text: O the happiness of that one, who Hath not walked in the counsel of the wicked. And in the way of sinners hath not stood, And in the seat of scorners hath not sat;
speaker: Narrator

text: But -- in the law of Jehovah [is] his delight, And in His law he doth meditate by day and by night:
speaker: Narrator

text: And he hath been as a tree, Planted by rivulets of water, That giveth its fruit in its season, And its leaf doth not wither, And all that he doth he causeth to prosper.
speaker: Narrator

text: Not so the wicked: But -- as chaff that wind driveth away!
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore the wicked rise not in judgment, Nor sinners in the company of the righteous,
speaker: Narrator

text: For Jehovah is knowing the way of the righteous, And the way of the wicked is lost!
speaker: Narrator

text: Why have nations tumultuously assembled? And do peoples meditate vanity?
speaker: Narrator

text: Station themselves do kings of the earth, And princes have been united together, Against Jehovah, and against His Messiah:
speaker: Narrator

text: `Let us draw off Their cords, And cast from us Their thick bands.'
speaker: Narrator

text: He who is sitting in the heavens doth laugh, The Lord doth mock at them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then doth He speak unto them in His anger, And in His wrath He doth trouble them:
speaker: Narrator

text: `And I -- I have anointed My King, Upon Zion -- My holy hill.'
speaker: Narrator

text: I declare concerning a statute: Jehovah said unto me, `My Son Thou [art], I to-day have brought thee forth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ask of Me and I give nations -- thy inheritance, And thy possession -- the ends of earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou dost rule them with a sceptre of iron, As a vessel of a potter Thou dost crush them.'
speaker: Narrator

text: And now, O kings, act wisely, Be instructed, O judges of earth,
speaker: Narrator

text: Serve ye Jehovah with fear, And rejoice with trembling.
speaker: Narrator

text: Kiss the Chosen One, lest He be angry, And ye lose the way, When His anger burneth but a little, O the happiness of all trusting in Him!
speaker: Narrator

text: A Psalm of David, in his fleeing from the face of Absalom his son. Jehovah, how have my distresses multiplied! Many are rising up against me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Many are saying of my soul, `There is no salvation for him in God.' Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Thou, O Jehovah, [art] a shield for me, My honour, and lifter up of my head.
speaker: Narrator

text: My voice [is] unto Jehovah: I call: And He answereth me from his holy hill, Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: I -- I have lain down, and I sleep, I have waked, for Jehovah sustaineth me.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am not afraid of myriads of people, That round about they have set against me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Rise, O Jehovah! save me, my God. Because Thou hast smitten All mine enemies [on] the cheek. The teeth of the wicked Thou hast broken.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of Jehovah [is] this salvation; On Thy people [is] Thy blessing! Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: To the Overseer with Stringed Instruments. -- A Psalm of David. In my calling answer Thou me, O God of my righteousness. In adversity Thou gavest enlargement to me; Favour me, and hear my prayer.
speaker: Narrator

text: Sons of men! till when [is] my glory for shame? Ye love a vain thing, ye seek a lie. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And know ye that Jehovah Hath separated a saintly one to Himself. Jehovah heareth in my calling to Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: `Tremble ye, and do not sin;' Say ye [thus] in your heart on your bed, And be ye silent. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Sacrifice ye sacrifices of righteousness, And trust ye unto Jehovah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Many are saying, `Who doth show us good?' Lift on us the light of Thy face, O Jehovah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast given joy in my heart, From the time their corn and their wine Have been multiplied.
speaker: Narrator

text: In peace together I lie down and sleep, For Thou, O Jehovah, alone, In confidence dost cause me to dwell!
speaker: Narrator

text: To the Overseer, `Concerning the Inheritances.' -- A Psalm of David. My sayings hear, O Jehovah, Consider my meditation.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be attentive to the voice of my cry, My king and my God, For unto Thee I pray habitually.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jehovah, [at] morning Thou hearest my voice, [At] morning I set in array for Thee, And I look out.
speaker: Narrator

text: For not a God desiring wickedness [art] Thou, Evil inhabiteth Thee not.
speaker: Narrator

text: The boastful station not themselves before Thine eyes: Thou hast hated all working iniquity.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou destroyest those speaking lies, A man of blood and deceit Jehovah doth abominate.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I, in the abundance of Thy kindness, I enter Thy house, I bow myself toward Thy holy temple in Thy fear.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Jehovah, lead me in Thy righteousness, Because of those observing me, Make straight before me Thy way,
speaker: Narrator

text: For there is no stability in their mouth. Their heart [is] mischiefs, An open grave [is] their throat, Their tongue they make smooth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Declare them guilty, O God, Let them fall from their own counsels, In the abundance of their transgressions Drive them away, Because they have rebelled against Thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: And rejoice do all trusting in Thee, To the age they sing, and Thou coverest them over, And those loving Thy name exult in Thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Thou blessest the righteous, O Jehovah, As a buckler with favour dost compass him!
speaker: Narrator

text: To the Overseer with stringed instruments, on the octave. -- A Psalm of David. O Jehovah, in Thine anger reprove me not, Nor in Thy fury chastise me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Favour me, O Jehovah, for I [am] weak, Heal me, O Jehovah, For troubled have been my bones,
speaker: Narrator

text: And my soul hath been troubled greatly, And Thou, O Jehovah, till when?
speaker: Narrator

text: Turn back, O Jehovah, draw out my soul, Save me for Thy kindness' sake.
speaker: Narrator

text: For there is not in death Thy memorial, In Sheol, who doth give thanks to Thee?
speaker: Narrator

text: I have been weary with my sighing, I meditate through all the night [on] my bed, With my tear my couch I waste.
speaker: Narrator

text: Old from provocation is mine eye, It is old because of all mine adversaries,
speaker: Narrator

text: Turn from me all ye workers of iniquity, For Jehovah heard the voice of my weeping,
speaker: Narrator

text: Jehovah hath heard my supplication, Jehovah my prayer receiveth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ashamed and troubled greatly are all mine enemies, They turn back -- ashamed [in] a moment!
speaker: Narrator

text: `The Erring One,' by David, that he sung to Jehovah concerning the words of Cush a Benjamite. O Jehovah, my God, in Thee I have trusted, Save me from all my pursuers, and deliver me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lest he tear as a lion my soul, Rending, and there is no deliverer.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Jehovah, my God, if I have done this, If there is iniquity in my hands,
speaker: Narrator

text: If I have done my well-wisher evil, And draw mine adversary without cause,
speaker: Narrator

text: An enemy pursueth my soul, and overtaketh, And treadeth down to the earth my life, And my honour placeth in the dust. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Rise, O Jehovah, in Thine anger, Be lifted up at the wrath of mine adversaries, And awake Thou for me: Judgment Thou hast commanded:
speaker: Narrator

text: And a company of peoples compass Thee, And over it on high turn Thou back,
speaker: Narrator

text: Jehovah doth judge the peoples; Judge me, O Jehovah, According to my righteousness, And according to mine integrity on me,
speaker: Narrator

text: Let, I pray Thee be ended the evil of the wicked, And establish Thou the righteous, And a trier of hearts and reins is the righteous God.
speaker: Narrator

text: My shield [is] on God, Saviour of the upright in heart!
speaker: Narrator

text: God [is] a righteous judge, And He is not angry at all times.
speaker: Narrator

text: If [one] turn not, His sword he sharpeneth, His bow he hath trodden -- He prepareth it,
speaker: Narrator

text: Yea, for him He hath prepared Instruments of death, His arrows for burning pursuers He maketh.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lo, he travaileth [with] iniquity, And he hath conceived perverseness, And hath brought forth falsehood.
speaker: Narrator

text: A pit he hath prepared, and he diggeth it, And he falleth into a ditch he maketh.
speaker: Narrator

text: Return doth his perverseness on his head, And on his crown his violence cometh down.
speaker: Narrator

text: I thank Jehovah, According to His righteousness, And praise the name of Jehovah Most High!
speaker: Narrator

text: To the Overseer, `On the Gittith.' A Psalm of David. Jehovah, our Lord, How honourable Thy name in all the earth! Who settest thine honour on the heavens.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the mouths of infants and sucklings Thou hast founded strength, Because of Thine adversaries, To still an enemy and a self-avenger.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I see Thy heavens, a work of Thy fingers, Moon and stars that Thou didst establish.
speaker: Narrator

text: What [is] man that Thou rememberest him? The son of man that Thou inspectest him?
speaker: Narrator

text: And causest him to lack a little of Godhead, And with honour and majesty compassest him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou dost cause him to rule Over the works of Thy hands, All Thou hast placed under his feet.
speaker: Narrator

text: Sheep and oxen, all of them, And also beasts of the field,
speaker: Narrator

text: Bird of the heavens, and fish of the sea, Passing through the paths of the seas!
speaker: Narrator

text: Jehovah, our Lord, How honourable Thy name in all the earth!
speaker: Narrator

text: To the Overseer, `On the Death of Labben.' -- A Psalm of David. I confess, O Jehovah, with all my heart, I recount all Thy wonders,
speaker: Narrator

text: I rejoice and exult in Thee, I praise Thy Name, O Most High.
speaker: Narrator

text: In mine enemies turning backward, they stumble and perish from Thy face.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Thou hast done my judgment and my right. Thou hast sat on a throne, A judge of righteousness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast rebuked nations, Thou hast destroyed the wicked, Their name Thou hast blotted out to the age and for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: O thou Enemy, Finished have been destructions for ever, As to cities thou hast plucked up, Perished hath their memorial with them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jehovah to the age abideth, He is preparing for judgment His throne.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He judgeth the world in righteousness, He judgeth the peoples in uprightness.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jehovah is a tower for the bruised, A tower for times of adversity.
speaker: Narrator

text: They trust in Thee who do know Thy name, For Thou hast not forsaken Those seeking Thee, O Jehovah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Sing ye praise to Jehovah, inhabiting Zion, Declare ye among the peoples His acts,
speaker: Narrator

text: For He who is seeking for blood Them hath remembered, He hath not forgotten the cry of the afflicted.
speaker: Narrator

text: Favour me, O Jehovah, See mine affliction by those hating me, Thou who liftest me up from the gates of death,
speaker: Narrator

text: So that I recount all Thy praise, In the gates of the daughter of Zion. I rejoice on Thy salvation.
speaker: Narrator

text: Sunk have nations in a pit they made, In a net that they hid hath their foot been captured.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jehovah hath been known, Judgment He hath done, By a work of his hands Hath the wicked been snared. Meditation. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: The wicked do turn back to Sheol, All nations forgetting God.
speaker: Narrator

text: For not for ever is the needy forgotten, The hope of the humble lost to the age.
speaker: Narrator

text: Rise, O Jehovah, let not man be strong, Let nations be judged before Thy face.
speaker: Narrator

text: Appoint, O Jehovah, a director to them, Let nations know they [are] men! Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Why, Jehovah, dost Thou stand at a distance? Thou dost hide in times of adversity,
speaker: Narrator

text: Through the pride of the wicked, Is the poor inflamed, They are caught in devices that they devised.
speaker: Narrator

text: Because the wicked hath boasted Of the desire of his soul, And a dishonest gainer he hath blessed, He hath despised Jehovah.
speaker: Narrator

text: The wicked according to the height of his face, inquireth not. `God is not!' [are] all his devices.
speaker: Narrator

text: Pain do his ways at all times, On high [are] Thy judgments before him, All his adversaries -- he puffeth at them.
speaker: Narrator

text: He hath said in his heart, `I am not moved,' To generation and generation not in evil.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of oaths his mouth is full, And deceits, and fraud: Under his tongue [is] perverseness and iniquity,
speaker: Narrator

text: He doth sit in an ambush of the villages, In secret places he doth slay the innocent. His eyes for the afflicted watch secretly,
speaker: Narrator

text: He lieth in wait in a secret place, as a lion in a covert. He lieth in wait to catch the poor, He catcheth the poor, drawing him into his net.
speaker: Narrator

text: He is bruised -- he boweth down, Fallen by his mighty ones hath the afflicted.
speaker: Narrator

text: He said in his heart, `God hath forgotten, He hath hid His face, He hath never seen.'
speaker: Narrator

text: Arise, O Jehovah! O God, lift up Thy hand! Forget not the humble.
speaker: Narrator

text: Wherefore hath the wicked despised God? He hath said in his heart, `It is not required.'
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast seen, For Thou perverseness and anger beholdest; By giving into Thy hand, On Thee doth the afflicted leave [it], Of the fatherless Thou hast been an helper.
speaker: Narrator

text: Break the arm of the wicked and the evil, Seek out his wickedness, find none;
speaker: Narrator

text: Jehovah [is] king to the age, and for ever, The nations have perished out of His land!
speaker: Narrator

text: The desire of the humble Thou hast heard, O Jehovah. Thou preparest their heart; Thou causest Thine ear to attend,
speaker: Narrator

text: To judge the fatherless and bruised: He addeth no more to oppress -- man of the earth!
speaker: Narrator

text: To the Overseer. -- By David. In Jehovah I trusted, how say ye to my soul, `They moved [to] Thy mountain for the bird?
speaker: Narrator

text: For lo, the wicked tread a bow, They have prepared their arrow on the string, To shoot in darkness at the upright in heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the foundations are destroyed, The righteous -- what hath he done?
speaker: Narrator

text: `Jehovah [is] in his holy temple: Jehovah -- in the heavens [is] His throne. His eyes see -- His eyelids try the sons of men.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jehovah the righteous doth try. And the wicked and the lover of violence, Hath His soul hated,
speaker: Narrator

text: He poureth on the wicked snares, fire, and brimstone, And a horrible wind [is] the portion of their cup.
speaker: Narrator

text: For righteous [is] Jehovah, Righteousness He hath loved, The upright doth His countenance see!'
speaker: Narrator

text: To the Overseer, on the octave. -- A Psalm of David. Save, Jehovah, for the saintly hath failed, For the stedfast have ceased From the sons of men:
speaker: Narrator

text: Vanity they speak each with his neighbour, Lip of flattery! With heart and heart they speak.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jehovah doth cut off all lips of flattery, A tongue speaking great things,
speaker: Narrator

text: Who said, `By our tongue we do mightily: Our lips [are] our own; who [is] lord over us?'
speaker: Narrator

text: Because of the spoiling of the poor, Because of the groaning of the needy, Now do I arise, saith Jehovah, I set in safety [him who] doth breathe for it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Sayings of Jehovah [are] pure sayings; Silver tried in a furnace of earth refined sevenfold.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou, O Jehovah, dost preserve them, Thou keepest us from this generation to the age.
speaker: Narrator

text: Around the wicked walk continually, According as vileness is exalted by sons of men!
speaker: Narrator

text: To the Overseer. -- A Psalm of David. Till when, O Jehovah, Dost Thou forget me? -- for ever? Till when dost Thou hide Thy face from me?
speaker: Narrator

text: Till when do I set counsels in my soul? Sorrow inn my heart daily? Till when is mine enemy exalted over me?
speaker: Narrator

text: Look attentively; Answer me, O Jehovah, my God, Enlighten mine eyes, lest I sleep in death,
speaker: Narrator

text: Lest mine enemy say, `I overcame him,' Mine adversaries joy when I am moved.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I, in Thy kindness I have trusted, Rejoice doth my heart in Thy salvation.
speaker: Narrator

text: I do sing to Jehovah, For He hath conferred benefits upon me!
speaker: Narrator

text: To the Overseer. -- By David. A fool hath said in his heart, `God is not;' They have done corruptly, They have done abominable actions, There is not a doer of good.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jehovah from the heavens Hath looked on the sons of men, To see if there is a wise one -- seeking God.
speaker: Narrator

text: The whole have turned aside, Together they have been filthy: There is not a doer of good, not even one.
speaker: Narrator

text: Have all working iniquity not known? Those consuming my people have eaten bread, Jehovah they have not called.
speaker: Narrator

text: There they have feared a fear, For God [is] in the generation of the righteous.
speaker: Narrator

text: The counsel of the poor ye cause to stink, Because Jehovah [is] his refuge.
speaker: Narrator

text: `Who doth give from Zion the salvation of Israel? When Jehovah doth turn back [To] a captivity of His people, Jacob doth rejoice -- Israel is glad!
speaker: Narrator

text: A Psalm of David. Jehovah, who doth sojourn in Thy tent? Who doth dwell in Thy holy hill?
speaker: Narrator

text: He who is walking uprightly, And working righteousness, And speaking truth in his heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: He hath not slandered by his tongue, He hath not done to his friend evil; And reproach he hath not lifted up Against his neighbour.
speaker: Narrator

text: Despised in his eyes [is] a rejected one, And those fearing Jehovah he doth honour. He hath sworn to suffer evil, and changeth not;
speaker: Narrator

text: His silver he hath not given in usury, And a bribe against the innocent Hath not taken; Whoso is doing these is not moved to the age!
speaker: Narrator

text: A Secret Treasure of David. Preserve me, O God, for I did trust in Thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast said to Jehovah, `My Lord Thou [art];' My good [is] not for thine own sake;
speaker: Narrator

text: For the holy ones who [are] in the land, And the honourable, all my delight [is] in them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Multiplied are their griefs, [Who] have hastened backward; I pour not out their libations of blood, Nor do I take up their names on my lips.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jehovah [is] the portion of my share, and of my cup, Thou -- Thou dost uphold my lot.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lines have fallen to me in pleasant places, Yea, a beauteous inheritance [is] for me.
speaker: Narrator

text: I bless Jehovah who hath counselled me; Also [in] the nights my reins instruct me.
speaker: Narrator

text: I did place Jehovah before me continually, Because -- at my right hand I am not moved.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore hath my heart been glad, And my honour doth rejoice, Also my flesh dwelleth confidently:
speaker: Narrator

text: For Thou dost not leave my soul to Sheol, Nor givest thy saintly one to see corruption.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou causest me to know the path of life; Fulness of joys [is] with Thy presence, Pleasant things by Thy right hand for ever!
speaker: Narrator

text: A Prayer of David. Hear, O Jehovah, righteousness, attend my cry, Give ear [to] my prayer, without lips of deceit.
speaker: Narrator

text: From before thee my judgment doth go out; Thine eyes do see uprightly.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast proved my heart, Thou hast inspected by night, Thou hast tried me, Thou findest nothing; My thoughts pass not over my mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text: As to doings of man, Through a word of Thy lips I have observed The paths of a destroyer;
speaker: Narrator

text: To uphold my goings in Thy paths, My steps have not slidden.
speaker: Narrator

text: I -- I called Thee, for Thou dost answer me, O God, incline Thine ear to me, hear my speech.
speaker: Narrator

text: Separate wonderfully Thy kindness, O Saviour of the confiding, By Thy right hand, from withstanders.
speaker: Narrator

text: Keep me as the apple, the daughter of the eye; In shadow of Thy wings thou dost hide me.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the face of the wicked who spoiled me. Mine enemies in soul go round against me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their fat they have closed up, Their mouths have spoken with pride:
speaker: Narrator

text: `Our steps now have compassed [him];' Their eyes they set to turn aside in the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: His likeness as a lion desirous to tear, As a young lion dwelling in secret places.
speaker: Narrator

text: Arise, O Jehovah, go before his face, Cause him to bend. Deliver my soul from the wicked, Thy sword,
speaker: Narrator

text: From men, Thy hand, O Jehovah, From men of the world, their portion [is] in life, And [with] Thy hidden things Thou fillest their belly, They are satisfied [with] sons; And have left their abundance to their sucklings.
speaker: Narrator

text: I -- in righteousness, I see Thy face; I am satisfied, in awaking, [with] Thy form!
speaker: Narrator

text: To the Overseer. -- By a servant of Jehovah, by David, who hath spoken to Jehovah the words of this song in the day Jehovah delivered him from the hand of all his enemies, and from the hand of Saul, and he saith: -- I love Thee, O Jehovah, my strength.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jehovah [is] my rock, and my bulwark, And my deliverer, My God [is] my rock, I trust in Him: My shield, and a horn of my salvation, My high tower.
speaker: Narrator

text: The `Praised One' I call Jehovah, And from my enemies I am saved.
speaker: Narrator

text: Compassed me have cords of death, And streams of the worthless make me afraid.
speaker: Narrator

text: Cords of Sheol have surrounded me, Before me have been snares of death.
speaker: Narrator

text: In mine adversity I call Jehovah, And unto my God I cry. He heareth from His temple my voice, And My cry before Him cometh into His ears.
speaker: Narrator

text: And shake and tremble doth the earth, And foundations of hills are troubled, And they shake -- because He hath wrath.
speaker: Narrator

text: Gone up hath smoke by His nostrils, And fire from His mouth consumeth, Coals have been kindled by it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He inclineth the heavens, and cometh down, And thick darkness [is] under His feet.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He rideth on a cherub, and doth fly, And He flieth on wings of wind.
speaker: Narrator

text: He maketh darkness His secret place, Round about Him His tabernacle, Darkness of waters, thick clouds of the skies.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the brightness over-against Him His thick clouds have passed on, Hail and coals of fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thunder in the heavens doth Jehovah, And the Most High giveth forth His voice, Hail and coals of fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He sendeth His arrows and scattereth them, And much lightning, and crusheth them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And seen are the streams of waters, And revealed are foundations of the earth. From Thy rebuke, O Jehovah, From the breath of the spirit of Thine anger.
speaker: Narrator

text: He sendeth from above -- He taketh me, He draweth me out of many waters.
speaker: Narrator

text: He delivereth me from my strong enemy, And from those hating me, For they have been stronger than I.
speaker: Narrator

text: They go before me in a day of my calamity And Jehovah is for a support to me.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He bringeth me forth to a large place, He draweth me out, because He delighted in me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jehovah doth recompense me According to my righteousness, According to the cleanness of my hands, He doth return to me.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I have kept the ways of Jehovah, And have not done wickedly against my God.
speaker: Narrator

text: For all His judgments [are] before me, And His statutes I turn not from me.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I am perfect with him, And I keep myself from mine iniquity.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jehovah doth return to me, According to my righteousness, According to the cleanness of my hands, Over-against his eyes.
speaker: Narrator

text: With the kind Thou showest Thyself kind, With a perfect man showest Thyself perfect.
speaker: Narrator

text: With the pure Thou showest Thyself pure, And with the perverse showest Thyself a wrestler,
speaker: Narrator

text: For Thou a poor people savest, And the eyes of the high causest to fall.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Thou -- Thou lightest my lamp, Jehovah my God enlighteneth my darkness.
speaker: Narrator

text: For by Thee I run -- a troop! And by my God I leap a wall.
speaker: Narrator

text: God! perfect [is] His way, The saying of Jehovah is tried, A shield [is] He to all those trusting in Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: For who [is] God besides Jehovah? And who [is] a rock save our God?
speaker: Narrator

text: God! who is girding me [with] strength, And He maketh perfect my way.
speaker: Narrator

text: Making my feet like hinds, And on my high places causeth me to stand.
speaker: Narrator

text: Teaching my hands for battle, And a bow of brass was brought down by my arms.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Thou givest to me the shield of Thy salvation, And Thy right hand doth support me, And Thy lowliness maketh me great.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou enlargest my step under me, And mine ankles have not slidden.
speaker: Narrator

text: I pursue mine enemies, and overtake them, And turn back not till they are consumed.
speaker: Narrator

text: I smite them, and they are not able to rise, They fall under my feet,
speaker: Narrator

text: And Thou girdest me [with] strength for battle, Causest my withstanders to bow under me.
speaker: Narrator

text: As to mine enemies -- Thou hast given to me the neck, As to those hating me -- I cut them off.
speaker: Narrator

text: They cry, and there is no saviour, On Jehovah, and He doth not answer them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I beat them as dust before wind, As mire of the streets I empty them out.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou dost deliver me From the strivings of the people, Thou placest me for a head of nations, A people I have not known do serve me.
speaker: Narrator

text: At the hearing of the ear they hearken to me, Sons of a stranger feign obedience to me,
speaker: Narrator

text: Sons of a stranger fade away, And are slain out of their close places.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jehovah liveth -- and blessed [is] my rock, And exalted is the God of my salvation.
speaker: Narrator

text: God -- who is giving vengeance to me, And He subdueth peoples under me,
speaker: Narrator

text: My deliverer from mine enemies, Above my withstanders Thou raisest me, From a man of violence dost deliver me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore I confess Thee among nations, O Jehovah, And to Thy name I sing praise,
speaker: Narrator

text: Magnifying the salvation of His king, And doing kindness to His anointed, To David, and to his seed -- unto the age!
speaker: Narrator

text: To the Overseer. -- A Psalm of David. The heavens [are] recounting the honour of God, And the work of His hands The expanse [is] declaring.
speaker: Narrator

text: Day to day uttereth speech, And night to night sheweth knowledge.
speaker: Narrator

text: There is no speech, and there are no words. Their voice hath not been heard.
speaker: Narrator

text: Into all the earth hath their line gone forth, And to the end of the world their sayings, For the sun He placed a tent in them,
speaker: Narrator

text: And he, as a bridegroom, goeth out from his covering, He rejoiceth as a mighty one To run the path.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the end of the heavens [is] his going out, And his revolution [is] unto their ends, And nothing is hid from his heat.
speaker: Narrator

text: The law of Jehovah [is] perfect, refreshing the soul, The testimonies of Jehovah [are] stedfast, Making wise the simple,
speaker: Narrator

text: The precepts of Jehovah [are] upright, Rejoicing the heart, The command of Jehovah [is] pure, enlightening the eyes,
speaker: Narrator

text: The fear of Jehovah [is] clean, standing to the age, The judgments of Jehovah [are] true, They have been righteous -- together.
speaker: Narrator

text: They are more desirable than gold, Yea, than much fine gold; and sweeter than honey, Even liquid honey of the comb.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also -- Thy servant is warned by them, `In keeping them [is] a great reward.'
speaker: Narrator

text: Errors! who doth understand? From hidden ones declare me innocent,
speaker: Narrator

text: Also -- from presumptuous ones keep back Thy servant, Let them not rule over me, Then am I perfect, And declared innocent of much transgression,
speaker: Narrator

text: Let the sayings of my mouth, And the meditation of my heart, Be for a pleasing thing before Thee, O Jehovah, my rock, and my redeemer!
speaker: Narrator

text: To the Overseer. -- A Psalm of David. Jehovah doth answer thee, In a day of adversity, The name of the God of Jacob doth set thee on high,
speaker: Narrator

text: He doth send thy help from the sanctuary, And from Zion doth support thee,
speaker: Narrator

text: He doth remember all thy presents, And thy burnt-offering doth reduce to ashes. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: He doth give to thee according to thy heart, And all thy counsel doth fulfil.
speaker: Narrator

text: We sing of thy salvation, And in the name of our God set up a banner. Jehovah doth fulfil all thy requests.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now I have known That Jehovah hath saved His anointed, He answereth him from His holy heavens, With the saving might of His right hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: Some of chariots, and some of horses, And we of the name of Jehovah our God Make mention.
speaker: Narrator

text: They -- they have bowed and have fallen, And we have risen and station ourselves upright.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Jehovah, save the king, He doth answer us in the day we call!
speaker: Narrator

text: To the Overseer. -- A Psalm of David. Jehovah, in Thy strength is the king joyful, In Thy salvation how greatly he rejoiceth.
speaker: Narrator

text: The desire of his heart Thou gavest to him, And the request of his lips Thou hast not withheld. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Thou puttest before him blessings of goodness, Thou settest on his head a crown of fine gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: Life he hath asked from Thee, Thou hast given to him -- length of days, Age-during -- and for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Great [is] his honour in Thy salvation, Honour and majesty Thou placest on him.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Thou makest him blessings for ever, Thou dost cause him to rejoice with joy, By Thy countenance.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the king is trusting in Jehovah, And in the kindness of the Most High He is not moved.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy hand cometh to all Thine enemies, Thy right hand doth find Thy haters.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou makest them as a furnace of fire, At the time of Thy presence. Jehovah in His anger doth swallow them, And fire doth devour them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their fruit from earth Thou destroyest, And their seed from the sons of men.
speaker: Narrator

text: For they stretched out against Thee evil, They devised a wicked device, they prevail not,
speaker: Narrator

text: For Thou makest them a butt, When Thy strings Thou preparest against their faces.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be Thou exalted, O Jehovah in, Thy strength, We sing and we praise Thy might!
speaker: Narrator

text: To the Overseer, on `The Hind of the Morning.' -- A Psalm of David. My God, my God, why hast Thou forsaken me? Far from my salvation, The words of my roaring?
speaker: Narrator

text: My God, I call by day, and Thou answerest not, And by night, and there is no silence to me.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Thou [art] holy, Sitting -- the Praise of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: In Thee did our fathers trust -- they trusted, And Thou dost deliver them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Unto Thee they cried, and were delivered, In Thee they trusted, and were not ashamed.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I [am] a worm, and no man, A reproach of man, and despised of the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: All beholding me do mock at me, They make free with the lip -- shake the head,
speaker: Narrator

text: `Roll unto Jehovah, He doth deliver him, He doth deliver him, for he delighted in him.'
speaker: Narrator

text: For thou [art] He bringing me forth from the womb, Causing me to trust, On the breasts of my mother.
speaker: Narrator

text: On Thee I have been cast from the womb, From the belly of my mother Thou [art] my God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be not far from me, For adversity is near, for there is no helper.
speaker: Narrator

text: Many bulls have surrounded me, Mighty ones of Bashan have compassed me,
speaker: Narrator

text: They have opened against me their mouth, A lion tearing and roaring.
speaker: Narrator

text: As waters I have been poured out, And separated themselves have all my bones, My heart hath been like wax, It is melted in the midst of my bowels.
speaker: Narrator

text: Dried up as an earthen vessel is my power, And my tongue is cleaving to my jaws.
speaker: Narrator

text: And to the dust of death thou appointest me, For surrounded me have dogs, A company of evil doers have compassed me, Piercing my hands and my feet.
speaker: Narrator

text: I count all my bones -- they look expectingly, They look upon me,
speaker: Narrator

text: They apportion my garments to themselves, And for my clothing they cause a lot to fall.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Thou, O Jehovah, be not far off, O my strength, to help me haste.
speaker: Narrator

text: Deliver from the sword my soul, From the paw of a dog mine only one.
speaker: Narrator

text: Save me from the mouth of a lion: -- And -- from the horns of the high places Thou hast answered me!
speaker: Narrator

text: I declare Thy name to my brethren, In the midst of the assembly I praise Thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye who fear Jehovah, praise ye Him, All the seed of Jacob, honour ye Him, And be afraid of Him, all ye seed of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: For He hath not despised, nor abominated, The affliction of the afflicted, Nor hath He hidden His face from him, And in his crying unto Him He heareth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of Thee my praise [is] in the great assembly. My vows I complete before His fearers.
speaker: Narrator

text: The humble do eat and are satisfied, Praise Jehovah do those seeking Him, Your heart doth live for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Remember and return unto Jehovah, Do all ends of the earth, And before Thee bow themselves, Do all families of the nations,
speaker: Narrator

text: For to Jehovah [is] the kingdom, And He is ruling among nations.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the fat ones of earth have eaten, And they bow themselves, Before Him bow do all going down to dust, And he [who] hath not revived his soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: A seed doth serve Him, It is declared of the Lord to the generation.
speaker: Narrator

text: They come and declare His righteousness, To a people that is borne, that He hath made!
speaker: Narrator

text: A Psalm of David. Jehovah [is] my shepherd, I do not lack,
speaker: Narrator

text: In pastures of tender grass He causeth me to lie down, By quiet waters He doth lead me.
speaker: Narrator

text: My soul He refresheth, He leadeth me in paths of righteousness, For His name's sake,
speaker: Narrator

text: Also -- when I walk in a valley of death-shade, I fear no evil, for Thou [art] with me, Thy rod and Thy staff -- they comfort me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou arrangest before me a table, Over-against my adversaries, Thou hast anointed with oil my head, My cup is full!
speaker: Narrator

text: Only -- goodness and kindness pursue me, All the days of my life, And my dwelling [is] in the house of Jehovah, For a length of days!
speaker: Narrator

text: A Psalm of David. To Jehovah [is] the earth and its fulness, The world and the inhabitants in it.
speaker: Narrator

text: For He on the seas hath founded it, And on the floods He doth establish it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who goeth up into the hill of Jehovah? And who riseth up in His holy place?
speaker: Narrator

text: The clean of hands, and pure of heart, Who hath not lifted up to vanity his soul, Nor hath sworn to deceit.
speaker: Narrator

text: He beareth away a blessing from Jehovah, Righteousness from the God of his salvation.
speaker: Narrator

text: This [is] a generation of those seeking Him. Seeking Thy face, O Jacob! Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lift up, O gates, your heads, And be lifted up, O doors age-during, And come in doth the king of glory!
speaker: Narrator

text: Who [is] this -- `the king of glory?' Jehovah -- strong and mighty, Jehovah, the mighty in battle.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lift up, O gates, your heads, And be lifted up, O doors age-during, And come in doth the king of glory!
speaker: Narrator

text: Who [is] He -- this `king of glory?' Jehovah of hosts -- He [is] the king of glory! Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: By David. Unto Thee, O Jehovah, my soul I lift up.
speaker: Narrator

text: My God, in Thee I have trusted, Let me not be ashamed, Let not mine enemies exult over me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also let none waiting on Thee be ashamed, Let the treacherous dealers without cause be ashamed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy ways, O Jehovah, cause me to know, Thy paths teach Thou me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Cause me to tread in Thy truth, and teach me, For Thou [art] the God of my salvation, Near Thee I have waited all the day.
speaker: Narrator

text: Remember Thy mercies, O Jehovah, And Thy kindnesses, for from the age [are] they.
speaker: Narrator

text: Sins of my youth, and my transgressions, Do not Thou remember. According to Thy kindness be mindful of me, For Thy goodness' sake, O Jehovah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Good and upright [is] Jehovah, Therefore He directeth sinners in the way.
speaker: Narrator

text: He causeth the humble to tread in judgment, And teacheth the humble His way.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the paths of Jehovah [are] kindness and truth, To those keeping His covenant, And His testimonies.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Thy name's sake, O Jehovah, Thou hast pardoned mine iniquity, for it [is] great.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who [is] this -- the man fearing Jehovah? He directeth him in the way He doth choose.
speaker: Narrator

text: His soul in good doth remain, And his seed doth possess the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: The secret of Jehovah [is] for those fearing Him, And His covenant -- to cause them to know.
speaker: Narrator

text: Mine eyes [are] continually unto Jehovah, For He bringeth out from a net my feet.
speaker: Narrator

text: Turn Thou unto me, and favour me, For lonely and afflicted [am] I.
speaker: Narrator

text: The distresses of my heart have enlarged themselves, From my distresses bring me out.
speaker: Narrator

text: See mine affliction and my misery, And bear with all my sins.
speaker: Narrator

text: See my enemies, for they have been many, And with violent hatred they have hated me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Keep my soul, and deliver me, Let me not be ashamed, for I trusted in Thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Integrity and uprightness do keep me, For I have waited [on] Thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Redeem Israel, O God, from all his distresses!
speaker: Narrator

text: By David. Judge me, O Jehovah, for I in mine integrity have walked, And in Jehovah I have trusted, I slide not.
speaker: Narrator

text: Try me, O Jehovah, and prove me, Purified [are] my reins and my heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Thy kindness [is] before mine eyes, And I have walked habitually in Thy truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have not sat with vain men, And with dissemblers I enter not.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have hated the assembly of evil doers, And with the wicked I sit not.
speaker: Narrator

text: I wash in innocency my hands, And I compass Thine altar, O Jehovah.
speaker: Narrator

text: To sound with a voice of confession, And to recount all Thy wonders.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jehovah, I have loved the habitation of Thy house, And the place of the tabernacle of Thine honour.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not gather with sinners my soul, And with men of blood my life,
speaker: Narrator

text: In whose hand [is] a wicked device, And their right hand [is] full of bribes.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I, in mine integrity I walk, Redeem me, and favour me.
speaker: Narrator

text: My foot hath stood in uprightness, In assemblies I bless Jehovah!
speaker: Narrator

text: By David. Jehovah [is] my light and my salvation, Whom do I fear? Jehovah [is] the strength of my life, Of whom am I afraid?
speaker: Narrator

text: When evil doers come near to me to eat my flesh, My adversaries and mine enemies to me, They have stumbled and fallen.
speaker: Narrator

text: Though a host doth encamp against me, My heart doth not fear, Though war riseth up against me, In this I [am] confident.
speaker: Narrator

text: One [thing] I asked of Jehovah -- it I seek. My dwelling in the house of Jehovah, All the days of my life, To look on the pleasantness of Jehovah, And to inquire in His temple.
speaker: Narrator

text: For He hideth me in a tabernacle in the day of evil, He hideth me in a secret place of His tent, On a rock he raiseth me up.
speaker: Narrator

text: And now, lifted up is my head, Above my enemies -- my surrounders, And I sacrifice in His tent sacrifices of shouting, I sing, yea, I sing praise to Jehovah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear, O Jehovah, my voice -- I call, And favour me, and answer me.
speaker: Narrator

text: To Thee said my heart `They sought my face, Thy face, O Jehovah, I seek.'
speaker: Narrator

text: Hide not Thy face from me, Turn not aside in anger Thy servant, My help Thou hast been. Leave me not, nor forsake me, O God of my salvation.
speaker: Narrator

text: When my father and my mother Have forsaken me, then doth Jehovah gather me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Shew me, O Jehovah, Thy way, And lead me in a path of uprightness, For the sake of my beholders.
speaker: Narrator

text: Give me not to the will of my adversaries, For risen against me have false witnesses, And they breathe out violence to me.
speaker: Narrator

text: I had not believed to look on the goodness of Jehovah In the land of the living!
speaker: Narrator

text: Look unto Jehovah -- be strong, And He doth strengthen thy heart, Yea, look unto Jehovah!
speaker: Narrator

text: By David. Unto Thee, O Jehovah, I call, My rock, be not silent to me! Lest Thou be silent to me, And I have been compared With those going down to the pit.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear the voice of my supplications, In my crying unto Thee, In my lifting up my hands toward thy holy oracle.
speaker: Narrator

text: Draw me not with the wicked, And with workers of iniquity, Speaking peace with their neighbours, And evil in their heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: Give to them according to their acting, And according to the evil of their doings. According to the work of their hands give to them. Return their deed to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: For they attend not to the doing of Jehovah, And unto the work of His hands. He throweth them down, And doth not build them up.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed [is] Jehovah, For He hath heard the voice of my supplications.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jehovah [is] my strength, and my shield, In Him my heart trusted, and I have been helped. And my heart exulteth, And with my song I thank Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jehovah [is] strength to him, Yea, the strength of the salvation of His anointed [is] He.
speaker: Narrator

text: Save Thy people, and bless Thine inheritance, And feed them, and carry them to the age!
speaker: Narrator

text: A Psalm of David. Ascribe to Jehovah, ye sons of the mighty, Ascribe to Jehovah honour and strength.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ascribe to Jehovah the honour of His name, Bow yourselves to Jehovah, In the beauty of holiness.
speaker: Narrator

text: The voice of Jehovah [is] on the waters, The God of glory hath thundered, Jehovah [is] on many waters.
speaker: Narrator

text: The voice of Jehovah [is] with power, The voice of Jehovah [is] with majesty,
speaker: Narrator

text: The voice of Jehovah [is] shivering cedars, Yea, Jehovah shivers the cedars of Lebanon.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He causeth them to skip as a calf, Lebanon and Sirion as a son of Reems,
speaker: Narrator

text: The voice of Jehovah is hewing fiery flames,
speaker: Narrator

text: The voice of Jehovah paineth a wilderness, Jehovah paineth the wilderness of Kadesh.
speaker: Narrator

text: The voice of Jehovah paineth the oaks, And maketh bare the forests, And in His temple every one saith, `Glory.'
speaker: Narrator

text: Jehovah on the deluge hath sat, And Jehovah sitteth king -- to the age,
speaker: Narrator

text: Jehovah strength to his people giveth, Jehovah blesseth His people with peace!
speaker: Narrator

text: A Psalm. -- A song of the dedication of the house of David. I exalt Thee, O Jehovah, For Thou hast drawn me up, and hast not let mine enemies rejoice over me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jehovah my God, I have cried to Thee, And Thou dost heal me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jehovah, Thou hast brought up from Sheol my soul, Thou hast kept me alive, From going down [to] the pit.
speaker: Narrator

text: Sing praise to Jehovah, ye His saints, And give thanks at the remembrance of His holiness,
speaker: Narrator

text: For -- a moment [is] in His anger, Life [is] in His good-will, At even remaineth weeping, and at morn singing.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I -- I have said in mine ease, `I am not moved -- to the age.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Jehovah, in Thy good pleasure, Thou hast caused strength to remain for my mountain,' Thou hast hidden Thy face -- I have been troubled.
speaker: Narrator

text: Unto Thee, O Jehovah, I call, And unto Jehovah I make supplication.
speaker: Narrator

text: `What gain [is] in my blood? In my going down unto corruption? Doth dust thank Thee? doth it declare Thy truth?
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear, O Jehovah, and favour me, O Jehovah, be a helper to me.'
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast turned my mourning to dancing for me, Thou hast loosed my sackcloth, And girdest me [with] joy.
speaker: Narrator

text: So that honour doth praise Thee, and is not silent, O Jehovah, my God, to the age I thank Thee!
speaker: Narrator

text: To the Overseer. -- A Psalm of David. In Thee, O Jehovah, I have trusted, Let me not be ashamed to the age, In Thy righteousness deliver me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Incline unto me Thine ear hastily, deliver me, Be to me for a strong rock, For a house of bulwarks to save me.
speaker: Narrator

text: For my rock and my bulwark [art] Thou, For Thy name's sake lead me and tend me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Bring me out from the net that they hid for me, For Thou [art] my strength.
speaker: Narrator

text: Into Thy hand I commit my spirit, Thou hast redeemed me, Jehovah God of truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have hated the observers of lying vanities, And I toward Jehovah have been confident.
speaker: Narrator

text: I rejoice, and am glad in Thy kindness, In that Thou hast seen mine affliction, Thou hast known in adversities my soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Thou hast not shut me up, Into the hand of an enemy, Thou hast caused my feet to stand in a broad place.
speaker: Narrator

text: Favour me, O Jehovah, for distress [is] to me, Mine eye, my soul, and my body Have become old by provocation.
speaker: Narrator

text: For my life hath been consumed in sorrow And my years in sighing. Feeble because of mine iniquity hath been my strength, And my bones have become old.
speaker: Narrator

text: Among all mine adversaries I have been a reproach, And to my neighbours exceedingly, And a fear to mine acquaintances, Those seeing me without -- fled from me.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have been forgotten as dead out of mind, I have been as a perishing vessel.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I have heard an evil account of many, Fear [is] round about. In their being united against me, To take my life they have devised,
speaker: Narrator

text: And I on Thee -- I have trusted, O Jehovah, I have said, `Thou [art] my God.'
speaker: Narrator

text: In Thy hand [are] my times, Deliver me from the hand of my enemies, And from my pursuers.
speaker: Narrator

text: Cause Thy face to shine on Thy servant, Save me in Thy kindness.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Jehovah, let me not be ashamed, For I have called Thee, let the wicked be ashamed, Let them become silent to Sheol.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let lips of falsehood become dumb, That are speaking against the righteous, Ancient sayings, in pride and contempt.
speaker: Narrator

text: How abundant is Thy goodness, That Thou hast laid up for those fearing Thee,
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast wrought for those trusting in Thee, Before sons of men. Thou hidest them in the secret place of Thy presence, From artifices of man, Thou concealest them in a tabernacle, From the strife of tongues.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed [is] Jehovah, For He hath made marvellous His kindness To me in a city of bulwarks.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I -- I have said in my haste, `I have been cut off from before Thine eyes,' But Thou hast heard the voice of my supplications, In my crying unto Thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Love Jehovah, all ye His saints, Jehovah is keeping the faithful, And recompensing abundantly a proud doer.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be strong, and He strengtheneth your heart, All ye who are waiting for Jehovah!
speaker: Narrator

text: By David. -- An Instruction. O the happiness of him whose transgression [is] forgiven, Whose sin is covered.
speaker: Narrator

text: O the happiness of a man, To whom Jehovah imputeth not iniquity, And in whose spirit there is no deceit.
speaker: Narrator

text: When I have kept silence, become old have my bones, Through my roaring all the day.
speaker: Narrator

text: When by day and by night Thy hand is heavy upon me, My moisture hath been changed Into the droughts of summer. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: My sin I cause Thee to know, And mine iniquity I have not covered. I have said, `I confess concerning My transgressions to Jehovah,' And Thou -- Thou hast taken away, The iniquity of my sin. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: For this doth every saintly one pray to Thee, As the time to find. Surely at an overflowing of many waters, Unto him they come not.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou [art] a hiding-place for me, From distress Thou dost keep me, [With] songs of deliverance dost compass me. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: I cause thee to act wisely, And direct thee in the way that thou goest, I cause mine eye to take counsel concerning thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be ye not as a horse -- as a mule, Without understanding, With bridle and bit, its ornaments, to curb, Not to come near unto thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Many [are] the pains of the wicked; As to him who is trusting in Jehovah, Kindness doth compass him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be glad in Jehovah, and rejoice, ye righteous, And sing, all ye upright of heart!
speaker: Narrator

text: Sing, ye righteous, in Jehovah, For upright ones praise [is] comely.
speaker: Narrator

text: Give ye thanks to Jehovah with a harp, With psaltery of ten strings sing praise to Him,
speaker: Narrator

text: Sing ye to Him a new song, Play skilfully with shouting.
speaker: Narrator

text: For upright [is] the word of Jehovah, And all His work [is] in faithfulness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Loving righteousness and judgment, Of the kindness of Jehovah is the earth full.
speaker: Narrator

text: By the word of Jehovah The heavens have been made, And by the breath of His mouth all their host.
speaker: Narrator

text: Gathering as a heap the waters of the sea, Putting in treasuries the depths.
speaker: Narrator

text: Afraid of Jehovah are all the earth, Of Him are all the inhabitants of the world afraid.
speaker: Narrator

text: For He hath said, and it is, He hath commanded, and it standeth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jehovah made void the counsel of nations, He disallowed the thoughts of the peoples.
speaker: Narrator

text: The counsel of Jehovah to the age standeth, The thoughts of His heart to all generations.
speaker: Narrator

text: O the happiness of the nation whose God [is] Jehovah, Of the people He did choose, For an inheritance to Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the heavens hath Jehovah looked, He hath seen all the sons of men.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the fixed place of His dwelling, He looked unto all inhabitants of the earth;
speaker: Narrator

text: Who is forming their hearts together, Who is attending unto all their works.
speaker: Narrator

text: The king is not saved by the multitude of a force. A mighty man is not delivered, By abundance of power.
speaker: Narrator

text: A false thing [is] the horse for safety, And by the abundance of his strength He doth not deliver.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lo, the eye of Jehovah [is] to those fearing Him, To those waiting for His kindness,
speaker: Narrator

text: To deliver from death their soul, And to keep them alive in famine.
speaker: Narrator

text: Our soul hath waited for Jehovah, Our help and our shield [is] He,
speaker: Narrator

text: For in Him doth our heart rejoice, For in His holy name we have trusted.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let Thy kindness, O Jehovah, be upon us, As we have waited for Thee!
speaker: Narrator

text: By David, in his changing his behaviour before Abimelech, and he driveth him away, and he goeth. I do bless Jehovah at all times, Continually His praise [is] in my mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text: In Jehovah doth my soul boast herself, Hear do the humble and rejoice.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ascribe ye greatness to Jehovah with me, And we exalt His name together.
speaker: Narrator

text: I sought Jehovah, and He answered me, And from all my fears did deliver me.
speaker: Narrator

text: They looked expectingly unto Him, And they became bright, And their faces are not ashamed.
speaker: Narrator

text: This poor [one] called, and Jehovah heard, And from all his distresses saved him.
speaker: Narrator

text: A messenger of Jehovah is encamping, Round about those who fear Him, And He armeth them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Taste ye and see that Jehovah [is] good, O the happiness of the man who trusteth in Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Fear Jehovah, ye His holy ones, For there is no lack to those fearing Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Young lions have lacked and been hungry, And those seeking Jehovah lack not any good,
speaker: Narrator

text: Come ye, children, hearken to me, The fear of Jehovah I do teach you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who [is] the man that is desiring life? Loving days to see good?
speaker: Narrator

text: Keep thy tongue from evil, And thy lips from speaking deceit.
speaker: Narrator

text: Turn aside from evil and do good, Seek peace and pursue it.
speaker: Narrator

text: The eyes of Jehovah [are] unto the righteous, And His ears unto their cry.
speaker: Narrator

text: (The face of Jehovah [is] on doers of evil, To cut off from earth their memorial.)
speaker: Narrator

text: They cried, and Jehovah heard, And from all their distresses delivered them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Near [is] Jehovah to the broken of heart, And the bruised of spirit He saveth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Many [are] the evils of the righteous, Out of them all doth Jehovah deliver him.
speaker: Narrator

text: He is keeping all his bones, One of them hath not been broken.
speaker: Narrator

text: Evil doth put to death the wicked, And those hating the righteous are desolate.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jehovah redeemeth the soul of His servants, And none trusting in Him are desolate!
speaker: Narrator

text: By David. Strive, Jehovah, with my strivers, fight with my fighters,
speaker: Narrator

text: Take hold of shield and buckler, and rise for my help,
speaker: Narrator

text: And draw out spear and lance, To meet my pursuers. Say to my soul, `Thy salvation I [am].'
speaker: Narrator

text: They are ashamed and blush, those seeking my soul, Turned backward and confounded, Those devising my evil.
speaker: Narrator

text: They are as chaff before wind, And a messenger of Jehovah driving away.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their way is darkness and slipperiness, And a messenger of Jehovah their pursuer.
speaker: Narrator

text: For without cause they hid for me their netpit, Without cause they digged for my soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: Meet him doth desolation -- he knoweth not, And his net that he hid catcheth him, For desolation he falleth into it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And my soul is joyful in Jehovah, It rejoiceth in His salvation.
speaker: Narrator

text: All my bones say, `Jehovah, who is like Thee, Delivering the poor from the stronger than he, And the poor and needy from his plunderer.'
speaker: Narrator

text: Violent witnesses rise up, That which I have not known they ask me.
speaker: Narrator

text: They pay me evil for good, bereaving my soul,
speaker: Narrator

text: And I -- in their sickness my clothing [is] sackcloth, I have humbled with fastings my soul, And my prayer unto my bosom returneth.
speaker: Narrator

text: As [if] a friend, as [if] my brother, I walked habitually, As a mourner for a mother, Mourning I have bowed down.
speaker: Narrator

text: And -- in my halting they have rejoiced, And have been gathered together, Gathered against me were the smiters, And I have not known, They have rent, and they have not ceased;
speaker: Narrator

text: With profane ones, mockers in feasts, Gnashing against me their teeth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lord, how long dost thou behold? Keep back my soul from their desolations, From young lions my only one.
speaker: Narrator

text: I thank Thee in a great assembly, Among a mighty people I praise Thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Mine enemies rejoice not over me [with] falsehood, Those hating me without cause wink the eye.
speaker: Narrator

text: For they speak not peace, And against the quiet of the land, Deceitful words they devise,
speaker: Narrator

text: And they enlarge against me their mouth, They said, `Aha, aha, our eye hath seen.'
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast seen, O Jehovah, Be not silent, O Lord -- be not far from me,
speaker: Narrator

text: Stir up, and wake to my judgment, My God, and my Lord, to my plea.
speaker: Narrator

text: Judge me according to Thy righteousness, O Jehovah my God, And they do not rejoice over me.
speaker: Narrator

text: They do not say in their heart, `Aha, our desire.' They do not say, `We swallowed him up.'
speaker: Narrator

text: They are ashamed and confounded together, Who are rejoicing at my evil. They put on shame and confusion, Who are magnifying themselves against me.
speaker: Narrator

text: They sing and rejoice, who are desiring my righteousness, And they say continually, `Jehovah is magnified, Who is desiring the peace of His servant.'
speaker: Narrator

text: And my tongue uttereth Thy righteousness, All the day Thy praise!
speaker: Narrator

text: To the Overseer. -- By a servant of Jehovah, by David. The transgression of the wicked Is affirming within my heart, `Fear of God is not before his eyes,
speaker: Narrator

text: For he made [it] smooth to himself in his eyes, To find his iniquity to be hated.
speaker: Narrator

text: The words of his mouth [are] iniquity and deceit, He ceased to act prudently -- to do good.
speaker: Narrator

text: Iniquity he deviseth on his bed, He stationeth himself on a way not good, Evil he doth not refuse.'
speaker: Narrator

text: O Jehovah, in the heavens [is] Thy kindness, Thy faithfulness [is] unto the clouds.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy righteousness [is] as mountains of God, Thy judgments [are] a great deep. Man and beast Thou savest, O Jehovah.
speaker: Narrator

text: How precious [is] Thy kindness, O God, And the sons of men In the shadow of Thy wings do trust.
speaker: Narrator

text: They are filled from the fatness of Thy house, And the stream of Thy delights Thou dost cause them to drink.
speaker: Narrator

text: For with Thee [is] a fountain of life, In Thy light we see light.
speaker: Narrator

text: Draw out Thy kindness to those knowing Thee, And Thy righteousness to the upright of heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let not a foot of pride meet me, And a hand of the wicked let not move me.
speaker: Narrator

text: There have workers of iniquity fallen, They have been overthrown, And have not been able to arise!
speaker: Narrator

text: By David. Do not fret because of evil doers, Be not envious against doers of iniquity,
speaker: Narrator

text: For as grass speedily they are cut off, And as the greenness of the tender grass do fade.
speaker: Narrator

text: Trust in Jehovah, and do good, Dwell [in] the land, and enjoy faithfulness,
speaker: Narrator

text: And delight thyself on Jehovah, And He giveth to thee the petitions of thy heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: Roll on Jehovah thy way, And trust upon Him, and He worketh,
speaker: Narrator

text: And hath brought out as light thy righteousness, And thy judgment as noon-day.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be silent for Jehovah, and stay thyself for Him, Do not fret because of him Who is making prosperous his way, Because of a man doing wicked devices.
speaker: Narrator

text: Desist from anger, and forsake fury, Fret not thyself only to do evil.
speaker: Narrator

text: For evil doers are cut off, As to those waiting on Jehovah, they possess the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: And yet a little, and the wicked is not, And thou hast considered his place, and it is not.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the humble do possess the land, And they have delighted themselves In the abundance of peace.
speaker: Narrator

text: The wicked is devising against the righteous, And gnashing against him his teeth.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord doth laugh at him, For He hath seen that his day cometh.
speaker: Narrator

text: A sword have the wicked opened, And they have trodden their bow, To cause to fall the poor and needy, To slaughter the upright of the way.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their sword doth enter into their own heart, And their bows are shivered.
speaker: Narrator

text: Better [is] the little of the righteous, Than the store of many wicked.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the arms of the wicked are shivered, And Jehovah is sustaining the righteous.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jehovah knoweth the days of the perfect, And their inheritance is -- to the age.
speaker: Narrator

text: They are not ashamed in a time of evil, And in days of famine they are satisfied.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the wicked perish, and the enemies of Jehovah, As the preciousness of lambs, Have been consumed, In smoke they have been consumed.
speaker: Narrator

text: The wicked is borrowing and repayeth not, And the righteous is gracious and giving.
speaker: Narrator

text: For His blessed ones do possess the land, And His reviled ones are cut off.
speaker: Narrator

text: From Jehovah [are] the steps of a man, They have been prepared, And his way he desireth.
speaker: Narrator

text: When he falleth, he is not cast down, For Jehovah is sustaining his hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: Young I have been, I have also become old, And I have not seen the righteous forsaken, And his seed seeking bread.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the day he is gracious and lending, And his seed [is] for a blessing.
speaker: Narrator

text: Turn aside from evil, and do good, and dwell to the age.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Jehovah is loving judgment, And He doth not forsake His saintly ones, To the age they have been kept, And the seed of the wicked is cut off.
speaker: Narrator

text: The righteous possess the land, And they dwell for ever on it.
speaker: Narrator

text: The mouth of the righteous uttereth wisdom, And his tongue speaketh judgment.
speaker: Narrator

text: The law of his God [is] his heart, His steps do not slide.
speaker: Narrator

text: The wicked is watching for the righteous, And is seeking to put him to death.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jehovah doth not leave him in his hand, Nor condemn him in his being judged.
speaker: Narrator

text: Look unto Jehovah, and keep His way, And He doth exalt thee to possess the land, In the wicked being cut off -- thou seest!
speaker: Narrator

text: I have seen the wicked terrible, And spreading as a green native plant,
speaker: Narrator

text: And he passeth away, and lo, he is not, And I seek him, and he is not found!
speaker: Narrator

text: Observe the perfect, and see the upright, For the latter end of each [is] peace.
speaker: Narrator

text: And transgressors were destroyed together, The latter end of the wicked was cut off.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the salvation of the righteous [is] from Jehovah, Their strong place in a time of adversity.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jehovah doth help them and deliver them, He delivereth them from the wicked, And saveth them, Because they trusted in Him!
speaker: Narrator

text: A Psalm of David, `To cause to remember.' Jehovah, in Thy wrath reprove me not, Nor in Thy fury chastise me.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Thine arrows have come down on me, And Thou lettest down upon me Thy hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: Soundness is not in my flesh, Because of Thine indignation, Peace is not in my bones because of my sin.
speaker: Narrator

text: For mine iniquities have passed over my head, As a heavy burden -- too heavy for me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Stunk -- become corrupt have my wounds, Because of my folly.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have been bent down, I have been bowed down -- unto excess, All the day I have gone mourning.
speaker: Narrator

text: For my flanks have been full of drought, And soundness is not in my flesh.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have been feeble and smitten -- unto excess, I have roared from disquietude of heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lord, before Thee [is] all my desire, And my sighing from Thee hath not been hid.
speaker: Narrator

text: My heart [is] panting, my power hath forsaken me, And the light of mine eyes, Even they are not with me.
speaker: Narrator

text: My lovers and my friends over-against my plague stand. And my neighbours afar off have stood.
speaker: Narrator

text: And those seeking my soul lay a snare, And those seeking my evil Have spoken mischievous things, And they do deceits meditate all the day.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I, as deaf, hear not. And as a dumb one who openeth not his mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yea, I am as a man who heareth not, And in his mouth are no reproofs.
speaker: Narrator

text: Because for Thee, O Jehovah, I have waited, Thou dost answer, O Lord my God.
speaker: Narrator

text: When I said, `Lest they rejoice over me, In the slipping of my foot against me they magnified themselves.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I am ready to halt, And my pain [is] before me continually.
speaker: Narrator

text: For mine iniquity I declare, I am sorry for my sin.
speaker: Narrator

text: And mine enemies [are] lively, They have been strong, and those hating me without cause, Have been multiplied.
speaker: Narrator

text: And those paying evil for good accuse me, Because of my pursuing good.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not forsake me, O Jehovah, My God, be not far from me,
speaker: Narrator

text: Haste to help me, O Lord, my salvation!
speaker: Narrator

text: To the Overseer, to Jeduthun. -- A Psalm of David. I have said, `I observe my ways, Against sinning with my tongue, I keep for my mouth a curb, while the wicked [is] before me.'
speaker: Narrator

text: I was dumb [with] silence, I kept silent from good, and my pain is excited.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hot [is] my heart within me, In my meditating doth the fire burn, I have spoken with my tongue.
speaker: Narrator

text: `Cause me to know, O Jehovah, mine end, And the measure of my days -- what it [is],' I know how frail I [am].
speaker: Narrator

text: Lo, handbreadths Thou hast made my days, And mine age [is] as nothing before Thee, Only, all vanity [is] every man set up. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Only, in an image doth each walk habitually, Only, [in] vain, they are disquieted, He heapeth up and knoweth not who gathereth them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And, now, what have I expected? O Lord, my hope -- it [is] of Thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: From all my transgressions deliver me, A reproach of the fool make me not.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have been dumb, I open not my mouth, Because Thou -- Thou hast done [it].
speaker: Narrator

text: Turn aside from off me Thy stroke, From the striving of Thy hand I have been consumed.
speaker: Narrator

text: With reproofs against iniquity, Thou hast corrected man, And dost waste as a moth his desirableness, Only, vanity [is] every man. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear my prayer, O Jehovah, And [to] my cry give ear, Unto my tear be not silent, For a sojourner I [am] with Thee, A settler like all my fathers.
speaker: Narrator

text: Look from me, and I brighten up before I go and am not!
speaker: Narrator

text: To the Overseer. -- A Psalm of David. I have diligently expected Jehovah, And He inclineth to me, and heareth my cry,
speaker: Narrator

text: And He doth cause me to come up From a pit of desolation -- from mire of mud, And He raiseth up on a rock my feet, He is establishing my steps.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He putteth in my mouth a new song, `Praise to our God.' Many do see and fear, and trust in Jehovah.
speaker: Narrator

text: O the happiness of the man Who hath made Jehovah his trust, And hath not turned unto the proud, And those turning aside to lies.
speaker: Narrator

text: Much hast Thou done, Jehovah my God; Thy wonders and Thy thoughts toward us, There is none to arrange unto Thee, I declare and speak: They have been more than to be numbered.
speaker: Narrator

text: Sacrifice and present Thou hast not desired, Ears Thou hast prepared for me, Burnt and sin-offering Thou hast not asked.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then said I, `Lo, I have come,' In the roll of the book it is written of me,
speaker: Narrator

text: To do Thy pleasure, my God, I have delighted, And Thy law [is] within my heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have proclaimed tidings of righteousness In the great assembly, lo, my lips I restrain not, O Jehovah, Thou hast known.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy righteousness I have not concealed In the midst of my heart, Thy faithfulness and Thy salvation I have told, I have not hidden Thy kindness and Thy truth, To the great assembly.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou, O Jehovah, restrainest not Thy mercies from me, Thy kindness and Thy truth do continually keep me.
speaker: Narrator

text: For compassed me have evils innumerable, Overtaken me have mine iniquities, And I have not been able to see; They have been more than the hairs of my head, And my heart hath forsaken me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be pleased, O Jehovah, to deliver me, O Jehovah, for my help make haste.
speaker: Narrator

text: They are ashamed and confounded together, Who are seeking my soul to destroy it, They are turned backward, And are ashamed, who are desiring my evil.
speaker: Narrator

text: They are desolate because of their shame, Who are saying to me, `Aha, aha.'
speaker: Narrator

text: All seeking Thee rejoice and are glad in Thee, Those loving Thy salvation say continually, `Jehovah is magnified.'
speaker: Narrator

text: And I [am] poor and needy, The Lord doth devise for me. My help and my deliverer [art] Thou, O my God, tarry Thou not.
speaker: Narrator

text: To the Overseer. -- A Psalm of David. O the happiness of him Who is acting wisely unto the poor, In a day of evil doth Jehovah deliver him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jehovah doth preserve him and revive him, He is happy in the land, And Thou givest him not into the will of his enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jehovah supporteth on a couch of sickness, All his bed Thou hast turned in his weakness.
speaker: Narrator

text: I -- I said, `O Jehovah, favour me, Heal my soul, for I did sin against Thee,'
speaker: Narrator

text: Mine enemies say evil of me: When he dieth -- his name hath perished!
speaker: Narrator

text: And if he came to see -- vanity he speaketh, His heart gathereth iniquity to itself, He goeth out -- at the street he speaketh.
speaker: Narrator

text: All hating me whisper together against me, Against me they devise evil to me:
speaker: Narrator

text: A thing of Belial is poured out on him, And because he lay down he riseth not again.
speaker: Narrator

text: Even mine ally, in whom I trusted, One eating my bread, made great the heel against me,
speaker: Narrator

text: And Thou, Jehovah, favour me, And cause me to rise, And I give recompence to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: By this I have known, That Thou hast delighted in me, Because my enemy shouteth not over me.
speaker: Narrator

text: As to me, in mine integrity, Thou hast taken hold upon me, And causest me to stand before Thee to the age.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed [is] Jehovah, God of Israel, From the age -- and unto the age. Amen and Amen.
speaker: Narrator

text: To the Overseer. -- An Instruction. By sons of Korah. As a hart doth pant for streams of water, So my soul panteth toward Thee, O God.
speaker: Narrator

text: My soul thirsted for God, for the living God, When do I enter and see the face of God?
speaker: Narrator

text: My tear hath been to me bread day and night, In their saying unto me all the day, `Where [is] thy God?'
speaker: Narrator

text: These I remember, and pour out my soul in me, For I pass over into the booth, I go softly with them unto the house of God, With the voice of singing and confession, The multitude keeping feast!
speaker: Narrator

text: What! bowest thou thyself, O my soul? Yea, art thou troubled within me? Wait for God, for still I confess Him: The salvation of my countenance -- My God!
speaker: Narrator

text: In me doth my soul bow itself, Therefore I remember Thee from the land of Jordan, And of the Hermons, from the hill Mizar.
speaker: Narrator

text: Deep unto deep is calling At the noise of Thy water-spouts, All Thy breakers and Thy billows passed over me.
speaker: Narrator

text: By day Jehovah commandeth His kindness, And by night a song [is] with me, A prayer to the God of my life.
speaker: Narrator

text: I say to God my rock, `Why hast Thou forgotten me? Why go I mourning in the oppression of an enemy?
speaker: Narrator

text: With a sword in my bones Have mine adversaries reproached me, In their saying unto me all the day, `Where [is] thy God?'
speaker: Narrator

text: What! bowest thou thyself, O my soul? And what! art thou troubled within me? Wait for God, for still I confess Him, The salvation of my countenance, and my God!
speaker: Narrator

text: Judge me, O God, And plead my cause against a nation not pious, From a man of deceit and perverseness Thou dost deliver me,
speaker: Narrator

text: For thou [art] the God of my strength. Why hast Thou cast me off? Why mourning do I go up and down, In the oppression of an enemy?
speaker: Narrator

text: Send forth Thy light and Thy truth, They -- they lead me, they bring me in, Unto Thy holy hill, and unto Thy tabernacles.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I go in unto the altar of God, Unto God, the joy of my rejoicing. And I thank Thee with a harp, O God, my God.
speaker: Narrator

text: What! bowest thou thyself, O my soul? And what! art thou troubled within me? Wait for God, for still I confess Him, The salvation of my countenance, and my God!
speaker: Narrator

text: To the Overseer. -- By sons of Korah. An Instruction. O God, with our ears we have heard, Our fathers have recounted to us, The work Thou didst work in their days, In the days of old.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou, [with] Thy hand, nations hast dispossessed. And Thou dost plant them. Thou afflictest peoples, and sendest them away.
speaker: Narrator

text: For, not by their sword Possessed they the land, And their arm gave not salvation to them, But Thy right hand, and Thine arm, And the light of Thy countenance, Because Thou hadst accepted them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou [art] He, my king, O God, Command the deliverances of Jacob.
speaker: Narrator

text: By Thee our adversaries we do push, By Thy name tread down our withstanders,
speaker: Narrator

text: For, not in my bow do I trust, And my sword doth not save me.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Thou hast saved us from our adversaries, And those hating us Thou hast put to shame.
speaker: Narrator

text: In God we have boasted all the day, And Thy name to the age we thank. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: In anger Thou hast cast off and causest us to blush, And goest not forth with our hosts.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou causest us to turn backward from an adversary, And those hating us, Have spoiled for themselves.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou makest us food like sheep, And among nations Thou hast scattered us.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou sellest Thy people -- without wealth, And hast not become great by their price.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou makest us a reproach to our neighbours, A scorn and a reproach to our surrounders.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou makest us a simile among nations, A shaking of the head among peoples.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the day my confusion [is] before me, And the shame of my face hath covered me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Because of the voice of a reproacher and reviler, Because of an enemy and a self-avenger.
speaker: Narrator

text: All this met us, and we did not forget Thee, Nor have we dealt falsely in Thy covenant.
speaker: Narrator

text: We turn not backward our heart, Nor turn aside doth our step from Thy path.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Thou hast smitten us in a place of dragons, And dost cover us over with death-shade.
speaker: Narrator

text: If we have forgotten the name of our God, And spread our hands to a strange God,
speaker: Narrator

text: Doth not God search out this? For He knoweth the secrets of the heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: Surely, for Thy sake we have been slain all the day, Reckoned as sheep of the slaughter.
speaker: Narrator

text: Stir up -- why dost Thou sleep, O Lord? Awake, cast us not off for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Why Thy face hidest Thou? Thou forgettest our afflictions and our oppression,
speaker: Narrator

text: For bowed to the dust hath our soul, Cleaved to the earth hath our belly.
speaker: Narrator
