text: Arise, a help to us, And ransom us for thy kindness' sake.
speaker: Narrator

text: To the Overseer. -- `On the Lilies.' -- By sons of Korah. -- An Instruction. -- A song of loves. My heart hath indited a good thing, I am telling my works to a king, My tongue [is] the pen of a speedy writer.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast been beautified above the sons of men, Grace hath been poured into thy lips, Therefore hath God blessed thee to the age.
speaker: Narrator

text: Gird Thy sword upon the thigh, O mighty, Thy glory and Thy majesty!
speaker: Narrator

text: As to Thy majesty -- prosper! -- ride! Because of truth, and meekness -- righteousness, And Thy right hand showeth Thee fearful things.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thine arrows [are] sharp, -- Peoples fall under Thee -- In the heart of the enemies of the king.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy throne, O God, [is] age-during, and for ever, A sceptre of uprightness [Is] the sceptre of Thy kingdom.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast loved righteousness and hatest wickedness, Therefore God, thy God, hath anointed thee, Oil of joy above thy companions.
speaker: Narrator

text: Myrrh and aloes, cassia! all thy garments, Out of palaces of ivory Stringed instruments have made thee glad.
speaker: Narrator

text: Daughters of kings [are] among thy precious ones, A queen hath stood at thy right hand, In pure gold of Ophir.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hearken, O daughter, and see, incline thine ear, And forget thy people, and thy father's house,
speaker: Narrator

text: And the king doth desire thy beauty, Because he [is] thy lord -- bow thyself to him,
speaker: Narrator

text: And the daughter of Tyre with a present, The rich of the people do appease thy face.
speaker: Narrator

text: All glory [is] the daughter of the king within, Of gold-embroidered work [is] her clothing.
speaker: Narrator

text: In divers colours she is brought to the king, Virgins -- after her -- her companions, Are brought to thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: They are brought with joy and gladness, They come into the palace of the king.
speaker: Narrator

text: Instead of thy fathers are thy sons, Thou dost appoint them for princes in all the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: I make mention of Thy name in all generations, Therefore do peoples praise Thee, To the age, and for ever!
speaker: Narrator

text: To the Overseer. -- By sons of Korah. `For the Virgins.' -- A song. God [is] to us a refuge and strength, A help in adversities found most surely.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore we fear not in the changing of earth, And in the slipping of mountains Into the heart of the seas.
speaker: Narrator

text: Roar -- troubled are its waters, Mountains they shake in its pride. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: A river -- its rivulets rejoice the city of God, Thy holy place of the tabernacles of the Most High.
speaker: Narrator

text: God [is] in her midst -- she is not moved, God doth help her at the turn of the morn!
speaker: Narrator

text: Troubled have been nations, Moved have been kingdoms, He hath given forth with His voice, earth melteth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jehovah of Hosts [is] with us, A tower for us [is] the God of Jacob. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Come ye, see the works of Jehovah, Who hath done astonishing things in the earth,
speaker: Narrator

text: Causing wars to cease, Unto the end of the earth, the bow he shivereth, And the spear He hath cut asunder, Chariots he doth burn with fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: Desist, and know that I [am] God, I am exalted among nations, I am exalted in the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jehovah of hosts [is] with us, A tower for us [is] the God of Jacob! Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: To the Overseer. -- By sons of Korah. A Psalm. All ye peoples, clap the hand, Shout to God with a voice of singing,
speaker: Narrator

text: For Jehovah Most High [is] fearful, A great king over all the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: He leadeth peoples under us, and nations under our feet.
speaker: Narrator

text: He doth choose for us our inheritance, The excellency of Jacob that He loves. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: God hath gone up with a shout, Jehovah with the sound of a trumpet.
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise God -- praise -- give praise to our king, praise.
speaker: Narrator

text: For king of all the earth [is] God, Give praise, O understanding one.
speaker: Narrator

text: God hath reigned over nations, God hath sat on His holy throne,
speaker: Narrator

text: Nobles of peoples have been gathered, [With] the people of the God of Abraham, For to God [are] the shields of earth, Greatly hath He been exalted!
speaker: Narrator

text: A Song, a Psalm, by sons of Korah. Great [is] Jehovah, and praised greatly, In the city of our God -- His holy hill.
speaker: Narrator

text: Beautiful [for] elevation, A joy of all the land, [is] Mount Zion, The sides of the north, the city of a great king.
speaker: Narrator

text: God in her high places is known for a tower.
speaker: Narrator

text: For, lo, the kings met, they passed by together,
speaker: Narrator

text: They have seen -- so they have marvelled, They have been troubled, they were hastened away.
speaker: Narrator

text: Trembling hath seized them there, Pain, as of a travailing woman.
speaker: Narrator

text: By an east wind Thou shiverest ships of Tarshish.
speaker: Narrator

text: As we have heard, so we have seen, In the city of Jehovah of hosts, In the city of our God, God doth establish her -- to the age. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: We have thought, O God, of Thy kindness, In the midst of Thy temple,
speaker: Narrator

text: As [is] Thy name, O God, so [is] Thy praise, Over the ends of the earth, Righteousness hath filled Thy right hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: Rejoice doth Mount Zion, The daughters of Judah are joyful, For the sake of Thy judgments.
speaker: Narrator

text: Compass Zion, and go round her, count her towers,
speaker: Narrator

text: Set your heart to her bulwark, Consider her high places, So that ye recount to a later generation,
speaker: Narrator

text: That this God [is] our God -- To the age and for ever, He -- he doth lead us over death!
speaker: Narrator

text: To the Overseer. -- By sons of Korah. A Psalm. Hear this, all ye peoples, Give ear, all ye inhabitants of the world.
speaker: Narrator

text: Both low and high, together rich and needy.
speaker: Narrator

text: My mouth speaketh wise things, And the meditations of my heart [are] things of understanding.
speaker: Narrator

text: I incline to a simile mine ear, I open with a harp my riddle:
speaker: Narrator

text: Why do I fear in days of evil? The iniquity of my supplanters doth compass me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those trusting on their wealth, And in the multitude of their riches, Do shew themselves foolish.
speaker: Narrator

text: A brother doth no one at all ransom, He doth not give to God his atonement.
speaker: Narrator

text: And precious [is] the redemption of their soul, And it hath ceased -- to the age.
speaker: Narrator

text: And still he liveth for ever, He seeth not the pit.
speaker: Narrator

text: For he seeth wise men die, Together the foolish and brutish perish, And have left to others their wealth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their heart [is]: Their houses [are] to the age, Their tabernacles to all generations. They proclaimed their names over the lands.
speaker: Narrator

text: And man in honour doth not remain, He hath been like the beasts, they have been cut off.
speaker: Narrator

text: This their way [is] folly for them, And their posterity with their sayings are pleased. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: As sheep for Sheol they have set themselves, Death doth afflict them, And the upright rule over them in the morning, And their form [is] for consumption. Sheol [is] a dwelling for him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Only, God doth ransom my soul from the hand of Sheol, For He doth receive me. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Fear not, when one maketh wealth, When the honour of his house is abundant,
speaker: Narrator

text: For at his death he receiveth nothing, His honour goeth not down after him.
speaker: Narrator

text: For his soul in his life he blesseth, (And they praise thee when thou dost well for thyself.)
speaker: Narrator

text: It cometh to the generation of his fathers, For ever they see not the light.
speaker: Narrator

text: Man in honour, who understandest not, Hath been like the beasts, they have been cut off!
speaker: Narrator

text: A Psalm of Asaph. The God of gods -- Jehovah -- hath spoken, And He calleth to the earth From the rising of the sun unto its going in.
speaker: Narrator

text: From Zion, the perfection of beauty, God shone.
speaker: Narrator

text: Our God cometh, and is not silent, Fire before Him doth devour, And round about him it hath been very tempestuous.
speaker: Narrator

text: He doth call unto the heavens from above, And unto the earth, to judge His people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Gather ye to Me My saints, Making covenant with Me over a sacrifice.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the heavens declare His righteousness, For God Himself [is] judge. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear, O My people, and I speak, O Israel, and I testify against thee, God, thy God [am] I.
speaker: Narrator

text: Not for thy sacrifices do I reprove thee, Yea, thy burnt-offerings [Are] before Me continually.
speaker: Narrator

text: I take not from thy house a bullock, From thy folds he goats.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Mine [is] every beast of the forest, The cattle on the hills of oxen.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have known every fowl of the mountains, And the wild beast of the field [is] with Me.
speaker: Narrator

text: If I am hungry I tell not to thee, For Mine [is] the world and its fulness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do I eat the flesh of bulls, And drink the blood of he-goats?
speaker: Narrator

text: Sacrifice to God confession, And complete to the Most High thy vows.
speaker: Narrator

text: And call Me in a day of adversity, I deliver thee, and thou honourest Me.
speaker: Narrator

text: And to the wicked hath God said: What to thee -- to recount My statutes? That thou liftest up My covenant on thy mouth?
speaker: Narrator

text: Yea, thou hast hated instruction, And dost cast My words behind thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: If thou hast seen a thief, Then thou art pleased with him, And with adulterers [is] thy portion.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy mouth thou hast sent forth with evil, And thy tongue joineth deceit together,
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou sittest, against thy brother thou speakest, Against a son of thy mother givest slander.
speaker: Narrator

text: These thou didst, and I kept silent, Thou hast thought that I am like thee, I reprove thee, and set in array before thine eyes.
speaker: Narrator

text: Understand this, I pray you, Ye who are forgetting God, Lest I tear, and there is no deliverer.
speaker: Narrator

text: He who is sacrificing praise honoureth Me, As to him who maketh a way, I cause him to look on the salvation of God!
speaker: Narrator

text: To the Overseer. -- A Psalm of David, in the coming inn unto him of Nathan the prophet, when he hath gone in unto Bath-Sheba. Favour me, O God, according to Thy kindness, According to the abundance of Thy mercies, Blot out my transgressions.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thoroughly wash me from mine iniquity, And from my sin cleanse me,
speaker: Narrator

text: For my transgressions I do know, And my sin [is] before me continually.
speaker: Narrator

text: Against Thee, Thee only, I have sinned, And done the evil thing in Thine eyes, So that Thou art righteous in Thy words, Thou art pure in Thy judging.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lo, in iniquity I have been brought forth, And in sin doth my mother conceive me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lo, truth Thou hast desired in the inward parts, And in the hidden part Wisdom Thou causest me to know.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou cleansest me with hyssop and I am clean, Washest me, and than snow I am whiter.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou causest me to hear joy and gladness, Thou makest joyful bones Thou hast bruised.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hide Thy face from my sin. And all mine iniquities blot out.
speaker: Narrator

text: A clean heart prepare for me, O God, And a right spirit renew within me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Cast me not forth from Thy presence, And Thy Holy Spirit take not from me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Restore to me the joy of Thy salvation, And a willing spirit doth sustain me.
speaker: Narrator

text: I teach transgressors Thy ways, And sinners unto Thee do return.
speaker: Narrator

text: Deliver me from blood, O God, God of my salvation, My tongue singeth of Thy righteousness.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord, my lips thou dost open, And my mouth declareth Thy praise.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Thou desirest not sacrifice, or I give [it], Burnt-offering Thou acceptest not.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sacrifices of God [are] a broken spirit, A heart broken and bruised, O God, Thou dost not despise.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do good in Thy good pleasure with Zion, Thou dost build the walls of Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Thou desirest sacrifices of righteousness, Burnt-offering, and whole burnt-offering, Then they offer bullocks on thine altar!
speaker: Narrator

text: To the Overseer. -- An instruction, by David, in the coming in of Doeg the Edomite, and he declareth to Saul, and saith to him, `David came in unto the house of Ahimelech.' What, boasteth thou in evil, O mighty one? The kindness of God [is] all the day.
speaker: Narrator

text: Mischiefs doth thy tongue devise, Like a sharp razor, working deceit.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast loved evil rather than good, Lying, than speaking righteousness. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast loved all devouring words, O thou deceitful tongue.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also -- God doth break thee down for ever, Taketh thee, and pulleth thee out of the tent, And He hath uprooted thee Out of the land of the living. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the righteous see, And fear, and laugh at him.
speaker: Narrator

text: `Lo, the man who maketh not God his strong place, And trusteth in the abundance of his riches, He is strong in his mischiefs.'
speaker: Narrator

text: And I, as a green olive in the house of God, I have trusted in the kindness of God, To the age and for ever,
speaker: Narrator

text: I thank Thee to the age, because Thou hast done [it], And I wait [on] Thy name for [it is] good before Thy saints!
speaker: Narrator

text: To the Overseer. -- `On a disease.' -- An instruction, by David. A fool said in his heart, `There is no God.' They have done corruptly, Yea, they have done abominable iniquity, There is none doing good.
speaker: Narrator

text: God from the heavens looked on the sons of men, To see if there be an understanding one, [One] seeking God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Every one went back, together they became filthy, There is none doing good -- not even one.
speaker: Narrator

text: Have not workers of iniquity known, Those eating my people have eaten bread, God they have not called.
speaker: Narrator

text: There they feared a fear -- there was no fear, For God hath scattered the bones of him Who is encamping against thee, Thou hast put to shame, For God hath despised them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who doth give from Zion the salvation of Israel? When God turneth back [to] a captivity of His people, Jacob doth rejoice -- Israel is glad!
speaker: Narrator

text: To the Overseer with stringed instruments. -- An instruction, by David, in the coming in of the Ziphim, and they say to Saul, `Is not David hiding himself with us?' O God, by Thy name save me, and by Thy might judge me.
speaker: Narrator

text: O God, hear my prayer, Give ear to the sayings of my mouth,
speaker: Narrator

text: For strangers have risen up against me And terrible ones have sought my soul, They have not set God before them. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lo, God [is] a helper to me, The Lord [is] with those supporting my soul,
speaker: Narrator

text: Turn back doth the evil thing to mine enemies, In Thy truth cut them off.
speaker: Narrator

text: With a free will-offering I sacrifice to Thee, I thank Thy name, O Jehovah, for [it is] good,
speaker: Narrator

text: For, from all adversity He delivered me, And on mine enemies hath mine eye looked!
speaker: Narrator

text: To the Overseer with stringed instruments. -- An instruction, by David. Give ear, O God, [to] my prayer, And hide not from my supplication.
speaker: Narrator

text: Attend to me, and answer me, I mourn in my meditation, and make a noise,
speaker: Narrator

text: Because of the voice of an enemy, Because of the oppression of the wicked, For they cause sorrow to move against me, And in anger they hate me.
speaker: Narrator

text: My heart is pained within me, And terrors of death have fallen on me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Fear and trembling come in to me, And horror doth cover me.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I say, `Who doth give to me a pinion as a dove? I fly away and rest,
speaker: Narrator

text: Lo, I move far off, I lodge in a wilderness. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: I hasten escape for myself, From a rushing wind, from a whirlwind.
speaker: Narrator

text: Swallow up, O Lord, divide their tongue, For I saw violence and strife in a city.
speaker: Narrator

text: By day and by night they go round it, on its walls. Both iniquity and perverseness [are] in its midst,
speaker: Narrator

text: Mischiefs [are] in its midst. Fraud and deceit depart not from its street.
speaker: Narrator

text: For an enemy reproacheth me not, or I bear [it], He who is hating me Hath not magnified himself against me, Or I hide from him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But thou, a man -- as mine equal, My familiar friend, and mine acquaintance.
speaker: Narrator

text: When together we sweeten counsel, Into the house of God we walk in company.
speaker: Narrator

text: Desolations [are] upon them, They go down [to] Sheol -- alive, For wickedness [is] in their dwelling, in their midst.
speaker: Narrator

text: I -- to God I call, and Jehovah saveth me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Evening, and morning, and noon, I meditate, and make a noise, and He heareth my voice,
speaker: Narrator

text: He hath ransomed in peace my soul From him who is near to me, For with the multitude they were with me.
speaker: Narrator

text: God doth hear and afflict them, And He sitteth of old. Selah. Because they have no changes, and fear not God,
speaker: Narrator

text: He hath sent forth his hands against his well-wishers, He hath polluted his covenant.
speaker: Narrator

text: Sweeter than honey hath been his mouth, And his heart [is] war! Softer have been his words than oil, And they [are] drawn [swords].
speaker: Narrator

text: Cast on Jehovah that which He hath given thee, And He doth sustain thee, He doth not suffer for ever the moving of the righteous.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Thou, O God, dost bring them down To a pit of destruction, Men of blood and deceit reach not to half their days, And I -- I do trust in Thee!
speaker: Narrator

text: To the Overseer. -- `On the Dumb Dove far off.' -- A secret treasure of David, in the Philistines' taking hold of him in Gath. Favour me, O God, for man swallowed me up, All the day fighting he oppresseth me,
speaker: Narrator

text: Mine enemies have swallowed up all the day, For many [are] fighting against me, O most High,
speaker: Narrator

text: The day I am afraid I am confident toward Thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: In God I praise His word, in God I have trusted, I fear not what flesh doth to me.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the day they wrest my words, Concerning me all their thoughts [are] for evil,
speaker: Narrator

text: They assemble, they hide, they watch my heels, When they have expected my soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: By iniquity they escape, In anger the peoples put down, O God.
speaker: Narrator

text: My wandering Thou hast counted, Thou -- place Thou my tear in Thy bottle, Are they not in Thy book?
speaker: Narrator

text: Then turn back do mine enemies in the day I call. This I have known, that God [is] for me.
speaker: Narrator

text: In God I praise the word, In Jehovah I praise the word.
speaker: Narrator

text: In God I trusted, I fear not what man doth to me,
speaker: Narrator

text: On me, O God, [are] Thy vows, I repay thank-offerings to Thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Thou hast delivered my soul from death, Dost Thou not my feet from falling? To walk habitually before God in the light of the living!
speaker: Narrator

text: To the Overseer. -- `Destroy not.' -- A secret treasure of David, in his fleeing from the face of Saul into a cave. Favour me, O God, favour me, For in Thee is my soul trusting, And in the shadow of Thy wings I trust, Until the calamities pass over.
speaker: Narrator

text: I call to God Most High, To God [who] is perfecting for me.
speaker: Narrator

text: He sendeth from the heaven, and saveth me, He reproached -- who is panting after me. Selah. God sendeth forth His kindness and His truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: My soul [is] in the midst of lions, I lie down [among] flames -- sons of men, Their teeth [are] a spear and arrows, And their tongue a sharp sword.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be Thou exalted above the heavens, O God, Above all the earth Thine honour.
speaker: Narrator

text: A net they have prepared for my steps, Bowed down hath my soul, They have digged before me a pit, They have fallen into its midst. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Prepared is my heart, O God, Prepared is my heart, I sing and praise.
speaker: Narrator

text: Awake, mine honour, awake, psaltery and harp, I awake the morning dawn.
speaker: Narrator

text: I thank Thee among the peoples, O Lord, I praise Thee among the nations.
speaker: Narrator

text: For great unto the heavens [is] Thy kindness, And unto the clouds Thy truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be thou exalted above the heavens, O God. Above all the earth Thine honour!
speaker: Narrator

text: To the Overseer. -- `Destroy not.' -- A secret treasure, by David. Is it true, O dumb one, righteously ye speak? Uprightly ye judge, O sons of men?
speaker: Narrator

text: Even in heart ye work iniquities, In the land the violence of your hands ye ponder.
speaker: Narrator

text: The wicked have been estranged from the womb, They have erred from the belly, speaking lies.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their poison [is] as poison of a serpent, As a deaf asp shutting its ear,
speaker: Narrator

text: Which hearkeneth not to the voice of whisperers, A charmer of charms most skilful.
speaker: Narrator

text: O God, break their teeth in their mouth, The jaw-teeth of young lions break down, O Jehovah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They are melted as waters, They go up and down for themselves, His arrow proceedeth as they cut themselves off.
speaker: Narrator

text: As a snail that melteth he goeth on, [As] an untimely birth of a woman, They have not seen the sun.
speaker: Narrator

text: Before your pots discern the bramble, As well the raw as the heated He whirleth away.
speaker: Narrator

text: The righteous rejoiceth that he hath seen vengeance, His steps he washeth in the blood of the wicked.
speaker: Narrator

text: And man saith: `Surely fruit [is] for the righteous: Surely there is a God judging in the earth!'
speaker: Narrator

text: To the Overseer. -- `Destroy not,' by David. -- A secret treasure, in Saul's sending, and they watch the house to put him to death. Deliver me from mine enemies, O my God, From my withstanders set me on high.
speaker: Narrator

text: Deliver me from workers of iniquity, And from men of blood save me.
speaker: Narrator

text: For, lo, they laid wait for my soul, Assembled against me are strong ones, Not my transgression nor my sin, O Jehovah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Without punishment they run and prepare themselves, Stir up to meet me, and see.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Thou, Jehovah, God of Hosts, God of Israel, Awake to inspect all the nations. Favour not any treacherous dealers of iniquity. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They turn back at evening, They make a noise like a dog, And go round about the city.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lo, they belch out with their mouths, Swords [are] in their lips, for `Who heareth?'
speaker: Narrator

text: And Thou, O Jehovah dost laugh at them, Thou dost mock at all the nations.
speaker: Narrator

text: O my Strength, unto Thee I take heed, For God [is] my tower -- the God of my kindness.
speaker: Narrator

text: God doth go before me, He causeth me to look on mine enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text: Slay them not, lest my people forget, Shake them by Thy strength, And bring them down, O Lord our shield.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sin of their mouth [is] a word of their lips, And they are captured in their pride, And from the curse and lying they recount.
speaker: Narrator

text: Consume in fury, consume and they are not, And they know that God is ruling in Jacob, To the ends of the earth. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they turn back at evening, They make a noise like a dog, And they go round about the city.
speaker: Narrator

text: They -- they wander for food, If they are not satisfied -- then they murmur.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I -- I sing [of] Thy strength, And I sing at morn [of] Thy kindness, For thou hast been a tower to me, And a refuge for me in a day of adversity.
speaker: Narrator

text: O my Strength, unto Thee I sing praise, For God [is] my tower, the God of my kindness!
speaker: Narrator

text: To the Overseer. -- `Concerning the Lily of Testimony,' a secret treasure of David, to teach, in his striving with Aram-Naharaim, and with Aram-Zobah, and Joab turneth back and smiteth Edom in the valley of Salt -- twelve thousand. O God, Thou hadst cast us off, Thou hadst broken us -- hadst been angry! -- Thou dost turn back to us.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast caused the land to tremble, Thou hast broken it, Heal its breaches, for it hath moved.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast shewn Thy people a hard thing, Thou hast caused us to drink wine of trembling.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast given to those fearing thee an ensign. To be lifted up as an ensign Because of truth. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: That Thy beloved ones may be drawn out, Save [with] Thy right hand, and answer us.
speaker: Narrator

text: God hath spoken in His holiness: I exult -- I apportion Shechem, And the valley of Succoth I measure,
speaker: Narrator

text: Mine [is] Gilead, and mine [is] Manasseh, And Ephraim [is] the strength of my head, Judah [is] my lawgiver,
speaker: Narrator

text: Moab [is] my pot for washing, over Edom I cast my shoe, Shout, concerning me, O Philistia.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who doth bring me [to] a city of bulwarks? Who hath led me unto Edom?
speaker: Narrator

text: Is it not Thou, O God? hast Thou cast us off? And dost Thou not go forth, O God, with our hosts!
speaker: Narrator

text: Give to us help from adversity, And vain [is] the deliverance of man.
speaker: Narrator

text: In God we do mightily, And He treadeth down our adversaries!
speaker: Narrator

text: To the Overseer, on stringed instruments. -- By David. Hear, O God, my loud cry, attend to my prayer.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the end of the land unto Thee I call, In the feebleness of my heart, Into a rock higher than I Thou dost lead me.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Thou hast been a refuge for me, A tower of strength because of the enemy.
speaker: Narrator

text: I sojourn in Thy tent to the ages, I trust in the secret place of Thy wings. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Thou, O God, hast hearkened to my vows, Thou hast appointed the inheritance Of those fearing Thy name.
speaker: Narrator

text: Days to the days of the king Thou addest, His years as generation and generation.
speaker: Narrator

text: He dwelleth to the age before God, Kindness and truth appoint -- they keep him.
speaker: Narrator

text: So do I praise Thy name for ever, When I pay my vows day by day!
speaker: Narrator

text: To the Overseer, for Jeduthun. -- A Psalm of David. Only -- toward God [is] my soul silent, From Him [is] my salvation.
speaker: Narrator

text: Only -- He [is] my rock, and my salvation, My tower, I am not much moved.
speaker: Narrator

text: Till when do ye devise mischief against a man? Ye are destroyed all of you, As a wall inclined, a hedge that is cast down.
speaker: Narrator

text: Only -- from his excellency They have consulted to drive away, They enjoy a lie, with their mouth they bless, And with their heart revile. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Only -- for God, be silent, O my soul, For from Him [is] my hope.
speaker: Narrator

text: Only -- He [is] my rock and my salvation, My tower, I am not moved.
speaker: Narrator

text: On God [is] my salvation, and my honour, The rock of my strength, my refuge [is] in God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Trust in Him at all times, O people, Pour forth before Him your heart, God [is] a refuge for us. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Only -- vanity [are] the low, a lie the high. In balances to go up they than vanity [are] lighter.
speaker: Narrator

text: Trust not in oppression, And in robbery become not vain, Wealth -- when it increaseth -- set not the heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: Once hath God spoken, twice I heard this, That `strength [is] with God.'
speaker: Narrator

text: And with Thee, O Lord, [is] kindness, For Thou dost recompense to each, According to his work!
speaker: Narrator

text: A Psalm of David, in his being in the wilderness of Judah. O God, Thou [art] my God, earnestly do I seek Thee, Thirsted for Thee hath my soul, Longed for Thee hath my flesh, In a land dry and weary, without waters.
speaker: Narrator

text: So in the sanctuary I have seen Thee, To behold Thy strength and Thine honour.
speaker: Narrator

text: Because better [is] Thy kindness than life, My lips do praise Thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: So I bless Thee in my life, in Thy name I lift up my hands.
speaker: Narrator

text: As [with] milk and fatness is my soul satisfied, And [with] singing lips doth my mouth praise.
speaker: Narrator

text: If I have remembered Thee on my couch, In the watches -- I meditate on Thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Thou hast been a help to me, And in the shadow of Thy wings I sing.
speaker: Narrator

text: Cleaved hath my soul after Thee, On me hath Thy right hand taken hold.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they who for desolation seek my soul, Go in to the lower parts of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: They cause him to run on the edge of the sword, A portion for foxes they are.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the king doth rejoice in God, Boast himself doth every one swearing by Him, But stopped is the mouth of those speaking lies!
speaker: Narrator

text: To the Overseer. -- A Psalm of David. Hear, O God, my voice, in my meditation, From the fear of an enemy Thou keepest my life,
speaker: Narrator

text: Hidest me from the secret counsel of evil doers, From the tumult of workers of iniquity.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who sharpened as a sword their tongue, They directed their arrow -- a bitter word.
speaker: Narrator

text: To shoot in secret places the perfect, Suddenly they shoot him, and fear not.
speaker: Narrator

text: They strengthen for themselves an evil thing, They recount of the hiding of snares, They have said, `Who doth look at it?'
speaker: Narrator

text: They search out perverse things, `We perfected a searching search,' And the inward part of man, and the heart [are] deep.
speaker: Narrator

text: And God doth shoot them [with] an arrow, Sudden have been their wounds,
speaker: Narrator

text: And they cause him to stumble, Against them [is] their own tongue, Every looker on them fleeth away.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all men fear, and declare the work of God, And His deed they have considered wisely.
speaker: Narrator

text: The righteous doth rejoice in Jehovah, And hath trusted in Him, And boast themselves do all the upright of heart!
speaker: Narrator

text: To the Overseer. -- A Psalm of David. A Song. To Thee, silence -- praise, O God, [is] in Zion, And to Thee is a vow completed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hearer of prayer, to Thee all flesh cometh.
speaker: Narrator

text: Matters of iniquities were mightier than I, Our transgressions -- Thou dost cover them.
speaker: Narrator

text: O the happiness of [him whom] Thou choosest, And drawest near, he inhabiteth Thy courts, We are satisfied with the goodness of Thy house, Thy holy temple.
speaker: Narrator

text: By fearful things in righteousness Thou answerest us, O God of our salvation, The confidence of all far off ends of earth and sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: Establishing mountains by His power, He hath been girded with might,
speaker: Narrator

text: Restraining the noise of seas, the noise of their billows, And the multitude of the peoples.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the inhabitants of the uttermost parts From Thy signs are afraid, The outgoings of morning and evening Thou causest to sing.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast inspected the earth, and waterest it, Thou makest it very rich, the rivulet of God [is] full of water, Thou preparest their corn, When thus Thou dost prepare it,
speaker: Narrator

text: Its ridges have been filled, Deepened hath been its furrow, With showers Thou dost soften it, Its springing up Thou blessest.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast crowned the year of Thy goodness, And Thy paths drop fatness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Drop do the pastures of a wilderness, And joy of the heights Thou girdest on.
speaker: Narrator

text: Clothed have lambs the flock, And valleys are covered with corn, They shout -- yea, they sing!
speaker: Narrator

text: To the Overseer. -- A Song, a Psalm. Shout ye to God, all the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise ye the honour of His name, Make ye honourable His praise.
speaker: Narrator

text: Say to God, `How fearful [are] Thy works, By the abundance of Thy strength, Thine enemies feign obedience to Thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the earth do bow to Thee, They sing praise to Thee, they praise Thy name.' Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Come ye, and see the works of God, Fearful acts toward the sons of men.
speaker: Narrator

text: He hath turned a sea to dry land, Through a river they pass over on foot, There do we rejoice in Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ruling by His might to the age, His eyes among the nations do watch, The refractory exalt not themselves. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Bless, ye peoples, our God, And sound the voice of His praise,
speaker: Narrator

text: Who hath placed our soul in life, And suffered not our feet to be moved.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Thou hast tried us, O God, Thou hast refined us as the refining of silver.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast brought us into a net, Thou hast placed pressure on our loins.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast caused man to ride at our head. We have entered into fire and into water, And Thou bringest us out to a watered place.
speaker: Narrator

text: I enter Thy house with burnt-offerings, I complete to Thee my vows,
speaker: Narrator

text: For opened were my lips, And my mouth spake in my distress:
speaker: Narrator

text: `Burnt-offerings of fatlings I offer to Thee, With perfume of rams, I prepare a bullock with he-goats.' Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Come, hear, all ye who fear God, And I recount what he did for my soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: Unto Him [with] my mouth I have called, And exaltation [is] under my tongue.
speaker: Narrator

text: Iniquity, if I have seen in my heart, The Lord doth not hear.
speaker: Narrator

text: But God hath heard, He hath attended to the voice of my prayer.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed [is] God, Who hath not turned aside my prayer, And His loving-kindness, from me!
speaker: Narrator

text: To the Overseer, with stringed instruments. -- A Psalm, a Song. God doth favour us and bless us, Doth cause His face to shine with us. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the knowledge in earth of Thy way, among all nations of Thy salvation.
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise Thee do peoples, O God, Praise Thee do peoples, all of them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Rejoice and sing do nations, For Thou judgest peoples uprightly, And peoples on earth comfortest. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Confess Thee do peoples, O God, Confess Thee do peoples -- all of them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Earth hath given her increase, God doth bless us -- our God,
speaker: Narrator

text: God doth bless us, and all ends of earth fear Him!
speaker: Narrator

text: To the Overseer. -- A Psalm, a song of David. Rise doth God -- scattered are His enemies! And those hating Him flee from His face.
speaker: Narrator

text: As the driving away of smoke Thou drivest away, As the melting of wax before fire, The wicked perish at the presence of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the righteous rejoice, they exult before God, And they joy with gladness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Sing ye to God -- praise His name, Raise up a highway for Him who is riding in deserts, In Jah [is] His name, and exult before Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Father of the fatherless, and judge of the widows, [Is] God in His holy habitation.
speaker: Narrator

text: God -- causing the lonely to dwell at home, Bringing out bound ones into prosperity, Only -- the refractory have inhabited a dry place.
speaker: Narrator

text: O God, in Thy going forth before Thy people, In Thy stepping through the wilderness, Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: The earth hath shaken, Yea, the heavens have dropped before God, This Sinai -- before God, the God of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: A shower of free-will gifts thou shakest out, O God. Thine inheritance, when it hath been weary, Thou hast established it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy company have dwelt in it, Thou preparest in Thy goodness for the poor, O God.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord doth give the saying, The female proclaimers [are] a numerous host.
speaker: Narrator

text: Kings of hosts flee utterly away, And a female inhabitant of the house apportioneth spoil.
speaker: Narrator

text: Though ye do lie between two boundaries, Wings of a dove covered with silver, And her pinions with yellow gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the Mighty spreadeth kings in it, It doth snow in Salmon.
speaker: Narrator

text: A hill of God [is] the hill of Bashan, A hill of heights [is] the hill of Bashan.
speaker: Narrator

text: Why do ye envy, O high hills, The hill God hath desired for His seat? Jehovah also doth tabernacle for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: The chariots of God [are] myriads, thousands of changes, The Lord [is] among them, in Sinai, in the sanctuary.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast ascended on high, Thou hast taken captive captivity, Thou hast taken gifts for men, That even the refractory may rest, O Jah God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed [is] the Lord, day by day He layeth on us. God Himself [is] our salvation. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: God Himself [is] to us a God for deliverances, And Jehovah Lord hath the outgoings of death.
speaker: Narrator

text: Only -- God doth smite The head of His enemies, The hairy crown of a habitual walker in his guilt.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord said: `From Bashan I bring back, I bring back from the depths of the sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: So that thou dashest thy foot in blood, [In the blood of] enemies -- the tongue of Thy dogs.'
speaker: Narrator

text: They have seen Thy goings, O God, Goings of my God, my king, in the sanctuary.
speaker: Narrator

text: Singers have been before, Behind [are] players on instruments, In the midst virgins playing with timbrels.
speaker: Narrator

text: In assemblies bless ye God, The Lord -- from the fountain of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: There [is] little Benjamin their ruler, Heads of Judah their defence, Heads of Zebulun -- heads of Naphtali.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy God hath commanded thy strength, Be strong, O God, this Thou hast wrought for us.
speaker: Narrator

text: Because of Thy temple at Jerusalem, To Thee do kings bring a present.
speaker: Narrator

text: Rebuke a beast of the reeds, a company of bulls, With calves of the peoples, Each humbling himself with pieces of silver, Scatter Thou peoples delighting in conflicts.
speaker: Narrator

text: Come do fat ones out of Egypt, Cush causeth her hands to run to God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Kingdoms of the earth, sing ye to God, Praise ye the Lord. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: To him who is riding on the heavens of the heavens of old, Lo, He giveth with His voice a strong voice.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ascribe ye strength to God, Over Israel [is] His excellency, and His strength in the clouds.
speaker: Narrator

text: Fearful, O God, out of Thy sanctuaries, The God of Israel Himself, Giving strength and might to the people. Blessed [is] God!
speaker: Narrator

text: To the Overseer. -- `On the Lilies,' by David. Save me, O God, for come have waters unto the soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have sunk in deep mire, And there is no standing, I have come into the depths of the waters, And a flood hath overflown me.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have been wearied with my calling, Burnt hath been my throat, Consumed have been mine eyes, waiting for my God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those hating me without cause Have been more than the hairs of my head, Mighty have been my destroyers, My lying enemies, That which I took not away -- I bring back.
speaker: Narrator

text: O God, Thou -- Thou hast known Concerning my overturn, And my desolations from Thee have not been hid.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let not those waiting on Thee be ashamed because of me, O Lord, Jehovah of Hosts, Let not those seeking Thee Blush because of me, O God of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: For because of Thee I have borne reproach, Shame hath covered my face.
speaker: Narrator

text: A stranger I have been to my brother, And a foreigner to sons of my mother.
speaker: Narrator

text: For zeal for Thy house hath consumed me, And the reproaches of Thy reproachers Have fallen upon me.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I weep in the fasting of my soul, And it is for a reproach to me.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I make my clothing sackcloth, And I am to them for a simile.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those sitting at the gate meditate concerning me, And those drinking strong drink, Play on instruments.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I -- my prayer [is] to Thee, O Jehovah, A time of good pleasure, O God, In the abundance of Thy kindness, Answer me in the truth of Thy salvation.
speaker: Narrator

text: Deliver me from the mire, and let me not sink, Let me be delivered from those hating me, And from deep places of waters.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let not a flood of waters overflow me, Nor let the deep swallow me up, Nor let the pit shut her mouth upon me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Answer me, O Jehovah, for good [is] Thy kindness, According to the abundance Of Thy mercies turn Thou unto me,
speaker: Narrator

text: And hide not Thy face from Thy servant, For I am in distress -- haste, answer me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be near unto my soul -- redeem it, Because of mine enemies ransom me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou -- Thou hast known my reproach, And my shame, and my blushing, Before Thee [are] all mine adversaries.
speaker: Narrator

text: Reproach hath broken my heart, and I am sick, And I look for a bemoaner, and there is none, And for comforters, and I have found none.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they give for my food gall, And for my thirst cause me to drink vinegar.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their table before them is for a snare, And for a recompence -- for a trap.
speaker: Narrator

text: Darkened are their eyes from seeing, And their loins continually shake Thou.
speaker: Narrator

text: Pour upon them Thine indignation, And the fierceness of Thine anger doth seize them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their tower is desolated, In their tents there is no dweller.
speaker: Narrator

text: For they have pursued him Thou hast smitten, And recount of the pain of Thy pierced ones.
speaker: Narrator

text: Give punishment for their iniquity, And they enter not into Thy righteousness.
speaker: Narrator

text: They are blotted out of the book of life, And with the righteous are not written.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I [am] afflicted and pained, Thy salvation, O God, doth set me on high.
speaker: Narrator

text: I praise the name of God with a song, And I magnify Him with thanksgiving,
speaker: Narrator

text: And it is better to Jehovah than an ox, A bullock -- horned -- hoofed.
speaker: Narrator

text: The humble have seen -- they rejoice, Ye who seek God -- and your heart liveth.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Jehovah hearkeneth unto the needy, And His bound ones He hath not despised.
speaker: Narrator

text: The heavens and earth do praise Him, Seas, and every moving thing in them.
speaker: Narrator

text: For God doth save Zion, And doth build the cities of Judah, And they have dwelt there, and possess it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the seed of His servants inherit it, And those loving His name dwell in it!
speaker: Narrator

text: To the Overseer, by David. -- `To cause to remember.' O God, to deliver me, O Jehovah, for my help, haste.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let them be ashamed and confounded Who are seeking my soul, Let them be turned backward and blush Who are desiring my evil.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let them turn back because of their shame, Who are saying, `Aha, aha.'
speaker: Narrator

text: Let all those seeking Thee joy and be glad in Thee, And let those loving Thy salvation Say continually, `God is magnified.'
speaker: Narrator

text: And I [am] poor and needy, O God, haste to me, My help and my deliverer [art] Thou, O Jehovah, tarry Thou not!
speaker: Narrator

text: In Thee, O Jehovah, I have trusted, Let me not be ashamed to the age.
speaker: Narrator

text: In Thy righteousness Thou dost deliver me, And dost cause me to escape, Incline unto me Thine ear, and save me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be to me for a rock -- a habitation, To go in continually, Thou hast given command to save me, For my rock and my bulwark [art] Thou.
speaker: Narrator

text: O my God, cause me to escape From the hand of the wicked, From the hand of the perverse and violent.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Thou [art] my hope, O Lord Jehovah, My trust from my youth.
speaker: Narrator

text: By Thee I have been supported from the womb, From my mother's bowels Thou dost cut me out, In Thee [is] my praise continually.
speaker: Narrator

text: As a wonder I have been to many, And Thou [art] my strong refuge.
speaker: Narrator

text: Filled is my mouth [with] Thy praise, All the day [with] Thy beauty.
speaker: Narrator

text: Cast me not off at the time of old age, According to the consumption of my power forsake me not.
speaker: Narrator

text: For mine enemies have spoken against me, And those watching my soul have taken counsel together,
speaker: Narrator

text: Saying, `God hath forsaken him, Pursue and catch him, for there is no deliverer.'
speaker: Narrator

text: O God, be not far from me, O my God, for my help make haste.
speaker: Narrator

text: They are ashamed, they are consumed, Who are opposing my soul, They are covered [with] reproach and blushing, Who are seeking my evil,
speaker: Narrator

text: And I continually do wait with hope, And have added unto all Thy praise.
speaker: Narrator

text: My mouth recounteth Thy righteousness, All the day Thy salvation, For I have not known the numbers.
speaker: Narrator

text: I come in the might of the Lord Jehovah, I mention Thy righteousness -- Thine only.
speaker: Narrator

text: God, Thou hast taught me from my youth, And hitherto I declare Thy wonders.
speaker: Narrator

text: And also unto old age and grey hairs, O God, forsake me not, Till I declare Thy strength to a generation, To every one that cometh Thy might.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Thy righteousness, O God, [is] unto the heights, Because Thou hast done great things, O God, who [is] like Thee?
speaker: Narrator

text: Because Thou hast showed me many and sad distresses, Thou turnest back -- Thou revivest me, And from the depths of the earth, Thou turnest back -- Thou bringest me up.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou dost increase my greatness, And Thou surroundest -- Thou comfortest me,
speaker: Narrator

text: I also thank Thee with a vessel of psaltery, Thy truth, O my God, I sing to Thee with a harp, O Holy One of Israel,
speaker: Narrator

text: My lips cry aloud when I sing praise to Thee, And my soul that Thou hast redeemed,
speaker: Narrator

text: My tongue also all the day uttereth Thy righteousness, Because ashamed -- because confounded, Have been those seeking my evil!
speaker: Narrator

text: By Solomon. O God, Thy judgments to the king give, And Thy righteousness to the king's son.
speaker: Narrator

text: He judgeth Thy people with righteousness, And Thy poor with judgment.
speaker: Narrator

text: The mountains bear peace to the people, And the heights by righteousness.
speaker: Narrator

text: He judgeth the poor of the people, Giveth deliverance to the sons of the needy, And bruiseth the oppressor.
speaker: Narrator

text: They fear Thee with the sun, and before the moon, Generation -- generations.
speaker: Narrator

text: He cometh down as rain on mown grass, As showers -- sprinkling the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Flourish in his days doth the righteous, And abundance of peace till the moon is not.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he ruleth from sea unto sea, And from the river unto the ends of earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Before him bow do the inhabitants of the dry places, And his enemies lick the dust.
speaker: Narrator

text: Kings of Tarshish and of the isles send back a present. Kings of Sheba and Seba a reward bring near.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all kings do bow themselves to him, All nations do serve him,
speaker: Narrator

text: For he delivereth the needy who crieth, And the poor when he hath no helper,
speaker: Narrator

text: He hath pity on the poor and needy, And the souls of the needy he saveth,
speaker: Narrator

text: From fraud and from violence he redeemeth their soul, And precious is their blood in his eyes.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he liveth, and giveth to him of the gold of Sheba, And prayeth for him continually, All the day he doth bless him.
speaker: Narrator

text: There is a handful of corn in the earth, On the top of mountains, Shake like Lebanon doth its fruit, And they flourish out of the city as the herb of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: His name is to the age, Before the sun is his name continued, And they bless themselves in him, All nations do pronounce him happy.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed is Jehovah God, God of Israel, He alone is doing wonders,
speaker: Narrator

text: And blessed [is] the Name of His honour to the age, And the whole earth is filled [with] His honour. Amen, and amen!
speaker: Narrator

text: The prayers of David son of Jesse have been ended.
speaker: Narrator

text: A Psalm of Asaph. Only -- good to Israel [is] God, to the clean of heart. And I -- as a little thing, My feet have been turned aside,
speaker: Narrator

text: As nothing, have my steps slipped, For I have been envious of the boastful,
speaker: Narrator

text: The peace of the wicked I see, That there are no bands at their death,
speaker: Narrator

text: And their might [is] firm.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the misery of mortals they are not, And with common men they are not plagued.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore hath pride encircled them, Violence covereth them as a dress.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their eye hath come out from fat. The imaginations of the heart transgressed;
speaker: Narrator

text: They do corruptly, And they speak in the wickedness of oppression, From on high they speak.
speaker: Narrator

text: They have set in the heavens their mouth, And their tongue walketh in the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore do His people return hither, And waters of fulness are wrung out to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they have said, `How hath God known? And is there knowledge in the Most High?'
speaker: Narrator

text: Lo, these [are] the wicked and easy ones of the age, They have increased strength.
speaker: Narrator

text: Only -- a vain thing! I have purified my heart, And I wash in innocency my hands,
speaker: Narrator

text: And I am plagued all the day, And my reproof [is] every morning.
speaker: Narrator

text: If I have said, `I recount thus,' Lo, a generation of Thy sons I have deceived.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I think to know this, Perverseness it [is] in mine eyes,
speaker: Narrator

text: Till I come in to the sanctuaries of God, I attend to their latter end.
speaker: Narrator

text: Only, in slippery places Thou dost set them, Thou hast caused them to fall to desolations.
speaker: Narrator

text: How have they become a desolation as in a moment, They have been ended -- consumed from terrors.
speaker: Narrator

text: As a dream from awakening, O Lord, In awaking, their image Thou despisest.
speaker: Narrator

text: For my heart doth show itself violent, And my reins prick themselves,
speaker: Narrator

text: And I am brutish, and do not know. A beast I have been with Thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I [am] continually with Thee, Thou hast laid hold on my right hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: With Thy counsel Thou dost lead me, And after honour dost receive me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whom have I in the heavens? And with Thee none I have desired in earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Consumed hath been my flesh and my heart, The rock of my heart and my portion [is] God to the age.
speaker: Narrator

text: For, lo, those far from Thee do perish, Thou hast cut off every one, Who is going a whoring from Thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I -- nearness of God to me [is] good, I have placed in the Lord Jehovah my refuge, To recount all Thy works!
speaker: Narrator

text: An Instruction of Asaph. Why, O God, hast Thou cast off for ever? Thine anger smoketh against the flock of Thy pasture.
speaker: Narrator

text: Remember Thy company. Thou didst purchase of old, Thou didst redeem the rod of Thy inheritance, This mount Zion -- Thou didst dwell in it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lift up Thy steps to the perpetual desolations, Everything the enemy did wickedly in the sanctuary.
speaker: Narrator

text: Roared have thine adversaries, In the midst of Thy meeting-places, They have set their ensigns as ensigns.
speaker: Narrator

text: He is known as one bringing in on high Against a thicket of wood -- axes.
speaker: Narrator

text: And now, its carvings together With axe and hatchet they break down,
speaker: Narrator

text: They have sent into fire Thy sanctuary, to the earth they polluted the tabernacle of Thy name,
speaker: Narrator

text: They said in their hearts, `Let us oppress them together,' They did burn all the meeting-places of God in the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: Our ensigns we have not seen, There is no more a prophet, Nor with us is one knowing how long.
speaker: Narrator

text: Till when, O God, doth an adversary reproach? Doth an enemy despise thy name for ever?
speaker: Narrator

text: Why dost Thou turn back Thy hand, Even Thy right hand? From the midst of Thy bosom remove [it].
speaker: Narrator

text: And God [is] my king of old, Working salvation in the midst of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast broken by Thy strength a sea-[monster], Thou hast shivered Heads of dragons by the waters,
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast broken the heads of leviathan, Thou makest him food, For the people of the dry places.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast cleaved a fountain and a stream, Thou hast dried up perennial flowings.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thine [is] the day, also Thine [is] the night, Thou hast prepared a light giver -- the sun.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast set up all the borders of earth, Summer and winter Thou hast formed them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Remember this -- an enemy reproached Jehovah, And a foolish people have despised Thy name.
speaker: Narrator

text: Give not up to a company, The soul of Thy turtle-dove, The company of Thy poor ones forget not for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Look attentively to the covenant, For the dark places of earth, Have been full of habitations of violence.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let not the oppressed turn back ashamed, Let the poor and needy praise Thy name,
speaker: Narrator

text: Arise, O God, plead Thy plea, Remember Thy reproach from a fool all the day.
speaker: Narrator

text: Forget not the voice of Thine adversaries, The noise of Thy withstanders is going up continually!
speaker: Narrator

text: To the Overseer. -- `Destroy not.' -- A Psalm of Asaph. -- A Song. We have given thanks to Thee, O God, We have given thanks, and near [is] Thy name, They have recounted Thy wonders.
speaker: Narrator

text: When I receive an appointment, I -- I do judge uprightly.
speaker: Narrator

text: Melted is the earth and all its inhabitants, I -- I have pondered its pillars. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have said to the boastful, `Be not boastful,' And to the wicked, `Raise not up a horn.'
speaker: Narrator

text: Raise not up on high your horn, (Ye speak with a stiff neck.)
speaker: Narrator

text: For not from the east, or from the west, Nor from the wilderness -- [is] elevation.
speaker: Narrator

text: But God [is] judge, This He maketh low -- and this He lifteth up.
speaker: Narrator

text: For a cup [is] in the hand of Jehovah, And the wine hath foamed, It is full of mixture, and He poureth out of it, Only its dregs wring out, and drink, Do all the wicked of the earth,
speaker: Narrator

text: And I -- I declare [it] to the age, I sing praise to the God of Jacob.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all horns of the wicked I cut off, Exalted are the horns of the righteous!
speaker: Narrator

text: To the Overseer with stringed instruments. -- A Psalm of Asaph. -- A Song. In Judah [is] God known, in Israel His name [is] great.
speaker: Narrator

text: And His tabernacle is in Salem, And His habitation in Zion.
speaker: Narrator

text: There he hath shivered arrows of a bow, Shield, and sword, and battle. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Bright [art] Thou, honourable above hills of prey.
speaker: Narrator

text: Spoiled themselves have the mighty of heart, They have slept their sleep, And none of the men of might found their hands.
speaker: Narrator

text: From Thy rebuke, O God of Jacob, Both rider and horse have been fast asleep.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou, fearful [art] Thou, And who doth stand before Thee, Since Thou hast been angry!
speaker: Narrator

text: From heaven Thou hast sounded judgment, Earth hath feared, and hath been still,
speaker: Narrator

text: In the rising of God to judgment, To save all the humble of earth. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the fierceness of man praiseth Thee, The remnant of fierceness Thou girdest on.
speaker: Narrator

text: Vow and complete to Jehovah your God, All ye surrounding him. They bring presents to the Fearful One.
speaker: Narrator

text: He doth gather the spirit of leaders, Fearful to the kings of earth!
speaker: Narrator

text: To the Overseer, for Jeduthun. -- A Psalm of Asaph. My voice [is] to God, and I cry, my voice [is] to God, And He hath given ear unto me.
speaker: Narrator

text: In a day of my distress the Lord I sought, My hand by night hath been spread out, And it doth not cease, My soul hath refused to be comforted.
speaker: Narrator

text: I remember God, and make a noise, I meditate, and feeble is my spirit. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast taken hold of the watches of mine eyes, I have been moved, and I speak not.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have reckoned the days of old, The years of the ages.
speaker: Narrator

text: I remember my music in the night, With my heart I meditate, and my spirit doth search diligently:
speaker: Narrator

text: To the ages doth the Lord cast off? Doth He add to be pleased no more?
speaker: Narrator

text: Hath His kindness ceased for ever? The saying failed to all generations?
speaker: Narrator

text: Hath God forgotten [His] favours? Hath He shut up in anger His mercies? Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I say: `My weakness is, The changes of the right hand of the Most High.'
speaker: Narrator

text: I mention the doings of Jah, For I remember of old Thy wonders,
speaker: Narrator

text: And I have meditated on all Thy working, And I talk concerning Thy doings.
speaker: Narrator

text: O God, in holiness [is] Thy way, Who [is] a great god like God?
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou [art] the God doing wonders. Thou hast made known among the peoples Thy strength,
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast redeemed with strength Thy people, The sons of Jacob and Joseph. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: The waters have seen Thee, O God, The waters have seen Thee, They are afraid -- also depths are troubled.
speaker: Narrator

text: Poured out waters have thick clouds, The skies have given forth a noise, Also -- Thine arrows go up and down.
speaker: Narrator

text: The voice of Thy thunder [is] in the spheres, Lightnings have lightened the world, The earth hath trembled, yea, it shaketh.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the sea [is] Thy way, And Thy paths [are] in many waters, And Thy tracks have not been known.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast led as a flock Thy people, By the hand of Moses and Aaron!
speaker: Narrator

text: An Instruction of Asaph. Give ear, O my people, to my law, Incline your ear to sayings of my mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text: I open with a simile my mouth, I bring forth hidden things of old,
speaker: Narrator

text: That we have heard and do know, And our fathers have recounted to us.
speaker: Narrator

text: We do not hide from their sons, To a later generation recounting praises of Jehovah, And His strength, and His wonders that He hath done.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He raiseth up a testimony in Jacob, And a law hath placed in Israel, That He commanded our fathers, To make them known to their sons.
speaker: Narrator

text: So that a later generation doth know, Sons who are born, do rise and recount to their sons,
speaker: Narrator

text: And place in God their confidence, And forget not the doings of God, But keep His commands.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they are not like their fathers, A generation apostate and rebellious, A generation! it hath not prepared its heart, Nor stedfast with God [is] its spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text: Sons of Ephraim -- armed bearers of bow, Have turned in a day of conflict.
speaker: Narrator

text: They have not kept the covenant of God, And in His law they have refused to walk,
speaker: Narrator

text: And they forget His doings, And His wonders that He shewed them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Before their fathers He hath done wonders, In the land of Egypt -- the field of Zoan.
speaker: Narrator

text: He cleft a sea, and causeth them to pass over, Yea, He causeth waters to stand as a heap.
speaker: Narrator

text: And leadeth them with a cloud by day, And all the night with a light of fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: He cleaveth rocks in a wilderness, And giveth drink -- as the great deep.
speaker: Narrator

text: And bringeth out streams from a rock, And causeth waters to come down as rivers.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they add still to sin against Him, To provoke the Most High in the dry place.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they try God in their heart, To ask food for their lust.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they speak against God -- they said: `Is God able to array a table in a wilderness?'
speaker: Narrator

text: Lo, He hath smitten a rock, And waters flow, yea, streams overflow. `Also -- bread [is] He able to give? Doth He prepare flesh for His people?'
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore hath Jehovah heard, And He sheweth Himself wroth, And fire hath been kindled against Jacob, And anger also hath gone up against Israel,
speaker: Narrator

text: For they have not believed in God, Nor have they trusted in His salvation.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He commandeth clouds from above, Yea, doors of the heavens He hath opened.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He raineth on them manna to eat, Yea, corn of heaven He hath given to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Food of the mighty hath each eaten, Venison He sent to them to satiety.
speaker: Narrator

text: He causeth an east wind to journey in the heavens, And leadeth by His strength a south wind,
speaker: Narrator

text: And He raineth on them flesh as dust, And as sand of the seas -- winged fowl,
speaker: Narrator

text: And causeth [it] to fall in the midst of His camp, Round about His tabernacles.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they eat, and are greatly satisfied, And their desire He bringeth to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: They have not been estranged from their desire, Yet [is] their food in their mouth,
speaker: Narrator

text: And the anger of God hath gone up against them, And He slayeth among their fat ones, And youths of Israel He caused to bend.
speaker: Narrator

text: With all this they have sinned again, And have not believed in His wonders.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He consumeth in vanity their days, And their years in trouble.
speaker: Narrator

text: If He slew them, then they sought Him, And turned back, and sought God earnestly,
speaker: Narrator

text: And they remember that God [is] their rock, And God Most High their redeemer.
speaker: Narrator

text: And -- they deceive Him with their mouth, And with their tongue do lie to Him,
speaker: Narrator

text: And their heart hath not been right with Him, And they have not been stedfast in His covenant.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He -- the Merciful One, Pardoneth iniquity, and destroyeth not, And hath often turned back His anger, And waketh not up all His fury.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He remembereth that they [are] flesh, A wind going on -- and it returneth not.
speaker: Narrator

text: How often do they provoke Him in the wilderness, Grieve Him in the desolate place?
speaker: Narrator

text: Yea, they turn back, and try God, And the Holy One of Israel have limited.
speaker: Narrator

text: They have not remembered His hand The day He ransomed them from the adversary.
speaker: Narrator

text: When He set His signs in Egypt, And His wonders in the field of Zoan,
speaker: Narrator

text: And He turneth to blood their streams, And their floods they drink not.
speaker: Narrator

text: He sendeth among them the beetle, and it consumeth them, And the frog, and it destroyeth them,
speaker: Narrator

text: And giveth to the caterpillar their increase, And their labour to the locust.
speaker: Narrator

text: He destroyeth with hail their vine, And their sycamores with frost,
speaker: Narrator

text: And delivereth up to the hail their beasts, And their cattle to the burning flames.
speaker: Narrator

text: He sendeth on them the fury of His anger, Wrath, and indignation, and distress -- A discharge of evil messengers.
speaker: Narrator

text: He pondereth a path for His anger, He kept not back their soul from death, Yea, their life to the pestilence He delivered up.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He smiteth every first-born in Egypt, The first-fruit of the strong in tents of Ham.
speaker: Narrator

text: And causeth His people to journey as a flock, And guideth them as a drove in a wilderness,
speaker: Narrator

text: And He leadeth them confidently, And they have not been afraid, And their enemies hath the sea covered.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He bringeth them in unto the border of His sanctuary, This mountain His right hand had got,
speaker: Narrator

text: And casteth out nations from before them, And causeth them to fall in the line of inheritance, And causeth the tribes of Israel to dwell in their tents,
speaker: Narrator

text: And they tempt and provoke God Most High, And His testimonies have not kept.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they turn back, And deal treacherously like their fathers, They have been turned like a deceitful bow,
speaker: Narrator

text: And make Him angry with their high places, And with their graven images make Him zealous,
speaker: Narrator

text: God hath heard, and sheweth Himself wroth. And kicketh exceedingly against Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He leaveth the tabernacle of Shiloh, The tent He had placed among men,
speaker: Narrator

text: And He giveth His strength to captivity, And His beauty into the hand of an adversary,
speaker: Narrator

text: And delivereth up to the sword His people, And with His inheritance shewed Himself angry.
speaker: Narrator

text: His young men hath fire consumed, And His virgins have not been praised.
speaker: Narrator

text: His priests by the sword have fallen, And their widows weep not.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord waketh as a sleeper, As a mighty one crying aloud from wine.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He smiteth His adversaries backward, A reproach age-during He hath put on them,
speaker: Narrator

text: And He kicketh against the tent of Joseph, And on the tribe of Ephraim hath not fixed.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He chooseth the tribe of Judah, With mount Zion that He loved,
speaker: Narrator

text: And buildeth His sanctuary as a high place, Like the earth, He founded it to the age.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He fixeth on David His servant, And taketh him from the folds of a flock,
speaker: Narrator

text: From behind suckling ones He hath brought him in, To rule over Jacob His people, And over Israel His inheritance.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he ruleth them according to the integrity of his heart, And by the skilfulness of his hands leadeth them!
speaker: Narrator

text: A Psalm of Asaph. O God, nations have come into Thy inheritance, They have defiled Thy holy temple, They made Jerusalem become heaps,
speaker: Narrator

text: They gave the dead bodies of Thy servants Food for the fowls of the heavens, The flesh of Thy saints For the wild beast of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: They have shed their blood As water round about Jerusalem, And there is none burying.
speaker: Narrator

text: We have been a reproach to our neighbours, A scorn and a derision to our surrounders.
speaker: Narrator

text: Till when, O Jehovah? art Thou angry for ever? Thy jealousy doth burn as fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: Pour Thy fury on the nations who have not known Thee, And on kingdoms that have not called in Thy name.
speaker: Narrator

text: For [one] hath devoured Jacob, And his habitation they have made desolate.
speaker: Narrator

text: Remember not for us the iniquities of forefathers, Haste, let Thy mercies go before us, For we have been very weak.
speaker: Narrator

text: Help us, O God of our salvation, Because of the honour of Thy name, And deliver us, and cover over our sins, For Thy name's sake.
speaker: Narrator

text: Why do the nations say, `Where [is] their God?' Let be known among the nations before our eyes, The vengeance of the blood of Thy servants that is shed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let the groaning of the prisoner come in before Thee, According to the greatness of Thine arm, Leave Thou the sons of death.
speaker: Narrator

text: And turn Thou back to our neighbours, Sevenfold unto their bosom, their reproach, Wherewith they reproached Thee, O Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: And we, Thy people, and the flock of Thy pasture, We give thanks to Thee to the age, To all generations we recount Thy praise!
speaker: Narrator

text: To the Overseer. -- `On the Lilies.' A testimony of Asaph. -- A Psalm. Shepherd of Israel, give ear, Leading Joseph as a flock, Inhabiting the cherubs -- shine forth,
speaker: Narrator

text: Before Ephraim, and Benjamin, and Manasseh, Wake up Thy might, and come for our salvation.
speaker: Narrator

text: O God, cause us to turn back, And cause Thy face to shine, and we are saved.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jehovah, God of Hosts, till when? Thou hast burned against the prayer of Thy people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast caused them to eat bread of tears, And causest them to drink With tears a third time.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou makest us a strife to our neighbors, And our enemies mock at it.
speaker: Narrator

text: God of Hosts, turn us back, And cause Thy face to shine, and we are saved.
speaker: Narrator

text: A vine out of Egypt Thou dost bring, Thou dost cast out nations, and plantest it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast looked before it, and dost root it, And it filleth the land,
speaker: Narrator

text: Covered have been hills [with] its shadow, And its boughs [are] cedars of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: It sendeth forth its branches unto the sea, And unto the river its sucklings.
speaker: Narrator

text: Why hast Thou broken down its hedges, And all passing by the way have plucked it?
speaker: Narrator

text: A boar out of the forest doth waste it, And a wild beast of the fields consumeth it.
speaker: Narrator

text: God of Hosts, turn back, we beseech Thee, Look from heaven, and see, and inspect this vine,
speaker: Narrator

text: And the root that Thy right hand planted, And the branch Thou madest strong for Thee,
speaker: Narrator

text: Burnt with fire -- cut down, From the rebuke of Thy face they perish.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let Thy hand be on the man of Thy right hand, On the son of man Thou hast strengthened for Thyself.
speaker: Narrator

text: And we do not go back from Thee, Thou dost revive us, and in Thy name we call.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Jehovah, God of Hosts, turn us back, Cause Thy face to shine, and we are saved!
speaker: Narrator

text: To the Overseer. -- `On the Gittith.' By Asaph. Cry aloud to God our strength, Shout to the God of Jacob.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lift up a song, and give out a timbrel, A pleasant harp with psaltery.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blow in the month a trumpet, In the new moon, at the day of our festival,
speaker: Narrator

text: For a statute to Israel it [is], An ordinance of the God of Jacob.
speaker: Narrator

text: A testimony on Joseph He hath placed it, In his going forth over the land of Egypt. A lip, I have not known -- I hear.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the burden his shoulder I turned aside, His hands from the basket pass over.
speaker: Narrator

text: In distress thou hast called and I deliver thee, I answer thee in the secret place of thunder, I try thee by the waters of Meribah. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear, O My people, and I testify to thee, O Israel, if thou dost hearken to me:
speaker: Narrator

text: There is not in thee a strange god, And thou bowest not thyself to a strange god.
speaker: Narrator

text: I [am] Jehovah thy God, Who bringeth thee up out of the land of Egypt. Enlarge thy mouth, and I fill it.
speaker: Narrator

text: But, My people hearkened not to My voice, And Israel hath not consented to Me.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I send them away in the enmity of their heart, They walk in their own counsels.
speaker: Narrator

text: O that My people were hearkening to Me, Israel in My ways would walk.
speaker: Narrator

text: As a little thing their enemies I cause to bow, And against their adversaries I turn back My hand,
speaker: Narrator

text: Those hating Jehovah feign obedience to Him, But their time is -- to the age.
speaker: Narrator

text: He causeth him to eat of the fat of wheat, And [with] honey from a rock I satisfy thee!
speaker: Narrator

text: -- A Psalm of Asaph. God hath stood in the company of God, In the midst God doth judge.
speaker: Narrator

text: Till when do ye judge perversely? And the face of the wicked lift up? Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Judge ye the weak and fatherless, The afflicted and the poor declare righteous.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let the weak and needy escape, From the hand of the wicked deliver them.
speaker: Narrator

text: They knew not, nor do they understand, In darkness they walk habitually, Moved are all the foundations of earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: I -- I have said, `Gods ye [are], And sons of the Most High -- all of you,
speaker: Narrator

text: But as man ye die, and as one of the heads ye fall,
speaker: Narrator

text: Rise, O God, judge the earth, For Thou hast inheritance among all the nations!
speaker: Narrator

text: A Song, -- A Psalm of Asaph. O God, let there be no silence to Thee, Be not silent, nor be quiet, O God.
speaker: Narrator

text: For, lo, Thine enemies do roar, And those hating Thee have lifted up the head,
speaker: Narrator

text: Against Thy people they take crafty counsel, And consult against Thy hidden ones.
speaker: Narrator

text: They have said, `Come, And we cut them off from [being] a nation, And the name of Israel is not remembered any more.'
speaker: Narrator

text: For they consulted in heart together, Against Thee a covenant they make,
speaker: Narrator

text: Tents of Edom, and Ishmaelites, Moab, and the Hagarenes,
speaker: Narrator

text: Gebal, and Ammon, and Amalek, Philistia with inhabitants of Tyre,
speaker: Narrator

text: Asshur also is joined with them, They have been an arm to sons of Lot. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do to them as [to] Midian, As [to] Sisera, as [to] Jabin, at the stream Kishon.
speaker: Narrator

text: They were destroyed at Endor, They were dung for the ground!
speaker: Narrator

text: Make their nobles as Oreb and as Zeeb, And as Zebah and Zalmunna all their princes,
speaker: Narrator

text: Who have said, `Let us occupy for ourselves The comely places of God.'
speaker: Narrator

text: O my God, make them as a rolling thing, As stubble before wind.
speaker: Narrator

text: As a fire doth burn a forest, And as a flame setteth hills on fire,
speaker: Narrator

text: So dost Thou pursue them with Thy whirlwind, And with Thy hurricane troublest them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Fill their faces [with] shame, And they seek Thy name, O Jehovah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They are ashamed and troubled for ever, Yea, they are confounded and lost.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they know that Thou -- (Thy name [is] Jehovah -- by Thyself,) [Art] the Most High over all the earth!
speaker: Narrator

text: To the Overseer. -- `On the Gittith By sons of Korah.' -- A Psalm. How beloved Thy tabernacles, Jehovah of Hosts!
speaker: Narrator

text: My soul desired, yea, it hath also been consumed, For the courts of Jehovah, My heart and my flesh cry aloud unto the living God,
speaker: Narrator

text: (Even a sparrow hath found a house, And a swallow a nest for herself, Where she hath placed her brood,) Thine altars, O Jehovah of Hosts, My king and my God.
speaker: Narrator

text: O the happiness of those inhabiting Thy house, Yet do they praise Thee. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: O the happiness of a man whose strength is in Thee, Highways [are] in their heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those passing through a valley of weeping, A fountain do make it, Blessings also cover the director.
speaker: Narrator

text: They go from strength unto strength, He appeareth unto God in Zion.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Jehovah, God of Hosts, hear my prayer, Give ear, O God of Jacob. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Our shield, see, O God, And behold the face of Thine anointed,
speaker: Narrator

text: For good [is] a day in Thy courts, O Teacher! I have chosen rather to be at the threshold, In the house of my God, Than to dwell in tents of wickedness.
speaker: Narrator
