text: For a sun and a shield [is] Jehovah God, Grace and honour doth Jehovah give. He withholdeth not good To those walking in uprightness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jehovah of Hosts! O the happiness of a man trusting in Thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: To the Overseer. -- By sons of Korah. A Psalm. Thou hast accepted, O Jehovah, Thy land, Thou hast turned [to] the captivity of Jacob.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast borne away the iniquity of Thy people, Thou hast covered all their sin. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast gathered up all Thy wrath, Thou hast turned back from the fierceness of Thine anger.
speaker: Narrator

text: Turn back [to] us, O God of our salvation, And make void Thine anger with us.
speaker: Narrator

text: To the age art Thou angry against us? Dost Thou draw out Thine anger To generation and generation?
speaker: Narrator

text: Dost Thou not turn back? Thou revivest us, And Thy people do rejoice in Thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Show us, O Jehovah, thy kindness, And Thy salvation Thou dost give to us.
speaker: Narrator

text: I hear what God Jehovah speaketh, For He speaketh peace unto His people, And unto His saints, and they turn not back to folly.
speaker: Narrator

text: Only, near to those fearing Him [is] His salvation, That honour may dwell in our land.
speaker: Narrator

text: Kindness and truth have met, Righteousness and peace have kissed,
speaker: Narrator

text: Truth from the earth springeth up, And righteousness from heaven looketh out,
speaker: Narrator

text: Jehovah also giveth that which is good, And our land doth give its increase.
speaker: Narrator

text: Righteousness before Him goeth, And maketh His footsteps for a way!
speaker: Narrator

text: A Prayer of David. Incline, O Jehovah, Thine ear, Answer me, for I [am] poor and needy.
speaker: Narrator

text: Keep my soul, for I [am] pious, Save Thy servant -- who is trusting to Thee, O Thou, my God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Favour me, O Lord, for to Thee I call all the day.
speaker: Narrator

text: Rejoice the soul of Thy servant, For unto Thee, O Lord, my soul I lift up.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Thou, Lord, [art] good and forgiving. And abundant in kindness to all calling Thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear, O Jehovah, my prayer, And attend to the voice of my supplications.
speaker: Narrator

text: In a day of my distress I call Thee, For Thou dost answer me.
speaker: Narrator

text: There is none like Thee among the gods, O Lord, And like Thy works there are none.
speaker: Narrator

text: All nations that Thou hast made Come and bow themselves before Thee, O Lord, And give honour to Thy name.
speaker: Narrator

text: For great [art] Thou, and doing wonders, Thou [art] God Thyself alone.
speaker: Narrator

text: Show me, O Jehovah, Thy way, I walk in Thy truth, My heart doth rejoice to fear Thy name.
speaker: Narrator

text: I confess Thee, O Lord my God, with all my heart, And I honour Thy name to the age.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Thy kindness [is] great toward me, And Thou hast delivered my soul from the lowest Sheol.
speaker: Narrator

text: O God, the proud have risen up against me, And a company of the terrible sought my soul, And have not placed Thee before them,
speaker: Narrator

text: And Thou, O Lord, [art] God, merciful and gracious, Slow to anger, and abundant in kindness and truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Look unto me, and favour me, Give Thy strength to Thy servant, And give salvation to a son of Thine handmaid.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do with me a sign for good, And those hating me see and are ashamed, For Thou, O Jehovah, hast helped me, Yea, Thou hast comforted me!
speaker: Narrator

text: By sons of Korah. -- A Psalm, a song. His foundation [is] in holy mountains.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jehovah is loving the gates of Zion Above all the tabernacles of Jacob.
speaker: Narrator

text: Honourable things are spoken in Thee, O city of God. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: I mention Rahab and Babel to those knowing Me, Lo, Philistia, and Tyre, with Cush! This [one] was born there.
speaker: Narrator

text: And of Zion it is said: Each one was born in her, And He, the Most High, doth establish her.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jehovah doth recount in the describing of the peoples, `This [one] was born there.' Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Singers also as players on instruments, All my fountains [are] in Thee!
speaker: Narrator

text: A Song, a Psalm, by sons of Korah, to the Overseer, `Concerning the Sickness of Afflictions.' -- An instruction, by Heman the Ezrahite. O Jehovah, God of my salvation, Daily I have cried, nightly before Thee,
speaker: Narrator

text: My prayer cometh in before Thee, Incline Thine ear to my loud cry,
speaker: Narrator

text: For my soul hath been full of evils, And my life hath come to Sheol.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have been reckoned with those going down [to] the pit, I have been as a man without strength.
speaker: Narrator

text: Among the dead -- free, As pierced ones lying in the grave, Whom Thou hast not remembered any more, Yea, they by Thy hand have been cut off.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast put me in the lowest pit, In dark places, in depths.
speaker: Narrator

text: Upon me hath Thy fury lain, And [with] all Thy breakers Thou hast afflicted. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast put mine acquaintance far from me, Thou hast made me an abomination to them, Shut up -- I go not forth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Mine eye hath grieved because of affliction, I called Thee, O Jehovah, all the day, I have spread out unto Thee my hands.
speaker: Narrator

text: To the dead dost Thou do wonders? Do Rephaim rise? do they thank Thee? Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Is Thy kindness recounted in the grave? Thy faithfulness in destruction?
speaker: Narrator

text: Are Thy wonders known in the darkness? And Thy righteousness in the land of forgetfulness?
speaker: Narrator

text: And I, unto Thee, O Jehovah, I have cried, And in the morning doth my prayer come before Thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Why, O Jehovah, castest Thou off my soul? Thou hidest Thy face from me.
speaker: Narrator

text: I [am] afflicted, and expiring from youth, I have borne Thy terrors -- I pine away.
speaker: Narrator

text: Over me hath Thy wrath passed, Thy terrors have cut me off,
speaker: Narrator

text: They have surrounded me as waters all the day, They have gone round against me together,
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast put far from me lover and friend, Mine acquaintance [is] the place of darkness!
speaker: Narrator

text: An instruction, by Ethan the Ezrahite. Of the kind acts of Jehovah, to the age I sing, To all generations I make known Thy faithfulness with my mouth,
speaker: Narrator

text: For I said, `To the age is kindness built, The heavens! Thou dost establish Thy faithfulness in them.'
speaker: Narrator

text: I have made a covenant for My chosen, I have sworn to David My servant:
speaker: Narrator

text: `Even to the age do I establish thy seed, And have built to generation and generation thy throne. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: and the heavens confess Thy wonders, O Jehovah, Thy faithfulness also [is] in an assembly of holy ones.
speaker: Narrator

text: For who in the sky, Compareth himself to Jehovah? Is like to Jehovah among sons of the mighty?
speaker: Narrator

text: God is very terrible, In the secret counsel of His holy ones, And fearful over all surrounding Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Jehovah, God of Hosts, Who [is] like Thee -- a strong Jah? And Thy faithfulness [is] round about Thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou [art] ruler over the pride of the sea, In the lifting up of its billows Thou dost restrain them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast bruised Rahab, as one wounded. With the arm of Thy strength Thou hast scattered Thine enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thine [are] the heavens -- the earth also [is] Thine, The habitable world and its fulness, Thou hast founded them.
speaker: Narrator

text: North and south Thou hast appointed them, Tabor and Hermon in Thy name do sing.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast an arm with might, Strong is Thy hand -- high Thy right hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: Righteousness and judgment [Are] the fixed place of Thy throne, Kindness and truth go before Thy face.
speaker: Narrator

text: O the happiness of the people knowing the shout, O Jehovah, in the light of Thy face they walk habitually.
speaker: Narrator

text: In Thy name they rejoice all the day, And in Thy righteousness they are exalted,
speaker: Narrator

text: For the beauty of their strength [art] Thou, And in Thy good will is our horn exalted,
speaker: Narrator

text: For of Jehovah [is] our shield, And of the Holy One of Israel our king.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Thou hast spoken in vision, To Thy saint, yea, Thou sayest, I have placed help upon a mighty one, Exalted a chosen one out of the people,
speaker: Narrator

text: I have found David My servant, With My holy oil I have anointed him.
speaker: Narrator

text: With whom My hand is established, My arm also doth strengthen him.
speaker: Narrator

text: An enemy exacteth not upon him, And a son of perverseness afflicteth him not.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I have beaten down before him his adversaries, And those hating him I plague,
speaker: Narrator

text: And My faithfulness and kindness [are] with him, And in My name is his horn exalted.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I have set on the sea his hand, And on the rivers his right hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: He proclaimeth me: `Thou [art] my Father, My God, and the rock of my salvation.'
speaker: Narrator

text: I also first-born do appoint him, Highest of the kings of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: To the age I keep for him My kindness, And My covenant [is] stedfast with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I have set his seed for ever, And his throne as the days of the heavens.
speaker: Narrator

text: If his sons forsake My law, And in My judgments do not walk;
speaker: Narrator

text: If My statutes they pollute, And My commands do not keep,
speaker: Narrator

text: I have looked after with a rod their transgression, And with strokes their iniquity,
speaker: Narrator

text: And My kindness I break not from him, Nor do I deal falsely in My faithfulness.
speaker: Narrator

text: I profane not My covenant, And that which is going forth from My lips I change not.
speaker: Narrator

text: Once I have sworn by My holiness, I lie not to David,
speaker: Narrator

text: His seed is to the age, And his throne [is] as the sun before Me,
speaker: Narrator

text: As the moon it is established -- to the age, And the witness in the sky is stedfast. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Thou, Thou hast cast off, and dost reject, Thou hast shown Thyself wroth With Thine anointed,
speaker: Narrator

text: Hast rejected the covenant of Thy servant, Thou hast polluted to the earth his crown,
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast broken down all his hedges, Thou hast made his fenced places a ruin.
speaker: Narrator

text: Spoiled him have all passing by the way, He hath been a reproach to his neighbours,
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast exalted the right hand of his adversaries, Thou hast caused all his enemies to rejoice.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also -- Thou turnest back the sharpness of his sword, And hast not established him in battle,
speaker: Narrator

text: Hast caused [him] to cease from his brightness, And his throne to the earth hast cast down.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast shortened the days of his youth, Hast covered him over [with] shame. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Till when, O Jehovah, art Thou hidden? For ever doth Thy fury burn as fire?
speaker: Narrator

text: Remember, I pray Thee, what [is] life-time? Wherefore in vain hast Thou created All the sons of men?
speaker: Narrator

text: Who [is] the man that liveth, and doth not see death? He delivereth his soul from the hand of Sheol. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Where [are] Thy former kindnesses, O Lord. Thou hast sworn to David in Thy faithfulness,
speaker: Narrator

text: Remember, O Lord, the reproach of Thy servants, I have borne in my bosom all the strivings of the peoples,
speaker: Narrator

text: Wherewith Thine enemies reproached, O Jehovah, Wherewith they have reproached The steps of Thine anointed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed [is] Jehovah to the age. Amen, and amen!
speaker: Narrator

text: A Prayer of Moses, the man of God. Lord, a habitation Thou -- Thou hast been, To us -- in generation and generation,
speaker: Narrator

text: Before mountains were brought forth, And Thou dost form the earth and the world, Even from age unto age Thou [art] God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou turnest man unto a bruised thing, And sayest, Turn back, ye sons of men.
speaker: Narrator

text: For a thousand years in Thine eyes [are] as yesterday, For it passeth on, yea, a watch by night.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast inundated them, they are asleep, In the morning as grass he changeth.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the morning it flourisheth, and hath changed, At evening it is cut down, and hath withered.
speaker: Narrator

text: For we were consumed in Thine anger, And in Thy fury we have been troubled.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast set our iniquities before Thee, Our hidden things at the light of Thy face,
speaker: Narrator

text: For all our days pined away in Thy wrath, We consumed our years as a meditation.
speaker: Narrator

text: Days of our years, in them [are] seventy years, And if, by reason of might, eighty years, Yet [is] their enlargement labour and vanity, For it hath been cut off hastily, and we fly away.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who knoweth the power of Thine anger? And according to Thy fear -- Thy wrath?
speaker: Narrator

text: To number our days aright let [us] know, And we bring the heart to wisdom.
speaker: Narrator

text: Turn back, O Jehovah, till when? And repent concerning Thy servants.
speaker: Narrator

text: Satisfy us at morn [with] Thy kindness, And we sing and rejoice all our days.
speaker: Narrator

text: Cause us to rejoice according to the days Wherein Thou hast afflicted us, The years we have seen evil.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let Thy work appear unto Thy servants, And Thine honour on their sons.
speaker: Narrator

text: And let the pleasantness of Jehovah our God be upon us, And the work of our hands establish on us, Yea, the work of our hands establish it!
speaker: Narrator

text: He who is dwelling In the secret place of the Most High, In the shade of the Mighty lodgeth habitually,
speaker: Narrator

text: He is saying of Jehovah, `My refuge, and my bulwark, my God, I trust in Him,'
speaker: Narrator

text: For He delivereth thee from the snare of a fowler, From a calamitous pestilence.
speaker: Narrator

text: With His pinion He covereth thee over, And under His wings thou dost trust, A shield and buckler [is] His truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou art not afraid of fear by night, Of arrow that flieth by day,
speaker: Narrator

text: Of pestilence in thick darkness that walketh, Of destruction that destroyeth at noon,
speaker: Narrator

text: There fall at thy side a thousand, And a myriad at thy right hand, Unto thee it cometh not nigh.
speaker: Narrator

text: But with thine eyes thou lookest, And the reward of the wicked thou seest,
speaker: Narrator

text: (For Thou, O Jehovah, [art] my refuge,) The Most High thou madest thy habitation.
speaker: Narrator

text: Evil happeneth not unto thee, And a plague cometh not near thy tent,
speaker: Narrator

text: For His messengers He chargeth for thee, To keep thee in all thy ways,
speaker: Narrator

text: On the hands they bear thee up, Lest thou smite against a stone thy foot.
speaker: Narrator

text: On lion and asp thou treadest, Thou trampest young lion and dragon.
speaker: Narrator

text: Because in Me he hath delighted, I also deliver him -- I set him on high, Because he hath known My name.
speaker: Narrator

text: He doth call Me, and I answer him, I [am] with him in distress, I deliver him, and honour him.
speaker: Narrator

text: With length of days I satisfy him, And I cause him to look on My salvation!
speaker: Narrator

text: A Psalm. -- A Song for the sabbath-day. Good to give thanks to Jehovah, And to sing praises to Thy name, O Most High,
speaker: Narrator

text: To declare in the morning Thy kindness, And Thy faithfulness in the nights.
speaker: Narrator

text: On ten strings and on psaltery, On higgaion, with harp.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Thou hast caused me to rejoice, O Jehovah, in Thy work, Concerning the works of Thy hands I sing.
speaker: Narrator

text: How great have been Thy works, O Jehovah, Very deep have been Thy thoughts.
speaker: Narrator

text: A brutish man doth not know, And a fool understandeth not this; --
speaker: Narrator

text: When the wicked flourish as a herb, And blossom do all workers of iniquity -- For their being destroyed for ever and ever!
speaker: Narrator

text: And Thou [art] high to the age, O Jehovah.
speaker: Narrator

text: For, lo, Thine enemies, O Jehovah, For, lo, Thine enemies, do perish, Separate themselves do all workers of iniquity.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Thou exaltest as a reem my horn, I have been anointed with fresh oil.
speaker: Narrator

text: And mine eye looketh on mine enemies, Of those rising up against me, The evil doers, do mine ears hear.
speaker: Narrator

text: The righteous as a palm-tree flourisheth, As a cedar in Lebanon he groweth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those planted in the house of Jehovah, In the courts of our God do flourish.
speaker: Narrator

text: Still they bring forth in old age, Fat and flourishing are they,
speaker: Narrator

text: To declare that upright [is] Jehovah my rock, And there is no perverseness in Him!
speaker: Narrator

text: Jehovah hath reigned, Excellency He hath put on, Jehovah put on strength, He girded Himself, Also -- established is the world, unmoved.
speaker: Narrator

text: Established is Thy throne since then, From the age Thou [art].
speaker: Narrator

text: Floods have lifted up, O Jehovah, Floods have lifted up their voice, Floods lift up their breakers.
speaker: Narrator

text: Than the voices of many mighty waters, Breakers of a sea, mighty on high [is] Jehovah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy testimonies have been very stedfast, To Thy house comely [is] holiness, O Jehovah, for length of days!
speaker: Narrator

text: God of vengeance -- Jehovah! God of vengeance, shine forth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be lifted up, O Judge of the earth, Send back a recompence on the proud.
speaker: Narrator

text: Till when [do] the wicked, O Jehovah? Till when do the wicked exult?
speaker: Narrator

text: They utter -- they speak an old saw, All working iniquity do boast themselves.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy people, O Jehovah, they bruise, And Thine inheritance they afflict.
speaker: Narrator

text: Widow and sojourner they slay, And fatherless ones they murder.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they say, `Jehovah doth not see, And the God of Jacob doth not consider.'
speaker: Narrator

text: Consider, ye brutish among the people, And ye foolish, when do ye act wisely?
speaker: Narrator

text: He who planteth the ear doth He not hear? He who formeth the eye doth He not see?
speaker: Narrator

text: He who is instructing nations, Doth He not reprove? He who is teaching man knowledge [is] Jehovah.
speaker: Narrator

text: He knoweth the thoughts of man, that they [are] vanity.
speaker: Narrator

text: O the happiness of the man Whom Thou instructest, O Jah, And out of Thy law teachest him,
speaker: Narrator

text: To give rest to him from days of evil, While a pit is digged for the wicked.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Jehovah leaveth not His people, And His inheritance forsaketh not.
speaker: Narrator

text: For to righteousness judgment turneth back, And after it all the upright of heart,
speaker: Narrator

text: Who riseth up for me with evil doers? Who stationeth himself for me with workers of iniquity?
speaker: Narrator

text: Unless Jehovah [were] a help to me, My soul had almost inhabited silence.
speaker: Narrator

text: If I have said, `My foot hath slipped,' Thy kindness, O Jehovah, supporteth me.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the abundance of my thoughts within me, Thy comforts delight my soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: Is a throne of mischief joined [with] Thee? A framer of perverseness by statute?
speaker: Narrator

text: They decree against the soul of the righteous, And innocent blood declare wicked.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jehovah is for a high place to me, And my God [is] for a rock -- my refuge,
speaker: Narrator

text: And turneth back on them their iniquity, And in their wickedness cutteth them off; Jehovah our God doth cut them off!
speaker: Narrator

text: Come, we sing to Jehovah, We shout to the rock of our salvation.
speaker: Narrator

text: We come before His face with thanksgiving, With psalms we shout to Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: For a great God [is] Jehovah, And a great king over all gods.
speaker: Narrator

text: In whose hand [are] the deep places of earth, And the strong places of hills [are] His.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whose is the sea, and He made it, And His hands formed the dry land.
speaker: Narrator

text: Come in, we bow ourselves, and we bend, We kneel before Jehovah our Maker.
speaker: Narrator

text: For He [is] our God, and we the people of His pasture, And the flock of His hand, To-day, if to His voice ye hearken,
speaker: Narrator

text: Harden not your heart as [in] Meribah, As [in] the day of Massah in the wilderness,
speaker: Narrator

text: Where your fathers have tried Me, Have proved Me, yea, have seen My work.
speaker: Narrator

text: Forty years I am weary of the generation, And I say, `A people erring in heart -- they! And they have not known My ways:'
speaker: Narrator

text: Where I sware in Mine anger, `If they come in unto My rest -- !'
speaker: Narrator

text: Sing to Jehovah a new song, Sing to Jehovah all the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Sing to Jehovah, bless His name, Proclaim from day to day His salvation.
speaker: Narrator

text: Declare among nations His honour, Among all the peoples His wonders.
speaker: Narrator

text: For great [is] Jehovah, and praised greatly, Fearful He [is] over all gods.
speaker: Narrator

text: For all the gods of the peoples [are] nought, And Jehovah made the heavens.
speaker: Narrator

text: Honour and majesty [are] before Him, Strength and beauty in His sanctuary.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ascribe to Jehovah, O families of the peoples, Ascribe to Jehovah honour and strength.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ascribe to Jehovah the honour of His name, Lift up a present and come in to His courts.
speaker: Narrator

text: Bow yourselves to Jehovah, In the honour of holiness, Be afraid of His presence, all the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Say among nations, `Jehovah hath reigned, Also -- established is the world, unmoved, He judgeth the peoples in uprightness.'
speaker: Narrator

text: The heavens joy, and the earth is joyful, The sea and its fulness roar.
speaker: Narrator

text: The field exulteth, and all that [is] in it, Then sing do all trees of the forest,
speaker: Narrator

text: Before Jehovah, for He hath come, For He hath come to judge the earth. He judgeth the world in righteousness, And the peoples in His faithfulness!
speaker: Narrator

text: Jehovah hath reigned, The earth is joyful, many isles rejoice.
speaker: Narrator

text: Cloud and darkness [are] round about Him, Righteousness and judgment the basis of His throne.
speaker: Narrator

text: Fire before Him goeth, And burneth round about His adversaries.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lightened have His lightnings the world, The earth hath seen, and is pained.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hills, like wax, melted before Jehovah, Before the Lord of all the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: The heavens declared His righteousness, And all the peoples have seen His honour.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ashamed are all servants of a graven image, Those boasting themselves in idols, Bow yourselves to him, all ye gods.
speaker: Narrator

text: Zion hath heard and rejoiceth, And daughters of Judah are joyful, Because of Thy judgments, O Jehovah.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Thou, Jehovah, [art] Most High over all the earth, Greatly Thou hast been exalted over all gods.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye who love Jehovah, hate evil, He is keeping the souls of His saints, From the hand of the wicked he delivereth them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Light [is] sown for the righteous, And for the upright of heart -- joy.
speaker: Narrator

text: Rejoice, ye righteous, in Jehovah, And give thanks at the remembrance of his holiness!
speaker: Narrator

text: A Psalm. Sing ye to Jehovah a new song, For wonders He hath done, Given salvation to Him hath His right hand and His holy arm.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jehovah hath made known His salvation, Before the eyes of the nations, He hath revealed His righteousness,
speaker: Narrator

text: He hath remembered His kindness, And His faithfulness to the house of Israel, All ends of earth have seen the salvation of our God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Shout to Jehovah, all the earth, Break forth, and cry aloud, and sing.
speaker: Narrator

text: Sing to Jehovah with harp, With harp, and voice of praise,
speaker: Narrator

text: With trumpets, and voice of a cornet, Shout ye before the king Jehovah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Roar doth the sea and its fulness, The world and the inhabitants in it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Floods clap hand, together hills cry aloud,
speaker: Narrator

text: Before Jehovah, For He hath come to judge the earth, He judgeth the world in righteousness, And the people in uprightness!
speaker: Narrator

text: Jehovah hath reigned, peoples tremble, The Inhabitant of the cherubs, the earth shaketh.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jehovah in Zion [is] great, And high He [is] over all the peoples.
speaker: Narrator

text: They praise Thy name, `Great, and fearful, holy [it] is.'
speaker: Narrator

text: And the strength of the king Hath loved judgment, Thou -- Thou hast established uprightness; Judgment and righteousness in Jacob, Thou -- Thou hast done.
speaker: Narrator

text: Exalt ye Jehovah our God, And bow yourselves at His footstool, holy [is] He.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses and Aaron among His priests, And Samuel among those proclaiming His name. They are calling unto Jehovah, And He doth answer them.
speaker: Narrator

text: In a pillar of cloud He speaketh unto them, They have kept His testimonies, And the statute He hath given to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Jehovah, our God, Thou hast afflicted them, A God forgiving Thou hast been to them, And taking vengeance on their actions.
speaker: Narrator

text: Exalt ye Jehovah our God, And bow yourselves at His holy hill, For holy [is] Jehovah our God!
speaker: Narrator

text: A Psalm of Thanksgiving. Shout to Jehovah, all the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Serve Jehovah with joy, come before him with singing.
speaker: Narrator

text: Know that Jehovah He [is] God, He made us, and we are His, His people -- and the flock of His pasture.
speaker: Narrator

text: Enter ye His gates with thanksgiving, His courts with praise, Give ye thanks to Him, bless ye His Name.
speaker: Narrator

text: For good [is] Jehovah, to the age His kindness, And to generation and generation His faithfulness!
speaker: Narrator

text: A Psalm of David. Kindness and judgment I sing, To Thee, O Jehovah, I sing praise.
speaker: Narrator

text: I act wisely in a perfect way, When dost Thou come in unto me? I walk habitually in the integrity of my heart, In the midst of my house.
speaker: Narrator

text: I set not before mine eyes a worthless thing, The work of those turning aside I have hated, It adhereth not to me.
speaker: Narrator

text: A perverse heart turneth aside from me, Wickedness I know not.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whoso slandereth in secret his neighbour, Him I cut off, The high of eyes and proud of heart, him I endure not.
speaker: Narrator

text: Mine eyes are on the faithful of the land, To dwell with me, Whoso is walking in a perfect way, he serveth me.
speaker: Narrator

text: He dwelleth not in my house who is working deceit, Whoso is speaking lies Is not established before mine eyes.
speaker: Narrator

text: At morning I cut off all the wicked of the land, To cut off from the city of Jehovah All the workers of iniquity!
speaker: Narrator

text: A Prayer of the afflicted when he is feeble, and before Jehovah poureth out his plaint. O Jehovah, hear my prayer, yea, my cry to Thee cometh.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hide not Thou Thy face from me, In a day of mine adversity, Incline unto me Thine ear, In the day I call, haste, answer me.
speaker: Narrator

text: For consumed in smoke have been my days, And my bones as a fire-brand have burned.
speaker: Narrator

text: Smitten as the herb, and withered, is my heart, For I have forgotten to eat my bread.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the voice of my sighing Hath my bone cleaved to my flesh.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have been like to a pelican of the wilderness, I have been as an owl of the dry places.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have watched, and I am As a bird alone on the roof.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the day mine enemies reproached me, Those mad at me have sworn against me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Because ashes as bread I have eaten, And my drink with weeping have mingled,
speaker: Narrator

text: From Thine indignation and Thy wrath, For Thou hast lifted me up, And dost cast me down.
speaker: Narrator

text: My days as a shadow [are] stretched out, And I -- as the herb I am withered.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Thou, O Jehovah, to the age abidest, And Thy memorial to all generations.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou -- Thou risest -- Thou pitiest Zion, For the time to favour her, For the appointed time hath come.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Thy servants have been pleased with her stones, And her dust they favour.
speaker: Narrator

text: And nations fear the name of Jehovah, And all kings of the earth Thine honour,
speaker: Narrator

text: For Jehovah hath builded Zion, He hath been seen in His honour,
speaker: Narrator

text: He turned unto the prayer of the destitute, And He hath not despised their prayer.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is written for a later generation, And the people created do praise Jah.
speaker: Narrator

text: For He hath looked From the high place of His sanctuary. Jehovah from heaven unto earth looked attentively,
speaker: Narrator

text: To hear the groan of the prisoner, To loose sons of death,
speaker: Narrator

text: To declare in Zion the name of Jehovah, And His praise in Jerusalem,
speaker: Narrator

text: In the peoples being gathered together, And the kingdoms -- to serve Jehovah.
speaker: Narrator

text: He hath humbled in the way my power, He hath shortened my days.
speaker: Narrator

text: I say, `My God, take me not up in the midst of my days,' Through all generations [are] Thine years.
speaker: Narrator

text: Beforetime the earth Thou didst found, And the work of Thy hands [are] the heavens.
speaker: Narrator

text: They -- They perish, and Thou remainest, And all of them as a garment become old, As clothing Thou changest them, And they are changed.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Thou [art] the same, and Thine years are not finished.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Thy servants do continue, And their seed before Thee is established!
speaker: Narrator

text: By David. Bless, O my soul, Jehovah, And all my inward parts -- His Holy Name.
speaker: Narrator

text: Bless, O my soul, Jehovah, And forget not all His benefits,
speaker: Narrator

text: Who is forgiving all thine iniquities, Who is healing all thy diseases,
speaker: Narrator

text: Who is redeeming from destruction thy life, Who is crowning thee -- kindness and mercies,
speaker: Narrator

text: Who is satisfying with good thy desire, Renew itself as an eagle doth thy youth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jehovah is doing righteousness and judgments For all the oppressed.
speaker: Narrator

text: He maketh known His ways to Moses, To the sons of Israel His acts.
speaker: Narrator

text: Merciful and gracious [is] Jehovah, Slow to anger, and abundant in mercy.
speaker: Narrator

text: Not for ever doth He strive, Nor to the age doth He watch.
speaker: Narrator

text: Not according to our sins hath He done to us, Nor according to our iniquities Hath He conferred benefits upon us.
speaker: Narrator

text: For, as the height of the heavens [is] above the earth, His kindness hath been mighty over those fearing Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: As the distance of east from west He hath put far from us our transgressions.
speaker: Narrator

text: As a father hath mercy on sons, Jehovah hath mercy on those fearing Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: For He hath known our frame, Remembering that we [are] dust.
speaker: Narrator

text: Mortal man! as grass [are] his days, As a flower of the field so he flourisheth;
speaker: Narrator

text: For a wind hath passed over it, and it is not, And its place doth not discern it any more.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the kindness of Jehovah [Is] from age even unto age on those fearing Him, And His righteousness to sons' sons,
speaker: Narrator

text: To those keeping His covenant, And to those remembering His precepts to do them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jehovah in the heavens Hath established His throne, And His kingdom over all hath ruled.
speaker: Narrator

text: Bless Jehovah, ye His messengers, Mighty in power -- doing His word, To hearken to the voice of His Word.
speaker: Narrator

text: Bless Jehovah, all ye His hosts, His ministers -- doing His pleasure.
speaker: Narrator

text: Bless Jehovah, all ye His works, In all places of His dominion. Bless, O my soul, Jehovah!
speaker: Narrator

text: Bless, O my soul, Jehovah! Jehovah, my God, Thou hast been very great, Honour and majesty Thou hast put on.
speaker: Narrator

text: Covering himself [with] light as a garment, Stretching out the heavens as a curtain,
speaker: Narrator

text: Who is laying the beam of His upper chambers in the waters, Who is making thick clouds His chariot, Who is walking on wings of wind,
speaker: Narrator

text: Making His messengers -- the winds, His ministers -- the flaming fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: He hath founded earth on its bases, It is not moved to the age and for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: The abyss! as with clothing Thou hast covered it, Above hills do waters stand.
speaker: Narrator

text: From Thy rebuke they flee, From the voice of Thy thunder haste away.
speaker: Narrator

text: They go up hills -- they go down valleys, Unto a place Thou hast founded for them.
speaker: Narrator

text: A border Thou hast set, they pass not over, They turn not back to cover the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who is sending forth fountains in valleys, Between hills they go on.
speaker: Narrator

text: They water every beast of the field, Wild asses break their thirst.
speaker: Narrator

text: By them the fowl of the heavens doth dwell, From between the branches They give forth the voice.
speaker: Narrator

text: Watering hills from His upper chambers, From the fruit of Thy works is the earth satisfied.
speaker: Narrator

text: Causing grass to spring up for cattle, And herb for the service of man, To bring forth bread from the earth,
speaker: Narrator

text: And wine -- it rejoiceth the heart of man, To cause the face to shine from oil, And bread -- the heart of man it supporteth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Satisfied [are] the trees of Jehovah, Cedars of Lebanon that He hath planted,
speaker: Narrator

text: Where birds do make nests, The stork -- the firs [are] her house.
speaker: Narrator

text: The high hills [are] for wild goats, Rocks [are] a refuge for conies,
speaker: Narrator

text: He made the moon for seasons, The sun hath known his place of entrance.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou settest darkness, and it is night, In it doth every beast of the forest creep.
speaker: Narrator

text: The young lions are roaring for prey, And to seek from God their food.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sun riseth, they are gathered, And in their dens they crouch.
speaker: Narrator

text: Man goeth forth to his work, And to his service -- till evening.
speaker: Narrator

text: How many have been Thy works, O Jehovah, All of them in wisdom Thou hast made, Full is the earth of thy possessions.
speaker: Narrator

text: This, the sea, great and broad of sides, There [are] moving things -- innumerable, Living creatures -- small with great.
speaker: Narrator

text: There do ships go: leviathan, That Thou hast formed to play in it.
speaker: Narrator

text: All of them unto Thee do look, To give their food in its season.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou dost give to them -- they gather, Thou dost open Thy hand -- they [are] satisfied [with] good.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hidest Thy face -- they are troubled, Thou gatherest their spirit -- they expire, And unto their dust they turn back.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou sendest out Thy Spirit, they are created, And Thou renewest the face of the ground.
speaker: Narrator

text: The honour of Jehovah is to the age, Jehovah rejoiceth in His works,
speaker: Narrator

text: Who is looking to earth, and it trembleth, He cometh against hills, and they smoke.
speaker: Narrator

text: I sing to Jehovah during my life, I sing praise to my God while I exist.
speaker: Narrator

text: Sweet is my meditation on Him, I -- I do rejoice in Jehovah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Consumed are sinners from the earth, And the wicked are no more. Bless, O my soul, Jehovah. Praise ye Jehovah!
speaker: Narrator

text: Give ye thanks to Jehovah -- call ye in His name, Make known among the peoples His acts.
speaker: Narrator

text: Sing ye to Him -- sing praise to Him, Meditate ye on all His wonders.
speaker: Narrator

text: Boast yourselves in His Holy Name, The heart of those seeking Jehovah rejoiceth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Seek ye Jehovah and His strength, Seek ye His face continually.
speaker: Narrator

text: Remember His wonders that He did, His signs and the judgments of His mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text: O seed of Abraham, His servant, O sons of Jacob, His chosen ones.
speaker: Narrator

text: He [is] Jehovah our God, In all the earth [are] His judgments.
speaker: Narrator

text: He hath remembered to the age His covenant, The word He commanded to a thousand generations,
speaker: Narrator

text: That He hath made with Abraham, And His oath to Isaac,
speaker: Narrator

text: And doth establish it to Jacob for a statute, To Israel -- a covenant age-during,
speaker: Narrator

text: Saying, `To thee I give the land of Canaan, The portion of your inheritance,'
speaker: Narrator

text: In their being few in number, But a few, and sojourners in it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they go up and down, from nation unto nation, From a kingdom unto another people.
speaker: Narrator

text: He hath not suffered any to oppress them And He reproveth for their sakes kings.
speaker: Narrator

text: `Strike not against Mine anointed, And to My prophets do not evil.'
speaker: Narrator

text: And He calleth a famine on the land, The whole staff of bread He hath broken.
speaker: Narrator

text: He hath sent before them a man, For a servant hath Joseph been sold.
speaker: Narrator

text: They have afflicted with fetters his feet, Iron hath entered his soul,
speaker: Narrator

text: Till the time of the coming of His word The saying of Jehovah hath tried him.
speaker: Narrator

text: The king hath sent, and looseth him, The ruler of the peoples, and draweth him out.
speaker: Narrator

text: He hath made him lord of his house, And ruler over all his possessions.
speaker: Narrator

text: To bind his chiefs at his pleasure, And his elders he maketh wise.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Israel cometh in to Egypt, And Jacob hath sojourned in the land of Ham.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He maketh His people very fruitful, And maketh it mightier than its adversaries.
speaker: Narrator

text: He turned their heart to hate His people, To conspire against His servants.
speaker: Narrator

text: He hath sent Moses His servant, Aaron whom He had fixed on.
speaker: Narrator

text: They have set among them the matters of His signs, And wonders in the land of Ham.
speaker: Narrator

text: He hath sent darkness, and it is dark, And they have not provoked His word.
speaker: Narrator

text: He hath turned their waters to blood, And putteth to death their fish.
speaker: Narrator

text: Teemed hath their land [with] frogs, In the inner chambers of their kings.
speaker: Narrator

text: He hath said, and the beetle cometh, Lice into all their border.
speaker: Narrator

text: He hath made their showers hail, A flaming fire [is] in their land.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He smiteth their vine and their fig, And shivereth the trees of their border.
speaker: Narrator

text: He hath said, and the locust cometh, And the cankerworm -- innumerable,
speaker: Narrator

text: And it consumeth every herb in their land, And it consumeth the fruit of their ground.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He smiteth every first-born in their land, The first-fruit of all their strength,
speaker: Narrator

text: And bringeth them out with silver and gold, And there is not in its tribes a feeble one.
speaker: Narrator

text: Rejoiced hath Egypt in their going forth, For their fear had fallen upon them.
speaker: Narrator

text: He hath spread a cloud for a covering, And fire to enlighten the night.
speaker: Narrator

text: They have asked, and He bringeth quails, And [with] bread of heaven satisfieth them.
speaker: Narrator

text: He hath opened a rock, and waters issue, They have gone on in dry places -- a river.
speaker: Narrator

text: For He hath remembered His holy word, With Abraham His servant,
speaker: Narrator

text: And He bringeth forth His people with joy, With singing His chosen ones.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He giveth to them the lands of nations, And the labour of peoples they possess,
speaker: Narrator

text: That they may observe His statutes, And His laws may keep. Praise ye Jehovah!
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise ye Jah, give thanks to Jehovah, For good, for to the age, [is] His kindness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who doth utter the mighty acts of Jehovah? Soundeth all His praise?
speaker: Narrator

text: O the happiness of those keeping judgment, Doing righteousness at all times.
speaker: Narrator

text: Remember me, O Jehovah, With the favour of Thy people, Look after me in Thy salvation.
speaker: Narrator

text: To look on the good of Thy chosen ones, To rejoice in the joy of Thy nation, To boast myself with Thine inheritance.
speaker: Narrator

text: We have sinned with our fathers, We have done perversely, we have done wickedly.
speaker: Narrator

text: Our fathers in Egypt, Have not considered wisely Thy wonders, They have not remembered The abundance of Thy kind acts, And provoke by the sea, at the sea of Suph.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He saveth them for His name's sake, To make known His might,
speaker: Narrator

text: And rebuketh the sea of Suph, and it is dried up, And causeth them to go Through depths as a wilderness.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He saveth them from the hand Of him who is hating, And redeemeth them from the hand of the enemy.
speaker: Narrator

text: And waters cover their adversaries, One of them hath not been left.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they believe in His words, they sing His praise,
speaker: Narrator

text: They have hasted -- forgotten His works, They have not waited for His counsel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they lust greatly in a wilderness, And try God in a desert.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He giveth to them their request, And sendeth leanness into their soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they are envious of Moses in the camp, Of Aaron, Jehovah's holy one.
speaker: Narrator

text: Earth openeth, and swalloweth up Dathan, And covereth over the company of Abiram.
speaker: Narrator

text: And fire burneth among their company, A flame setteth on fire the wicked.
speaker: Narrator

text: They make a calf in Horeb, And bow themselves to a molten image,
speaker: Narrator

text: And change their Honour Into the form of an ox eating herbs.
speaker: Narrator

text: They have forgotten God their saviour, The doer of great things in Egypt,
speaker: Narrator

text: Of wonderful things in the land of Ham, Of fearful things by the sea of Suph.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He saith to destroy them, Unless Moses, His chosen one, Had stood in the breach before Him, To turn back His wrath from destroying.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they kick against the desirable land, They have not given credence to His word.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they murmur in their tents, They have not hearkened to the voice of Jehovah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He lifteth up His hand to them, To cause them to fall in a wilderness,
speaker: Narrator

text: And to cause their seed to fall among nations, And to scatter them through lands.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they are coupled to Baal-Peor, And eat the sacrifices of the dead,
speaker: Narrator

text: And they provoke to anger by their actions, And a plague breaketh forth upon them,
speaker: Narrator

text: And Phinehas standeth, and executeth judgment, And the plague is restrained,
speaker: Narrator

text: And it is reckoned to him to righteousness, To all generations -- unto the age.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they cause wrath by the waters of Meribah, And it is evil to Moses for their sakes,
speaker: Narrator

text: For they have provoked his spirit, And he speaketh wrongfully with his lips.
speaker: Narrator

text: They have not destroyed the peoples, As Jehovah had said to them,
speaker: Narrator

text: And mix themselves among nations, and learn their works,
speaker: Narrator

text: And serve their idols, And they are to them for a snare.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they sacrifice their sons And their daughters to destroyers,
speaker: Narrator

text: And they shed innocent blood -- Blood of their sons and of their daughters, Whom they have sacrificed to idols of Canaan, And the land is profaned with blood.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they are defiled with their works, And commit whoredom in their habitual doings.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the anger of Jehovah Is kindled against His people, And He doth abominate His inheritance.
speaker: Narrator

text: And giveth them into the hand of nations, And those hating them rule over them,
speaker: Narrator

text: And their enemies oppress them, And they are humbled under their hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: Many times He doth deliver them, And they rebel in their counsel, And they are brought low in their iniquity.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He looketh on their distress When He heareth their cry,
speaker: Narrator

text: And remembereth for them His covenant, And is comforted, According to the abundance of His kindness.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He appointeth them for mercies Before all their captors.
speaker: Narrator

text: Save us, O Jehovah our God, and gather us from the nations, To give thanks to Thy holy name, To glory in Thy praise.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed [is] Jehovah, God of Israel, From the age even unto the age. And all the people said, `Amen, praise Jah!'
speaker: Narrator

text: `Give ye thanks to Jehovah, For good, for to the age [is] His kindness:'
speaker: Narrator

text: Let the redeemed of Jehovah say, Whom He redeemed from the hand of an adversary.
speaker: Narrator

text: And from the lands hath gathered them, From east and from west, From north, and from the sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: They wandered in a wilderness, in a desert by the way, A city of habitation they have not found.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hungry -- yea -- thirsty, Their soul in them becometh feeble,
speaker: Narrator

text: And they cry unto Jehovah in their adversity, From their distress He delivereth them,
speaker: Narrator

text: And causeth them to tread in a right way, To go unto a city of habitation.
speaker: Narrator

text: They confess to Jehovah His kindness, And His wonders to the sons of men.
speaker: Narrator

text: For He hath satisfied a longing soul, And a hungry soul hath filled [with] goodness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Inhabitants of dark places and death-shade, Prisoners of affliction and of iron,
speaker: Narrator

text: Because they changed the saying of God, And the counsel of the Most High despised.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He humbleth with labour their heart, They have been feeble, and there is no helper.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they cry unto Jehovah in their adversity, From their distresses He saveth them.
speaker: Narrator

text: He bringeth them out from the dark place, And death-shade, And their bands He draweth away.
speaker: Narrator

text: They confess to Jehovah His kindness, And His wonders to the sons of men.
speaker: Narrator

text: For He hath broken doors of brass, And bars of iron He hath cut.
speaker: Narrator

text: Fools, by means of their transgression, And by their iniquities, afflict themselves.
speaker: Narrator

text: All food doth their soul abominate, And they come nigh unto the gates of death,
speaker: Narrator

text: And cry unto Jehovah in their adversity, From their distresses He saveth them,
speaker: Narrator

text: He sendeth His word and healeth them, And delivereth from their destructions.
speaker: Narrator

text: They confess to Jehovah His kindness, And His wonders to the sons of men,
speaker: Narrator

text: And they sacrifice sacrifices of thanksgiving, And recount His works with singing.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those going down [to] the sea in ships, Doing business in many waters,
speaker: Narrator

text: They have seen the works of Jehovah, And His wonders in the deep.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He saith, and appointeth a tempest, And it lifteth up its billows,
speaker: Narrator

text: They go up [to] the heavens, they go down [to] the depths, Their soul in evil is melted.
speaker: Narrator

text: They reel to and fro, and move as a drunkard, And all their wisdom is swallowed up.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they cry to Jehovah in their adversity, And from their distresses He bringeth them out.
speaker: Narrator

text: He establisheth a whirlwind to a calm, And hushed are their billows.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they rejoice because they are quiet, And He leadeth them to the haven of their desire.
speaker: Narrator

text: They confess to Jehovah His kindness, And His wonders to the sons of men,
speaker: Narrator

text: And they exalt Him in the assembly of the people, And in the seat of the elders praise Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: He maketh rivers become a wilderness, And fountains of waters become dry land.
speaker: Narrator

text: A fruitful land becometh a barren place, For the wickedness of its inhabitants.
speaker: Narrator

text: He maketh a wilderness become a pool of water, And a dry land become fountains of waters.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He causeth the hungry to dwell there, And they prepare a city of habitation.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they sow fields, and plant vineyards, And they make fruits of increase.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He blesseth them, and they multiply exceedingly, And their cattle He doth not diminish.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they are diminished, and bow down, By restraint, evil, and sorrow.
speaker: Narrator

text: He is pouring contempt upon nobles, And causeth them to wander in vacancy -- no way.
speaker: Narrator

text: And setteth on high the needy from affliction, And placeth families as a flock.
speaker: Narrator

text: The upright do see and rejoice, And all perversity hath shut her mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who [is] wise, and observeth these? They understand the kind acts of Jehovah!
speaker: Narrator

text: A Song, a Psalm of David. Prepared is my heart, O God, I sing, yea, I sing praise, also my honour.
speaker: Narrator

text: Awake, psaltery and harp, I awake the dawn.
speaker: Narrator

text: I thank Thee among peoples, O Jehovah, And I praise Thee among the nations.
speaker: Narrator

text: For great above the heavens [is] Thy kindness, And unto the clouds Thy truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be Thou exalted above the heavens, O God, And above all the earth Thy honour.
speaker: Narrator

text: That Thy beloved ones may be delivered, Save [with] Thy right hand, and answer us.
speaker: Narrator

text: God hath spoken in His holiness: I exult, I apportion Shechem, And the valley of Succoth I measure,
speaker: Narrator

text: Mine [is] Gilead, mine [is] Manasseh, And Ephraim [is] the strength of my head, Judah [is] my lawgiver,
speaker: Narrator

text: Moab [is] a pot for my washing, Upon Edom I cast my shoe, Over Philistia I shout habitually.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who doth bring me in to the fenced city? Who hath led me unto Edom?
speaker: Narrator

text: Hast not Thou, O God, cast us off? And Thou goest not out, O God, with our hosts!
speaker: Narrator

text: Give to us help from adversity, And vain is the salvation of man.
speaker: Narrator

text: In God we do mightily, And He doth tread down our adversaries!
speaker: Narrator

text: To the Overseer. -- A Psalm of David. O God of my praise, be not silent,
speaker: Narrator

text: For the mouth of wickedness, and the mouth of deceit, Against me they have opened, They have spoken with me -- A tongue of falsehood, and words of hatred!
speaker: Narrator

text: They have compassed me about, And they fight me without cause.
speaker: Narrator

text: For my love they oppose me, and I -- prayer!
speaker: Narrator

text: And they set against me evil for good, And hatred for my love.
speaker: Narrator

text: Appoint Thou over him the wicked, And an adversary standeth at his right hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: In his being judged, he goeth forth wicked, And his prayer is for sin.
speaker: Narrator

text: His days are few, his oversight another taketh,
speaker: Narrator

text: His sons are fatherless, and his wife a widow.
speaker: Narrator

text: And wander continually do his sons, Yea, they have begged, And have sought out of their dry places.
speaker: Narrator

text: An exactor layeth a snare for all that he hath, And strangers spoil his labour.
speaker: Narrator

text: He hath none to extend kindness, Nor is there one showing favour to his orphans.
speaker: Narrator

text: His posterity is for cutting off, In another generation is their name blotted out.
speaker: Narrator

text: The iniquity of his fathers Is remembered unto Jehovah, And the sin of his mother is not blotted out.
speaker: Narrator

text: They are before Jehovah continually, And He cutteth off from earth their memorial.
speaker: Narrator

text: Because that he hath not remembered to do kindness, And pursueth the poor man and needy, And the smitten of heart -- to slay,
speaker: Narrator

text: And he loveth reviling, and it meeteth him, And he hath not delighted in blessing, And it is far from him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he putteth on reviling as his robe, And it cometh in as water into his midst, And as oil into his bones.
speaker: Narrator

text: It is to him as apparel -- he covereth himself, And for a continual girdle he girdeth it on.
speaker: Narrator

text: This [is] the wage of mine accusers from Jehovah, And of those speaking evil against my soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Thou, O Jehovah Lord, Deal with me for Thy name's sake, Because Thy kindness [is] good, deliver me.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I [am] poor and needy, And my heart hath been pierced in my midst.
speaker: Narrator

text: As a shadow when it is stretched out I have gone, I have been driven away as a locust.
speaker: Narrator

text: My knees have been feeble from fasting, And my flesh hath failed of fatness.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I -- I have been a reproach to them, They see me, they shake their head.
speaker: Narrator

text: Help me, O Jehovah my God, Save me, according to Thy kindness.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they know that this [is] Thy hand, Thou, O Jehovah, Thou hast done it.
speaker: Narrator

text: They revile, and Thou dost bless, They have risen, and are ashamed, And Thy servant doth rejoice.
speaker: Narrator

text: Mine accusers put on blushing, and are covered, As an upper robe [is] their shame.
speaker: Narrator

text: I thank Jehovah greatly with my mouth, And in the midst of many I praise Him,
speaker: Narrator

text: For He standeth at the right hand of the needy, To save from those judging his soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: A Psalm of David. The affirmation of Jehovah to my Lord: `Sit at My right hand, Till I make thine enemies thy footstool.'
speaker: Narrator

text: The rod of thy strength doth Jehovah send from Zion, Rule in the midst of thine enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy people [are] free-will gifts in the day of Thy strength, in the honours of holiness, From the womb, from the morning, Thou hast the dew of thy youth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jehovah hath sworn, and doth not repent, `Thou [art] a priest to the age, According to the order of Melchizedek.'
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord on thy right hand smote kings In the day of His anger.
speaker: Narrator

text: He doth judge among the nations, He hath completed the carcases, Hath smitten the head over the mighty earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: From a brook in the way he drinketh, Therefore he doth lift up the head!
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise ye Jah! I thank Jehovah with the whole heart, In the secret meeting of the upright, And of the company.
speaker: Narrator

text: Great [are] the works of Jehovah, Sought out by all desiring them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Honourable and majestic is His work, And His righteousness is standing for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: A memorial He hath made of His wonders, Gracious and merciful [is] Jehovah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Prey He hath given to those fearing Him, He remembereth to the age His covenant.
speaker: Narrator

text: The power of His works He hath declared to His people, To give to them the inheritance of nations.
speaker: Narrator

text: The works of His hands [are] true and just, Stedfast [are] all His appointments.
speaker: Narrator

text: They are sustained for ever to the age. They are made in truth and uprightness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Redemption He hath sent to His people, He hath appointed to the age His covenant, Holy and fearful [is] His name.
speaker: Narrator

text: The beginning of wisdom [is] fear of Jehovah, Good understanding have all doing them, His praise [is] standing for ever!
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise ye Jah! O the happiness of one fearing Jehovah, In His commands he hath delighted greatly.
speaker: Narrator

text: Mighty in the earth is his seed, The generation of the upright is blessed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Wealth and riches [are] in his house, And his righteousness is standing for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Light hath risen in darkness to the upright, Gracious, and merciful, and righteous.
speaker: Narrator

text: Good [is] the man -- gracious and lending, He sustaineth his matters in judgment.
speaker: Narrator

text: For -- to the age he is not moved; For a memorial age-during is the righteous.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of an evil report he is not afraid, Prepared is His heart, confident in Jehovah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Sustained is his heart -- he feareth not, Till that he look on his adversaries.
speaker: Narrator

text: He hath scattered -- hath given to the needy, His righteousness is standing for ever, His horn is exalted with honour.
speaker: Narrator

text: The wicked seeth, and hath been angry, His teeth he gnasheth, and hath melted, The desire of the wicked doth perish!
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise ye Jah! Praise, ye servants of Jehovah. Praise the name of Jehovah.
speaker: Narrator

text: The name of Jehovah is blessed, From henceforth, and unto the age.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the rising of the sun unto its going in, Praised [is] the name of Jehovah.
speaker: Narrator

text: High above all nations [is] Jehovah, Above the heavens [is] his honour.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who [is] as Jehovah our God, He is exalting [Himself] to sit?
speaker: Narrator

text: He is humbling [Himself] to look On the heavens and on the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: He is raising up from the dust the poor, From a dunghill He exalteth the needy.
speaker: Narrator

text: To cause to sit with princes, With the princes of His people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Causing the barren one of the house to sit, A joyful mother of sons; praise ye Jah!
speaker: Narrator

text: In the going out of Israel from Egypt, The house of Jacob from a strange people,
speaker: Narrator

text: Judah became His sanctuary, Israel his dominion.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sea hath seen, and fleeth, The Jordan turneth backward.
speaker: Narrator

text: The mountains have skipped as rams, Heights as sons of a flock.
speaker: Narrator

text: What -- to thee, O sea, that thou fleest? O Jordan, thou turnest back!
speaker: Narrator

text: O mountains, ye skip as rams! O heights, as sons of a flock!
speaker: Narrator

text: From before the Lord be afraid, O earth, From before the God of Jacob,
speaker: Narrator

text: He is turning the rock to a pool of waters, The flint to a fountain of waters!
speaker: Narrator

text: Not to us, O Jehovah, not to us, But to Thy name give honour, For Thy kindness, for Thy truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Why do the nations say, `Where, pray, [is] their God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And our God [is] in the heavens, All that He hath pleased He hath done.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their idols [are] silver and gold, work of man's hands,
speaker: Narrator

text: A mouth they have, and they speak not, Eyes they have, and they see not,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ears they have, and they hear not, A nose they have, and they smell not,
speaker: Narrator

text: Their hands, but they handle not, Their feet, and they walk not;
speaker: Narrator

text: Nor do they mutter through their throat, Like them are their makers, Every one who is trusting in them.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Israel, trust in Jehovah, `Their help and their shield [is] He.'
speaker: Narrator

text: O house of Aaron, trust in Jehovah, `Their help and their shield [is] He.'
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye fearing Jehovah, trust in Jehovah, `Their help and their shield [is] He.'
speaker: Narrator

text: Jehovah hath remembered us, He blesseth, He blesseth the house of Israel, He blesseth the house of Aaron,
speaker: Narrator

text: He blesseth those fearing Jehovah, The small with the great.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jehovah addeth to you, to you, and to your sons.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed [are] ye of Jehovah, maker of heaven and earth,
speaker: Narrator

text: The heavens -- the heavens [are] Jehovah's, And the earth He hath given to sons of men,
speaker: Narrator

text: The dead praise not Jah, Nor any going down to silence.
speaker: Narrator

text: And we, we bless Jah, From henceforth, and unto the age. Praise ye Jah!
speaker: Narrator

text: I have loved, because Jehovah heareth My voice, my supplication,
speaker: Narrator

text: Because He hath inclined His ear to me, And during my days I call.
speaker: Narrator

text: Compassed me have cords of death, And straits of Sheol have found me, Distress and sorrow I find.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in the name of Jehovah I call: I pray Thee, O Jehovah, deliver my soul,
speaker: Narrator

text: Gracious [is] Jehovah, and righteous, Yea, our God [is] merciful,
speaker: Narrator

text: A preserver of the simple [is] Jehovah, I was low, and to me He giveth salvation.
speaker: Narrator

text: Turn back, O my soul, to thy rest, For Jehovah hath conferred benefits on thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Thou hast delivered my soul from death, My eyes from tears, my feet from overthrowing.
speaker: Narrator

text: I walk habitually before Jehovah In the lands of the living.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have believed, for I speak, I -- I have been afflicted greatly.
speaker: Narrator

text: I said in my haste, `Every man [is] a liar.'
speaker: Narrator

text: What do I return to Jehovah? All His benefits [are] upon me.
speaker: Narrator

text: The cup of salvation I lift up, And in the name of Jehovah I call.
speaker: Narrator

text: My vows to Jehovah let me complete, I pray you, before all His people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Precious in the eyes of Jehovah [is] the death for His saints.
speaker: Narrator

text: Cause [it] to come, O Jehovah, for I [am] Thy servant. I [am] Thy servant, son of Thy handmaid, Thou hast opened my bonds.
speaker: Narrator

text: To Thee I sacrifice a sacrifice of thanks, And in the name of Jehovah I call.
speaker: Narrator

text: My vows to Jehovah let me complete, I pray you, before all His people,
speaker: Narrator

text: In the courts of the house of Jehovah, In thy midst, O Jerusalem, praise ye Jah!
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise Jehovah, all ye nations, Glorify Him, all ye peoples.
speaker: Narrator

text: For mighty to us hath been His kindness, And the truth of Jehovah [is] to the age. Praise ye Jah!
speaker: Narrator

text: Give ye thanks to Jehovah, For good, for to the age [is] His kindness.
speaker: Narrator

text: I pray you, let Israel say, That, to the age [is] His kindness.
speaker: Narrator

text: I pray you, let the house of Aaron say, That, to the age [is] His kindness.
speaker: Narrator

text: I pray you, let those fearing Jehovah say, That, to the age [is] His kindness.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the straitness I called Jah, Jah answered me in a broad place.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jehovah [is] for me, I do not fear what man doth to me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jehovah [is] for me among my helpers, And I -- I look on those hating me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Better to take refuge in Jehovah than to trust in man,
speaker: Narrator

text: Better to take refuge in Jehovah, Than to trust in princes.
speaker: Narrator

text: All nations have compassed me about, In the name of Jehovah I surely cut them off.
speaker: Narrator

text: They have compassed me about, Yea, they have compassed me about, In the name of Jehovah I surely cut them off.
speaker: Narrator

text: They compassed me about as bees, They have been extinguished as a fire of thorns, In the name of Jehovah I surely cut them off.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast sorely thrust me to fall, And Jehovah hath helped me.
speaker: Narrator

text: My strength and song [is] Jah, And He is to me for salvation.
speaker: Narrator

text: A voice of singing and salvation, [Is] in the tents of the righteous, The right hand of Jehovah is doing valiantly.
speaker: Narrator

text: The right hand of Jehovah is exalted, The right hand of Jehovah is doing valiantly.
speaker: Narrator

text: I do not die, but live, And recount the works of Jah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Jah hath sorely chastened me, And to death hath not given me up.
speaker: Narrator

text: Open ye to me gates of righteousness, I enter into them -- I thank Jah.
speaker: Narrator

text: This [is] the gate to Jehovah, The righteous enter into it.
speaker: Narrator

text: I thank Thee, for Thou hast answered me, And art to me for salvation.
speaker: Narrator

text: A stone the builders refused Hath become head of a corner.
speaker: Narrator

text: From Jehovah hath this been, It [is] wonderful in our eyes,
speaker: Narrator

text: This [is] the day Jehovah hath made, We rejoice and are glad in it.
speaker: Narrator

text: I beseech Thee, O Jehovah, save, I pray Thee, I beseech Thee, O Jehovah, prosper, I pray Thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed [is] he who is coming In the name of Jehovah, We blessed you from the house of Jehovah,
speaker: Narrator

text: God [is] Jehovah, and He giveth to us light, Direct ye the festal-sacrifice with cords, Unto the horns of the altar.
speaker: Narrator

text: My God Thou [art], and I confess Thee, My God, I exalt Thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Give ye thanks to Jehovah, For good, for to the age, [is] His kindness!
speaker: Narrator

text: [Aleph.] O the happiness of those perfect in the way, They are walking in the law of Jehovah,
speaker: Narrator

text: O the happiness of those keeping His testimonies, With the whole heart they seek Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yea, they have not done iniquity, In His ways they have walked.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast commanded us Thy precepts to keep diligently,
speaker: Narrator

text: O that my ways were prepared to keep Thy statutes,
speaker: Narrator

text: Then I am not ashamed In my looking unto all Thy commands.
speaker: Narrator

text: I confess Thee with uprightness of heart, In my learning the judgments of Thy righteousness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy statutes I keep, leave me not utterly!
speaker: Narrator

text: [Beth.] With what doth a young man purify his path? To observe -- according to Thy word.
speaker: Narrator

text: With all my heart I have sought Thee, Let me not err from Thy commands.
speaker: Narrator

text: In my heart I have hid Thy saying, That I sin not before Thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed [art] Thou, O Jehovah, teach me Thy statutes.
speaker: Narrator

text: With my lips I have recounted All the judgments of Thy mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the way of Thy testimonies I have joyed, As over all wealth.
speaker: Narrator

text: In Thy precepts I meditate, And I behold attentively Thy paths.
speaker: Narrator

text: In Thy statutes I delight myself, I do not forget Thy word.
speaker: Narrator

text: [Gimel.] Confer benefits on Thy servant, I live, and I keep Thy word.
speaker: Narrator

text: Uncover mine eyes, and I behold wonders out of Thy law.
speaker: Narrator

text: A sojourner I [am] on earth, Hide not from me Thy commands.
speaker: Narrator

text: Broken hath my soul for desire Unto Thy judgments at all times.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast rebuked the cursed proud, Who are erring from Thy commands.
speaker: Narrator

text: Remove from me reproach and contempt, For Thy testimonies I have kept.
speaker: Narrator

text: Princes also sat -- against me they spoke, Thy servant doth meditate in Thy statutes,
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy testimonies also [are] my delight, The men of my counsel!
speaker: Narrator

text: [Daleth.] Cleaved to the dust hath my soul, Quicken me according to Thy word.
speaker: Narrator

text: My ways I have recounted, And Thou answerest me, teach me Thy statutes,
speaker: Narrator

text: The way of Thy precepts cause me to understand, And I meditate in Thy wonders.
speaker: Narrator

text: My soul hath dropped from affliction, Establish me according to Thy word.
speaker: Narrator

text: The way of falsehood turn aside from me And with Thy law favour me.
speaker: Narrator

text: The way of faithfulness I have chosen, Thy judgments I have compared,
speaker: Narrator

text: I have adhered to Thy testimonies, O Jehovah, put me not to shame.
speaker: Narrator

text: The way of Thy commands I run, For Thou dost enlarge my heart!
speaker: Narrator

text: [He.] Show me, O Jehovah, the way of Thy statutes, And I keep it -- [to] the end.
speaker: Narrator

text: Cause me to understand, and I keep Thy law, And observe it with the whole heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: Cause me to tread in the path of Thy commands, For in it I have delighted.
speaker: Narrator

text: Incline my heart unto Thy testimonies, And not unto dishonest gain.
speaker: Narrator

text: Remove mine eyes from seeing vanity, In Thy way quicken Thou me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Establish to Thy servant Thy saying, That [is] concerning Thy fear.
speaker: Narrator

text: Remove my reproach that I have feared, For Thy judgments [are] good.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lo, I have longed for Thy precepts, In Thy righteousness quicken Thou me,
speaker: Narrator

text: [Waw.] And meet me doth Thy kindness, O Jehovah, Thy salvation according to Thy saying.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I answer him who is reproaching me a word, For I have trusted in Thy word.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Thou takest not utterly away From my mouth the word of truth, Because for Thy judgment I have hoped.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I keep Thy law continually, To the age and for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I walk habitually in a broad place, For Thy precepts I have sought.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I speak of Thy testimonies before kings, And I am not ashamed.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I delight myself in Thy commands, That I have loved,
speaker: Narrator

text: And I lift up my hands unto Thy commands, That I have loved, And I do meditate on Thy statutes!
speaker: Narrator

text: [Zain.] Remember the word to Thy servant, On which Thou hast caused me to hope.
speaker: Narrator

text: This [is] my comfort in mine affliction, That Thy saying hath quickened me.
speaker: Narrator

text: The proud have utterly scorned me, From Thy law I have not turned aside.
speaker: Narrator

text: I remembered Thy judgments of old, O Jehovah, And I comfort myself.
speaker: Narrator

text: Horror hath seized me, Because of the wicked forsaking Thy law.
speaker: Narrator

text: Songs have been to me Thy statutes, In the house of my sojournings.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have remembered in the night Thy name, O Jehovah, And I do keep Thy law.
speaker: Narrator

text: This hath been to me, That Thy precepts I have kept!
speaker: Narrator

text: [Cheth.] My portion [is] Jehovah; I have said -- to keep Thy words,
speaker: Narrator

text: I appeased Thy face with the whole heart, Favour me according to Thy saying.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have reckoned my ways, And turn back my feet unto Thy testimonies.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have made haste, And delayed not, to keep Thy commands.
speaker: Narrator

text: Cords of the wicked have surrounded me, Thy law I have not forgotten.
speaker: Narrator

text: At midnight I rise to give thanks to Thee, For the judgments of Thy righteousness.
speaker: Narrator

text: A companion I [am] to all who fear Thee, And to those keeping Thy precepts.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of Thy kindness, O Jehovah, the earth is full, Thy statutes teach Thou me!
speaker: Narrator

text: [Teth.] Good Thou didst with Thy servant, O Jehovah, According to Thy word.
speaker: Narrator

text: The goodness of reason and knowledge teach me, For in Thy commands I have believed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Before I am afflicted, I -- I am erring, And now Thy saying I have kept.
speaker: Narrator

text: Good Thou [art], and doing good, Teach me Thy statutes.
speaker: Narrator

text: Forged against me falsehood have the proud, I with the whole heart keep Thy precepts.
speaker: Narrator

text: Insensate as fat hath been their heart, I -- in Thy law I have delighted.
speaker: Narrator

text: Good for me that I have been afflicted, That I might learn Thy statutes.
speaker: Narrator

text: Better to me [is] the law of Thy mouth Than thousands of gold and silver!
speaker: Narrator

text: [Yod.] Thy hands made me and establish me, Cause me to understand, and I learn Thy commands.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those fearing Thee see me and rejoice, Because for Thy word I have hoped.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have known, O Jehovah, That righteous [are] Thy judgments, And [in] faithfulness Thou hast afflicted me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let, I pray Thee, Thy kindness be to comfort me, According to Thy saying to Thy servant.
speaker: Narrator

text: Meet me do Thy mercies, and I live, For Thy law [is] my delight.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ashamed are the proud, For [with] falsehood they dealt perversely with me. I meditate in Thy precepts.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those fearing Thee turn back to me, And those knowing Thy testimonies.
speaker: Narrator

text: My heart is perfect in Thy statutes, So that I am not ashamed.
speaker: Narrator

text: [Kaph.] Consumed for Thy salvation hath been my soul, For Thy word I have hoped.
speaker: Narrator

text: Consumed have been mine eyes for Thy word, Saying, `When doth it comfort me?'
speaker: Narrator

text: For I have been as a bottle in smoke, Thy statutes I have not forgotten.
speaker: Narrator

text: How many [are] the days of Thy servant? When dost Thou execute Against my pursuers judgment?
speaker: Narrator

text: The proud have digged for me pits, That [are] not according to Thy law.
speaker: Narrator

text: All Thy commands [are] faithfulness, [With] falsehood they have pursued me, Help Thou me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Almost consumed me on earth have they, And I -- I have not forsaken Thy precepts.
speaker: Narrator

text: According to Thy kindness quicken Thou me, And I keep the testimony of Thy mouth!
speaker: Narrator

text: [Lamed.] To the age, O Jehovah, Thy word is set up in the heavens.
speaker: Narrator

text: To all generations Thy faithfulness, Thou didst establish earth, and it standeth.
speaker: Narrator

text: According to Thine ordinances They have stood this day, for the whole [are] Thy servants.
speaker: Narrator

text: Unless Thy law [were] my delights, Then had I perished in mine affliction.
speaker: Narrator

text: To the age I forget not Thy precepts, For by them Thou hast quickened me.
speaker: Narrator

text: I [am] Thine, save Thou me, For Thy precepts I have sought.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy wicked waited for me to destroy me, Thy testimonies I understand.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of all perfection I have seen an end, Broad [is] Thy command -- exceedingly!
speaker: Narrator

text: [Mem.] O how I have loved Thy law! All the day it [is] my meditation.
speaker: Narrator

text: Than mine enemies Thy command maketh me wiser, For it [is] before me to the age.
speaker: Narrator

text: Above all my teachers I have acted wisely. For Thy testimonies [are] my meditation.
speaker: Narrator

text: Above elders I understand more, For Thy precepts I have kept.
speaker: Narrator

text: From every evil path I restrained my feet, So that I keep Thy word.
speaker: Narrator

text: From Thy judgments I turned not aside, For Thou -- Thou hast directed me.
speaker: Narrator

text: How sweet to my palate hath been Thy saying, Above honey to my mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text: From Thy precepts I have understanding, Therefore I have hated every false path!
speaker: Narrator

text: [Nun.] A lamp to my foot [is] Thy word, And a light to my path.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have sworn, and I confirm [it], To keep the judgments of Thy righteousness.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have been afflicted very much, O Jehovah, quicken me, according to Thy word.
speaker: Narrator

text: Free-will-offerings of my mouth, Accept, I pray Thee, O Jehovah, And Thy judgments teach Thou me.
speaker: Narrator

text: My soul [is] in my hand continually, And Thy law I have not forgotten.
speaker: Narrator

text: The wicked have laid a snare for me, And from thy precepts I wandered not.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have inherited Thy testimonies to the age, For the joy of my heart [are] they.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have inclined my heart To do Thy statutes, to the age -- [to] the end!
speaker: Narrator

text: [Samech.] Doubting ones I have hated, And Thy law I have loved.
speaker: Narrator

text: My hiding place and my shield [art] Thou, For Thy word I have hoped.
speaker: Narrator

text: Turn aside from me, ye evil-doers, And I keep the commands of my God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Sustain me according to Thy saying, And I live, and Thou puttest me not to shame Because of my hope.
speaker: Narrator
