text: Support Thou me, and I am saved, And I look on Thy statutes continually.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast trodden down All going astray from Thy statutes, For falsehood [is] their deceit.
speaker: Narrator

text: Dross! Thou hast caused to cease All the wicked of the earth; Therefore I have loved Thy testimonies.
speaker: Narrator

text: Trembled from Thy fear hath my flesh, And from Thy judgments I have been afraid!
speaker: Narrator

text: [Ain.] I have done judgment and righteousness, Leave me not to mine oppressors.
speaker: Narrator

text: Make sure Thy servant for good, Let not the proud oppress me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Mine eyes have been consumed for Thy salvation. And for the saying of Thy righteousness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do with Thy servant according to Thy kindness. And Thy statutes teach Thou me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy servant [am] I -- cause me to understand, And I know Thy testimonies.
speaker: Narrator

text: Time for Jehovah to work! they have made void Thy law.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore I have loved Thy commands Above gold -- even fine gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore all my appointments I have declared wholly right, Every path of falsehood I have hated!
speaker: Narrator

text: [Pe.] Wonderful [are] Thy testimonies, Therefore hath my soul kept them.
speaker: Narrator

text: The opening of Thy words enlighteneth, Instructing the simple.
speaker: Narrator

text: My mouth I have opened, yea, I pant, For, for Thy commands I have longed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Look unto me, and favour me, As customary to those loving Thy name.
speaker: Narrator

text: My steps establish by Thy saying, And any iniquity doth not rule over me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ransom me from the oppression of man, And I observe Thy precepts,
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy face cause to shine on Thy servant, And teach me Thy statutes.
speaker: Narrator

text: Rivulets of waters have come down mine eyes, Because they have not kept Thy law!
speaker: Narrator

text: [Tzade.] Righteous [art] Thou, O Jehovah, And upright [are] Thy judgments.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast appointed Thy testimonies, Righteous and exceeding faithful,
speaker: Narrator

text: Cut me off hath my zeal, For mine adversaries forgot Thy words.
speaker: Narrator

text: Tried [is] thy saying exceedingly, And Thy servant hath loved it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Small I [am], and despised, Thy precepts I have not forgotten.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy righteousness [is] righteousness to the age, And Thy law [is] truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Adversity and distress have found me, Thy commands [are] my delights.
speaker: Narrator

text: The righteousness of Thy testimonies [is] to Cause me to understand, and I live!
speaker: Narrator

text: [Koph.] I have called with the whole heart, Answer me, O Jehovah, Thy statutes I keep,
speaker: Narrator

text: I have called Thee, save Thou me, And I do keep Thy testimonies.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have gone forward in the dawn, and I cry, For Thy word I have hoped.
speaker: Narrator

text: Mine eyes have gone before the watches, To meditate in Thy saying.
speaker: Narrator

text: My voice hear, according to Thy kindness, Jehovah, according to Thy judgment quicken me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Near have been my wicked pursuers, From Thy law they have been far off.
speaker: Narrator

text: Near [art] Thou, O Jehovah, And all Thy commands [are] truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of old I have known Thy testimonies, That to the age Thou hast founded them!
speaker: Narrator

text: [Resh.] See my affliction, and deliver Thou me, For Thy law I have not forgotten.
speaker: Narrator

text: Plead my plea, and redeem me, According to Thy saying quicken me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Far from the wicked [is] salvation, For Thy statutes they have not sought.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy mercies [are] many, O Jehovah, According to Thy judgments quicken me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Many [are] my pursuers, and adversaries, From Thy testimonies I have not turned aside.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have seen treacherous ones, And grieve myself, Because Thy saying they have not kept.
speaker: Narrator

text: See, for thy precepts I have loved, Jehovah, According to Thy kindness quicken me.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sum of Thy word [is] truth, And to the age [is] every judgment of Thy righteousness!
speaker: Narrator

text: [Shin.] Princes have pursued me without cause, And because of Thy words was my heart afraid.
speaker: Narrator

text: I do rejoice concerning Thy saying, As one finding abundant spoil.
speaker: Narrator

text: Falsehood I have hated, yea I abominate [it], Thy law I have loved.
speaker: Narrator

text: Seven [times] in a day I have praised Thee, Because of the judgments of Thy righteousness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Abundant peace have those loving Thy law, And they have no stumbling-block.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have waited for Thy salvation, O Jehovah, And Thy commands I have done.
speaker: Narrator

text: Kept hath my soul Thy testimonies, And I do love them exceedingly.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have kept Thy precepts and Thy testimonies, For all my ways are before Thee!
speaker: Narrator

text: [Taw.] My loud cry cometh near before Thee, O Jehovah; According to Thy word cause me to understand.
speaker: Narrator

text: My supplication cometh in before Thee, According to Thy saying deliver Thou me.
speaker: Narrator

text: My lips do utter praise, For Thou dost teach me Thy statutes.
speaker: Narrator

text: My tongue doth sing of Thy saying, For all Thy commands [are] righteous.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy hand is for a help to me, For Thy commands I have chosen.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have longed for Thy salvation, O Jehovah, And Thy law [is] my delight.
speaker: Narrator

text: My soul liveth, and it doth praise Thee, And Thy judgments do help me.
speaker: Narrator

text: I wandered as a lost sheep, seek Thy servant, For Thy precepts I have not forgotten!
speaker: Narrator

text: A Song of the Ascents. Unto Jehovah in my distress I have called, And He answereth me.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Jehovah, deliver my soul from a lying lip, From a deceitful tongue!
speaker: Narrator

text: What doth He give to thee? And what doth He add to thee? O deceitful tongue!
speaker: Narrator

text: Sharp arrows of a mighty one, with broom-coals.
speaker: Narrator

text: Wo to me, for I have inhabited Mesech, I have dwelt with tents of Kedar.
speaker: Narrator

text: Too much hath my soul dwelt with him who is hating peace.
speaker: Narrator

text: I [am] peace, and when I speak they [are] for war!
speaker: Narrator

text: A Song of the Ascents. I lift up mine eyes unto the hills, Whence doth my help come?
speaker: Narrator

text: My help [is] from Jehovah, maker of heaven and earth,
speaker: Narrator

text: He suffereth not thy foot to be moved, Thy preserver slumbereth not.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lo, He slumbereth not, nor sleepeth, He who is preserving Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jehovah [is] thy preserver, Jehovah [is] thy shade on thy right hand,
speaker: Narrator

text: By day the sun doth not smite thee, Nor the moon by night.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jehovah preserveth thee from all evil, He doth preserve thy soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jehovah preserveth thy going out and thy coming in, From henceforth even unto the age!
speaker: Narrator

text: A Song of the Ascents, by David. I have rejoiced in those saying to me, `To the house of Jehovah we go.'
speaker: Narrator

text: Our feet have been standing in thy gates, O Jerusalem!
speaker: Narrator

text: Jerusalem -- the builded one -- [Is] as a city that is joined to itself together.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thither have tribes gone up, Tribes of Jah, companies of Israel, To give thanks to the name of Jehovah.
speaker: Narrator

text: For there have sat thrones of judgment, Thrones of the house of David.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ask ye the peace of Jerusalem, At rest are those loving thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Peace is in thy bulwark, rest in thy high places,
speaker: Narrator

text: For the sake of my brethren and my companions, Let me speak, I pray thee, `Peace [be] in thee.'
speaker: Narrator

text: For the sake of the house of Jehovah our God, I seek good for thee!
speaker: Narrator

text: A Song of the Ascents. Unto Thee I have lifted up mine eyes, O dweller in the heavens.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lo, as eyes of men-servants [Are] unto the hand of their masters, As eyes of a maid-servant [Are] unto the hand of her mistress, So [are] our eyes unto Jehovah our God, Till that He doth favour us.
speaker: Narrator

text: Favour us, O Jehovah, favour us, For greatly have we been filled with contempt,
speaker: Narrator

text: Greatly hath our soul been filled With the scorning of the easy ones, With the contempt of the arrogant!
speaker: Narrator

text: A Song of the Ascents, by David. Save [for] Jehovah -- who hath been for us, (Pray, let Israel say),
speaker: Narrator

text: Save [for] Jehovah -- who hath been for us, In the rising up of man against us,
speaker: Narrator

text: Then alive they had swallowed us up, In the burning of their anger against us,
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the waters had overflowed us, The stream passed over our soul,
speaker: Narrator

text: Then passed over our soul had the proud waters.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed [is] Jehovah who hath not given us, A prey to their teeth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Our soul as a bird hath escaped from a snare of fowlers, The snare was broken, and we have escaped.
speaker: Narrator

text: Our help [is] in the name of Jehovah, Maker of the heavens and earth!
speaker: Narrator

text: A Song of the Ascents. Those trusting in Jehovah [are] as Mount Zion, It is not moved -- to the age it abideth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jerusalem! mountains [are] round about her, And Jehovah [is] round about His people, From henceforth even unto the age.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the rod of wickedness resteth not On the lot of the righteous, That the righteous put not forth on iniquity their hands.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do good, O Jehovah, to the good, And to the upright in their hearts.
speaker: Narrator

text: As to those turning [to] their crooked ways, Jehovah causeth them to go with workers of iniquity. Peace on Israel!
speaker: Narrator

text: A Song of the Ascents. In Jehovah's turning back [to] the captivity of Zion, We have been as dreamers.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then filled [with] laughter is our mouth, And our tongue [with] singing, Then do they say among nations, `Jehovah did great things with these.'
speaker: Narrator

text: Jehovah did great things with us, We have been joyful.
speaker: Narrator

text: Turn again, O Jehovah, [to] our captivity, As streams in the south.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those sowing in tears, with singing do reap,
speaker: Narrator

text: Whoso goeth on and weepeth, Bearing the basket of seed, Surely cometh in with singing, bearing his sheaves!
speaker: Narrator

text: A Song of the Ascents, by Solomon. If Jehovah doth not build the house, In vain have its builders laboured at it, If Jehovah doth not watch a city, In vain hath a watchman waked.
speaker: Narrator

text: Vain for you who are rising early, Who delay sitting, eating the bread of griefs, So He giveth to His beloved one sleep.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lo, an inheritance of Jehovah [are] sons, A reward [is] the fruit of the womb.
speaker: Narrator

text: As arrows in the hand of a mighty one, So [are] the sons of the young men.
speaker: Narrator

text: O the happiness of the man Who hath filled his quiver with them, They are not ashamed, For they speak with enemies in the gate!
speaker: Narrator

text: A Song of the Ascents. O the happiness of every one fearing Jehovah, Who is walking in His ways.
speaker: Narrator

text: The labour of thy hands thou surely eatest, Happy [art] thou, and good [is] to thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy wife [is] as a fruitful vine in the sides of thy house, Thy sons as olive plants around thy table.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lo, surely thus is the man blessed who is fearing Jehovah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jehovah doth bless thee out of Zion, Look, then, on the good of Jerusalem, All the days of thy life,
speaker: Narrator

text: And see the sons of thy sons! Peace on Israel!
speaker: Narrator

text: A Song of the Ascents. Often they distressed me from my youth, Pray, let Israel say:
speaker: Narrator

text: Often they distressed me from my youth, Yet they have not prevailed over me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Over my back have ploughers ploughed, They have made long their furrows.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jehovah [is] righteous, He hath cut asunder cords of the wicked.
speaker: Narrator

text: Confounded and turn backward do all hating Zion.
speaker: Narrator

text: They are as grass of the roofs, That before it was drawn out withereth,
speaker: Narrator

text: That hath not filled the hand of a reaper, And the bosom of a binder of sheaves.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the passers by have not said, `The blessing of Jehovah [is] on you, We blessed you in the Name of Jehovah!'
speaker: Narrator

text: A Song of the Ascents. From depths I have called Thee, Jehovah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lord, hearken to my voice, Thine ears are attentive to the voice of my supplications.
speaker: Narrator

text: If iniquities Thou dost observe, O Lord, who doth stand?
speaker: Narrator

text: But with Thee [is] forgiveness, that Thou mayest be feared.
speaker: Narrator

text: I hoped [for] Jehovah -- hoped hath my soul, And for His word I have waited.
speaker: Narrator

text: My soul [is] for the Lord, More than those watching for morning, Watching for morning!
speaker: Narrator

text: Israel doth wait on Jehovah, For with Jehovah [is] kindness, And abundant with Him [is] redemption.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He doth redeem Israel from all his iniquities!
speaker: Narrator

text: A Song of the Ascents, by David. Jehovah, my heart hath not been haughty, Nor have mine eyes been high, Nor have I walked in great things, And in things too wonderful for me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Have I not compared, and kept silent my soul, As a weaned one by its mother? As a weaned one by me [is] my soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: Israel doth wait on Jehovah, From henceforth, and unto the age!
speaker: Narrator

text: A Song of the Ascents. Remember, Jehovah, for David, all his afflictions.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who hath sworn to Jehovah. He hath vowed to the Mighty One of Jacob:
speaker: Narrator

text: `If I enter into the tent of my house, If I go up on the couch of my bed,
speaker: Narrator

text: If I give sleep to mine eyes, To mine eyelids -- slumber,
speaker: Narrator

text: Till I do find a place for Jehovah, Tabernacles for the Mighty One of Jacob.
speaker: Narrator

text: `Lo, we have heard it in Ephratah, We have found it in the fields of the forest.
speaker: Narrator

text: We come in to His tabernacles, We bow ourselves at His footstool.
speaker: Narrator

text: Arise, O Jehovah, to Thy rest, Thou, and the ark of Thy strength,
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy priests do put on righteousness, And Thy pious ones cry aloud.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the sake of David Thy servant, Turn not back the face of Thine anointed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jehovah hath sworn truth to David, He turneth not back from it: Of the fruit of thy body, I set on the throne for thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: If thy sons keep My covenant, And My testimonies that I teach them, Their sons also for ever and ever, Do sit on the throne for thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Jehovah hath fixed on Zion, He hath desired [it] for a seat to Himself,
speaker: Narrator

text: This [is] My rest for ever and ever, Here do I sit, for I have desired it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Her provision I greatly bless, Her needy ones I satisfy [with] bread,
speaker: Narrator

text: And her priests I clothe [with] salvation, And her pious ones do sing aloud.
speaker: Narrator

text: There I cause to spring up a horn for David, I have arranged a lamp for Mine anointed.
speaker: Narrator

text: His enemies I do clothe [with] shame, And upon him doth his crown flourish!
speaker: Narrator

text: A Song of the Ascents, by David. Lo, how good and how pleasant The dwelling of brethren -- even together!
speaker: Narrator

text: As the good oil on the head, Coming down on the beard, the beard of Aaron, That cometh down on the skirt of his robes,
speaker: Narrator

text: As dew of Hermon -- That cometh down on hills of Zion, For there Jehovah commanded the blessing -- Life unto the age!
speaker: Narrator

text: A Song of the Ascents. Lo, bless Jehovah, all servants of Jehovah, Who are standing in the house of Jehovah by night.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lift up your hands [in] the sanctuary, And bless ye Jehovah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jehovah doth bless thee out of Zion, The maker of the heavens and earth!
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise ye Jah! Praise ye the name of Jehovah, Praise, ye servants of Jehovah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Who are standing in the house of Jehovah, In the courts of the house of our God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise ye Jah! for Jehovah [is] good, Sing praise to His name, for [it is] pleasant.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Jacob hath Jah chosen for Himself, Israel for His peculiar treasure.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I have known that great [is] Jehovah, Yea, our Lord [is] above all gods.
speaker: Narrator

text: All that Jehovah pleased He hath done, In the heavens and in earth, In the seas and all deep places,
speaker: Narrator

text: Causing vapours to ascend from the end of the earth, Lightnings for the rain He hath made, Bringing forth wind from His treasures.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who smote the first-born of Egypt, From man unto beast.
speaker: Narrator

text: He sent tokens and wonders into thy midst, O Egypt, On Pharaoh and on all his servants.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who smote many nations, and slew strong kings,
speaker: Narrator

text: Even Sihon king of the Amorite, And Og king of Bashan, And all kingdoms of Canaan.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He gave their land an inheritance, An inheritance to Israel His people,
speaker: Narrator

text: O Jehovah, Thy name [is] to the age, O Jehovah, Thy memorial to all generations.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Jehovah doth judge His people, And for His servants comforteth Himself.
speaker: Narrator

text: The idols of the nations [are] silver and gold, Work of the hands of man.
speaker: Narrator

text: A mouth they have, and they speak not, Eyes they have, and they see not,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ears they have, and they give not ear, Nose -- there is no breath in their mouth!
speaker: Narrator

text: Like them are their makers, Every one who is trusting in them.
speaker: Narrator

text: O house of Israel, bless ye Jehovah, O house of Aaron, bless ye Jehovah,
speaker: Narrator

text: O house of Levi, bless ye Jehovah, Those fearing Jehovah, bless ye Jehovah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed [is] Jehovah from Zion, Inhabiting Jerusalem -- praise ye Jah!
speaker: Narrator

text: Give ye thanks to Jehovah, For good, for to the age [is] His kindness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Give ye thanks to the God of gods, For to the age [is] His kindness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Give ye thanks to the Lord of lords, For to the age [is] His kindness.
speaker: Narrator

text: To Him doing great wonders by Himself alone, For to the age [is] His kindness.
speaker: Narrator

text: To Him making the heavens by understanding, For to the age [is] His kindness.
speaker: Narrator

text: To Him spreading the earth over the waters, For to the age [is] His kindness.
speaker: Narrator

text: To Him making great lights, For to the age [is] His kindness.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sun to rule by day, For to the age [is] His kindness.
speaker: Narrator

text: The moon and stars to rule by night, For to the age [is] His kindness.
speaker: Narrator

text: To Him smiting Egypt in their first-born, For to the age [is] His kindness.
speaker: Narrator

text: And bringing forth Israel from their midst, For to the age [is] His kindness.
speaker: Narrator

text: By a strong hand, and a stretched-out-arm, For to the age [is] His kindness.
speaker: Narrator

text: To Him cutting the sea of Suph into parts, For to the age [is] His kindness,
speaker: Narrator

text: And caused Israel to pass through its midst, For to the age [is] His kindness,
speaker: Narrator

text: And shook out Pharaoh and his force in the sea of Suph, For to the age [is] His kindness.
speaker: Narrator

text: To Him leading His people in a wilderness, For to the age [is] His kindness.
speaker: Narrator

text: To Him smiting great kings, For to the age [is] His kindness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yea, He doth slay honourable kings, For to the age [is] His kindness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Even Sihon king of the Amorite, For to the age [is] His kindness.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Og king of Bashan, For to the age [is] His kindness.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He gave their land for inheritance, For to the age [is] His kindness.
speaker: Narrator

text: An inheritance to Israel His servant, For to the age [is] His kindness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who in our lowliness hath remembered us, For to the age [is] His kindness.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He delivereth us from our adversaries, For to the age [is] His kindness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Giving food to all flesh, For to the age [is] His kindness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Give ye thanks to the God of the heavens, For to the age [is] His kindness!
speaker: Narrator

text: By rivers of Babylon -- There we did sit, Yea, we wept when we remembered Zion.
speaker: Narrator

text: On willows in its midst we hung our harps.
speaker: Narrator

text: For there our captors asked us the words of a song, And our spoilers -- joy: `Sing ye to us of a song of Zion.'
speaker: Narrator

text: How do we sing the song of Jehovah, On the land of a stranger?
speaker: Narrator

text: If I forget thee, O Jerusalem, my right hand forgetteth!
speaker: Narrator

text: My tongue doth cleave to my palate, If I do not remember thee, If I do not exalt Jerusalem above my chief joy.
speaker: Narrator

text: Remember, Jehovah, for the sons of Edom, The day of Jerusalem, Those saying, `Rase, rase to its foundation!'
speaker: Narrator

text: O daughter of Babylon, O destroyed one, O the happiness of him who repayeth to thee thy deed, That thou hast done to us.
speaker: Narrator

text: O the happiness of him who doth seize, And hath dashed thy sucklings on the rock!
speaker: Narrator

text: By David. I confess Thee, with all my heart, Before the gods I do praise Thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: I bow myself toward Thy holy temple, And I confess Thy name, For Thy kindness, and for Thy truth, For Thou hast made great Thy saying above all Thy name.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the day I called, when Thou dost answer me, Thou dost strengthen me in my soul [with] strength.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Jehovah, all kings of earth confess Thee, When they have heard the sayings of Thy mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they sing in the ways of Jehovah, For great [is] the honour of Jehovah.
speaker: Narrator

text: For high [is] Jehovah, and the lowly He seeth, And the haughty from afar He knoweth.
speaker: Narrator

text: If I walk in the midst of distress Thou quickenest me, Against the anger of mine enemies Thou sendest forth Thy hand, And Thy right hand doth save me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jehovah doth perfect for me, O Jehovah, Thy kindness [is] to the age, The works of Thy hands let not fall!
speaker: Narrator

text: To the Overseer. -- A Psalm by David. Jehovah, Thou hast searched me, and knowest.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou -- Thou hast known my sitting down, And my rising up, Thou hast attended to my thoughts from afar.
speaker: Narrator

text: My path and my couch Thou hast fanned, And [with] all my ways hast been acquainted.
speaker: Narrator

text: For there is not a word in my tongue, Lo, O Jehovah, Thou hast known it all!
speaker: Narrator

text: Behind and before Thou hast besieged me, And Thou dost place on me Thy hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: Knowledge too wonderful for me, It hath been set on high, I am not able for it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whither do I go from Thy Spirit? And whither from Thy face do I flee?
speaker: Narrator

text: If I ascend the heavens -- there Thou [art], And spread out a couch in Sheol, lo, Thee!
speaker: Narrator

text: I take the wings of morning, I dwell in the uttermost part of the sea,
speaker: Narrator

text: Also there Thy hand doth lead me, And Thy right hand doth hold me.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I say, `Surely darkness bruiseth me, Then night [is] light to me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also darkness hideth not from Thee, And night as day shineth, as [is] darkness so [is] light.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Thou -- Thou hast possessed my reins, Thou dost cover me in my mother's belly.
speaker: Narrator

text: I confess Thee, because that [with] wonders I have been distinguished. Wonderful [are] Thy works, And my soul is knowing [it] well.
speaker: Narrator

text: My substance was not hid from Thee, When I was made in secret, Curiously wrought in the lower part of earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Mine unformed substance Thine eyes saw, And on Thy book all of them are written, The days they were formed -- And not one among them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And to me how precious have been Thy thoughts, O God, how great hath been their sum!
speaker: Narrator

text: I recount them! than the sand they are more, I have waked, and I am still with Thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Dost Thou slay, O God, the wicked? Then, men of blood, turn aside from me!
speaker: Narrator

text: Who exchange Thee for wickedness, Lifted up to vanity [are] Thine enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not I hate, Jehovah, those hating Thee? And with Thy withstanders grieve myself?
speaker: Narrator

text: [With] perfect hatred I have hated them, Enemies they have become to me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Search me, O God, and know my heart, Try me, and know my thoughts,
speaker: Narrator

text: And see if a grievous way be in me, And lead me in a way age-during!
speaker: Narrator

text: To the Overseer. -- A Psalm of David. Deliver me, O Jehovah, from an evil man, From one of violence Thou keepest me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who have devised evils in the heart, All the day they assemble [for] wars.
speaker: Narrator

text: They sharpened their tongue as a serpent, Poison of an adder [is] under their lips. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Preserve me, Jehovah, from the hands of the wicked, From one of violence Thou keepest me, Who have devised to overthrow my steps.
speaker: Narrator

text: The proud hid a snare for me -- and cords, They spread a net by the side of the path, Snares they have set for me. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have said to Jehovah, `My God [art] Thou, Hear, Jehovah, the voice of my supplications.'
speaker: Narrator

text: O Jehovah, my Lord, strength of my salvation, Thou hast covered my head in the day of armour.
speaker: Narrator

text: Grant not, O Jehovah, the desires of the wicked, His wicked device bring not forth, They are high. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: The chief of my surrounders, The perverseness of their lips covereth them.
speaker: Narrator

text: They cause to fall on themselves burning coals, Into fire He doth cast them, Into deep pits -- they arise not.
speaker: Narrator

text: A talkative man is not established in the earth, One of violence -- evil hunteth to overflowing.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have known that Jehovah doth execute The judgment of the afflicted, The judgment of the needy.
speaker: Narrator

text: Only -- the righteous give thanks to Thy name, The upright do dwell with Thy presence!
speaker: Narrator

text: A Psalm, by David. O Jehovah, I have called Thee, haste to me, Give ear [to] my voice when I call to Thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: My prayer is prepared -- incense before Thee, The lifting up of my hands -- the evening present.
speaker: Narrator

text: Set, O Jehovah, a watch for my mouth, Watch Thou over the door of my lips.
speaker: Narrator

text: Incline not my heart to an evil thing, To do habitually actions in wickedness, With men working iniquity, Yea, I eat not of their pleasant things.
speaker: Narrator

text: The righteous doth beat me [in] kindness. And doth reprove me, Oil of the head my head disalloweth not, For still my prayer [is] about their vexations.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their judges have been released by the sides of a rock, And they have heard my sayings, For they have been pleasant.
speaker: Narrator

text: As one tilling and ripping up in the land, Have our bones been scattered at the command of Saul.
speaker: Narrator

text: But to Thee, O Jehovah, my Lord, [are] mine eyes, In Thee I have trusted, Make not bare my soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: Keep me from the gin they laid for me, Even snares of workers of iniquity.
speaker: Narrator

text: The wicked fall in their nets together, till I pass over!
speaker: Narrator

text: An Instruction of David, a Prayer when he is in the cave. My voice [is] unto Jehovah, I cry, My voice [is] unto Jehovah, I entreat grace.
speaker: Narrator

text: I pour forth before Him my meditation, My distress before Him I declare.
speaker: Narrator

text: When my spirit hath been feeble in me, Then Thou hast known my path; In the way [in] which I walk, They have hid a snare for me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Looking on the right hand -- and seeing, And I have none recognizing; Perished hath refuge from me, There is none inquiring for my soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have cried unto thee, O Jehovah, I have said, `Thou [art] my refuge, My portion in the land of the living.'
speaker: Narrator

text: Attend Thou unto my loud cry, For I have become very low, Deliver Thou me from my pursuers, For they have been stronger than I.
speaker: Narrator

text: Bring forth from prison my soul to confess Thy name, The righteous do compass me about, When Thou conferrest benefits upon me!
speaker: Narrator

text: A Psalm of David. O Jehovah, hear my prayer, Give ear unto my supplications, In Thy faithfulness answer me -- in Thy righteousness.
speaker: Narrator

text: And enter not into judgment with Thy servant, For no one living is justified before Thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: For an enemy hath pursued my soul, He hath bruised to the earth my life, He hath caused me to dwell in dark places, As the dead of old.
speaker: Narrator

text: And my spirit in me is become feeble, Within me is my heart become desolate.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have remembered days of old, I have meditated on all Thine acts, On the work of Thy hand I muse.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have spread forth my hands unto Thee, My soul [is] as a weary land for Thee. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Haste, answer me, O Jehovah, My spirit hath been consumed, Hide not Thou Thy face from me, Or I have been compared with those going down [to] the pit.
speaker: Narrator

text: Cause me to hear in the morning Thy kindness, For in Thee I have trusted, Cause me to know the way that I go, For unto Thee I have lifted up my soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: Deliver me from mine enemies, O Jehovah, Near Thee I am covered.
speaker: Narrator

text: Teach me to do Thy good pleasure, For Thou [art] my God -- Thy Spirit [is] good, Lead me into a land of uprightness.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Thy name's sake O Jehovah, Thou dost quicken me, In Thy righteousness, Thou bringest out from distress my soul,
speaker: Narrator

text: And in Thy kindness cuttest off mine enemies, And hast destroyed all the adversaries of my soul, For I [am] Thy servant!
speaker: Narrator

text: By David. Blessed [is] Jehovah my rock, who is teaching My hands for war, my fingers for battle.
speaker: Narrator

text: My kind one, and my bulwark, My tower, and my deliverer, My shield, and in whom I have trusted, Who is subduing my people under me!
speaker: Narrator

text: Jehovah, what [is] man that Thou knowest him? Son of man, that Thou esteemest him?
speaker: Narrator

text: Man to vanity hath been like, His days [are] as a shadow passing by.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jehovah, incline Thy heavens and come down, Strike against mountains, and they smoke.
speaker: Narrator

text: Send forth lightning, and scatter them, Send forth Thine arrows, and trouble them,
speaker: Narrator

text: Send forth Thy hand from on high, Free me, and deliver me from many waters, From the hand of sons of a stranger,
speaker: Narrator

text: Because their mouth hath spoken vanity, And their right hand [is] a right hand of falsehood.
speaker: Narrator

text: O God, a new song I sing to Thee, On a psaltery of ten strings I sing praise to Thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who is giving deliverance to kings, Who is freeing David His servant from the sword of evil.
speaker: Narrator

text: Free me, and deliver me From the hand of sons of a stranger, Because their mouth hath spoken vanity, And their right hand [is] a right hand of falsehood,
speaker: Narrator

text: Because our sons [are] as plants, Becoming great in their youth, Our daughters as hewn stones, Polished -- the likeness of a palace,
speaker: Narrator

text: Our garners [are] full, bringing out from kind to kind, Our flocks are bringing forth thousands, Ten thousands in our out-places,
speaker: Narrator

text: Our oxen are carrying, there is no breach, And there is no outgoing, And there is no crying in our broad places.
speaker: Narrator

text: O the happiness of the people that is thus, O the happiness of the people whose God [is] Jehovah!
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise by David. I exalt Thee, my God, O king, And bless Thy name to the age and for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Every day do I bless Thee, And praise Thy name to the age and for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Great [is] Jehovah, and praised greatly, And of His greatness there is no searching.
speaker: Narrator

text: Generation to generation praiseth Thy works, And Thy mighty acts they declare.
speaker: Narrator

text: The honour -- the glory of Thy majesty, And the matters of Thy wonders I declare.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the strength of Thy fearful acts they tell, And Thy greatness I recount.
speaker: Narrator

text: The memorial of the abundance of Thy goodness they send forth. And Thy righteousness they sing.
speaker: Narrator

text: Gracious and merciful [is] Jehovah, Slow to anger, and great in kindness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Good [is] Jehovah to all, And His mercies [are] over all His works.
speaker: Narrator

text: Confess Thee O Jehovah, do all Thy works, And Thy saints do bless Thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: The honour of Thy kingdom they tell, And [of] Thy might they speak,
speaker: Narrator

text: To make known to sons of men His mighty acts, The honour of the majesty of His kingdom.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy kingdom [is] a kingdom of all ages, And Thy dominion [is] in all generations.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jehovah is supporting all who are falling, And raising up all who are bowed down.
speaker: Narrator

text: The eyes of all unto Thee do look, And Thou art giving to them their food in its season,
speaker: Narrator

text: Opening Thy hand, and satisfying The desire of every living thing.
speaker: Narrator

text: Righteous [is] Jehovah in all His ways, And kind in all His works.
speaker: Narrator

text: Near [is] Jehovah to all those calling Him, To all who call Him in truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: The desire of those fearing Him He doth, And their cry He heareth, and saveth them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jehovah preserveth all those loving Him, And all the wicked He destroyeth.
speaker: Narrator

text: The praise of Jehovah my mouth speaketh, And all flesh doth bless His holy name, To the age and for ever!
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise ye Jah! Praise, O my soul, Jehovah.
speaker: Narrator

text: I praise Jehovah during my life, I sing praise to my God while I exist.
speaker: Narrator

text: Trust not in princes -- in a son of man, For he hath no deliverance.
speaker: Narrator

text: His spirit goeth forth, he returneth to his earth, In that day have his thoughts perished.
speaker: Narrator

text: O the happiness of him Who hath the God of Jacob for his help, His hope [is] on Jehovah his God,
speaker: Narrator

text: Making the heavens and earth, The sea and all that [is] in them, Who is keeping truth to the age,
speaker: Narrator

text: Doing judgment for the oppressed, Giving bread to the hungry.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jehovah is loosing the prisoners, Jehovah is opening (the eyes of) the blind, Jehovah is raising the bowed down, Jehovah is loving the righteous,
speaker: Narrator

text: Jehovah is preserving the strangers, The fatherless and widow He causeth to stand, And the way of the wicked He turneth upside down.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jehovah doth reign to the age, Thy God, O Zion, to generation and generation, Praise ye Jah!
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise ye Jah! For [it is] good to praise our God, For pleasant -- comely [is] praise.
speaker: Narrator

text: Building Jerusalem [is] Jehovah, The driven away of Israel He gathereth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who is giving healing to the broken of heart, And is binding up their griefs.
speaker: Narrator

text: Appointing the number of the stars, To all them He giveth names.
speaker: Narrator

text: Great [is] our Lord, and abundant in power, Of His understanding there is no narration.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jehovah is causing the meek to stand, Making low the wicked unto the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Answer ye to Jehovah with thanksgiving, Sing ye to our God with a harp.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who is covering the heavens with clouds, Who is preparing for the earth rain, Who is causing grass to spring up [on] mountains,
speaker: Narrator

text: Giving to the beast its food, To the young of the ravens that call.
speaker: Narrator

text: Not in the might of the horse doth He delight, Not in the legs of a man is He pleased.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jehovah is pleased with those fearing Him, With those waiting for His kindness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Glorify, O Jerusalem, Jehovah, Praise thy God, O Zion.
speaker: Narrator

text: For He did strengthen the bars of thy gates, He hath blessed thy sons in thy midst.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who is making thy border peace, [With] the fat of wheat He satisfieth Thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who is sending forth His saying [on] earth, Very speedily doth His word run.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who is giving snow like wool, Hoar-frost as ashes He scattereth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Casting forth His ice like morsels, Before His cold who doth stand?
speaker: Narrator

text: He sendeth forth His word and melteth them, He causeth His wind to blow -- the waters flow.
speaker: Narrator

text: Declaring His words to Jacob, His statutes and His judgments to Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: He hath not done so to any nation, As to judgments, they have not known them. Praise ye Jah!
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise ye Jah! Praise ye Jehovah from the heavens, Praise ye Him in high places.
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise ye Him, all His messengers, Praise ye Him, all His hosts.
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise ye Him, sun and moon, Praise ye Him, all stars of light.
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise ye Him, heavens of heavens, And ye waters that are above the heavens.
speaker: Narrator

text: They do praise the name of Jehovah, For He commanded, and they were created.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He establisheth them for ever to the age, A statute He gave, and they pass not over.
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise ye Jehovah from the earth, Dragons and all deeps,
speaker: Narrator

text: Fire and hail, snow and vapour, Whirlwind doing His word;
speaker: Narrator

text: The mountains and all heights, Fruit tree, and all cedars,
speaker: Narrator

text: The wild beast, and all cattle, Creeping thing, and winged bird,
speaker: Narrator

text: Kings of earth, and all peoples, Chiefs, and all judges of earth,
speaker: Narrator

text: Young men, and also maidens, Aged men, with youths,
speaker: Narrator

text: They praise the name of Jehovah, For His name alone hath been set on high, His honour [is] above earth and heavens.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He exalteth the horn of His people, The praise of all His saints, Of the sons of Israel, a people near Him. Praise ye Jah!
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise ye Jah! Sing ye to Jehovah a new song, His praise in an assembly of saints.
speaker: Narrator

text: Israel doth rejoice in his Maker, Sons of Zion do joy in their king.
speaker: Narrator

text: They praise His name in a dance, With timbrel and harp sing praise to Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Jehovah is pleased with His people, He beautifieth the humble with salvation.
speaker: Narrator

text: Exult do saints in honour, They sing aloud on their beds.
speaker: Narrator

text: The exaltation of God [is] in their throat, And a two-edged sword in their hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: To do vengeance among nations, Punishments among the peoples.
speaker: Narrator

text: To bind their kings with chains, And their honoured ones with fetters of iron,
speaker: Narrator

text: To do among them the judgment written, An honour it [is] for all his saints. Praise ye Jah!
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise ye Jah! Praise ye God in His holy place, Praise Him in the expanse of His strength.
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise Him in His mighty acts, Praise Him according to the abundance of His greatness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise Him with blowing of trumpet, Praise Him with psaltery and harp.
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise Him with timbrel and dance, Praise Him with stringed instruments and organ.
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise Him with cymbals of sounding, Praise Him with cymbals of shouting.
speaker: Narrator

text: All that doth breathe doth praise Jah! Praise ye Jah!
speaker: Narrator
